The internet charge for the room was $12 and it was not wireless. I would say the plus is that it is very close to the airport and Sea World. For a Hilton property, I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “An okay resort”
Reviews.Author: samara33
Reviews.Content: This resort was okay. $8.00 for 10 minutes to use intranet is a bit cheeky. Rooms were spacious but a bit dated. Our room was located a fair distance from the reception and we werent offered any assistance with our bags. The staff seemed disinterested and unfriendly which is surprising compared to other hotels we have stayed at in the US. The pool area was great and the food in the restauant albeit expensive was very nice (you didnt really have any other choice as hotel not located in walking distance of other restaurants).

Reviews.Title: “WALL OF MOLD MADE ME ILL”
Reviews.Author: lisalaw
Reviews.Content: I can't find anything good to say about this hotel. It is out in the middle of nowhere with nothing within walking distance. We were forced to get room service and paid $50 for breakfast for 2. I started getting sick on the 3rd day. I thought it was just an allergy from pollen. I kept feeling worse each day. Ahh-Haa! I found the source of the allergy on the last night there.... Green, White and black fuzzy thick mold all the way from the floor about 4 feet up the wall. I felt better the first morning after I returned to Michigan. This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel. It should not be moldy! TV sucked as well. No channels worth watching and no movie channels unless you order a movie. Would NOT recommend this place. Go to Pacific Beach. Much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice looking aged in places, expensive parking, slow internet, no HBO”
Reviews.Author: BritGuyUSA
Reviews.Content: Hotel consists of a tower and some condo style rooms. Stopping in building 500 we have a top floor condo room. Room itself is very nice, fridge, microwave, large flatscreen tv, balcony with garden view. Seems strange, but no HBO - i guess they want you to spend the $16 on a movie instead. The walls in the hallway could do with a touch of paint in places and the tiled floor areas at both ends of the building were dirty. There is no buffet for breakfast and the coupons are good or a continental breakfast which is very limited in what you can get. Otherwise prices seem to be standard. Hotel grounds are very nice as is the pool area. It is heated, but all that really means is that it is not cold, so its too cold to be using this time of year. Happy hour at the olive is great, cheep drinks and food too. The pizza we had last night was good and was much larger than expected for the $10. Parking: i dont know why they are charging people so much for parking... Its not like people are going to come here witout a car - just seems like a hidden fee. This s why they get a low rating in value for money. Overall, nice place and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING in every way!”
Reviews.Author: AuOphir
Reviews.Content: We went down to San Diego to see the Packers vs. Chargers game, and had such a wonderful weekend! The staff at this hotel are completely amazing; the room service was stellar and the cuisine in the restaurant was beyond compare. It would be impossible to find enough superlatives to describe the quality of our stay. Chef Jimmy and his staff provided the most wonderful dinner (pumpkin ravioli, a creme brulee trio) the night before the game! After the game, we treated ourselves to room service, and enjoyed far too much food (pizza margherita, a chicken sandwich, bruschetta, etc.) served with excellent care. I cannot give a high enough recommendation for this hotel; needless to say, I will be back many times, if this is any indication of how guests are treated at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip RUINED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A
Reviews.Content: We will never stay at this location again. This trip was for our wedding anniversary and recovering from extensive cancer therapy. Fire alarm went off at night and it was laughed off as a prank. No emergency services were dispatched when there was smoke coming in through our bathroom vent. The restaurant on site had no menu posted. The food was horrible and over priced. The concierge was not supportive in our inquiries to certain attractions. He acted as if were interrupting "his day!" The front desk help were nice but when we mentioned our displeasure or concern - no- solutions were given. The young lady in the coffee shop very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Location, Worst Stay at a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ScottB68
Reviews.Content: So, I take these reviews seriously and try my best to guide you all with all of the facts....Here's our story during our Nov stay at the San Diego Hilton Resorts.....Start with the positives....Front desk staff was awesome, great, friendly and fast check in.....Location is great, close to Sea World, Old Town and a couple of parks. Room in the 200 building was great, well appointed. Here is the Bad.....we checked in and paid with Hilton Points....Hotel was 95% full with a church group and the noise was terrible - until 1 am each morning.....No control and no sleep until 1 am each night....called the front desk and security checked but noise continued. Next, 28 bucks a day for self parking is a joke - absolute rip off and I had to part on the other side of the complex and walk.......Based on the noise and the parking, the pros outweigh the cons....Finally, 50,000 HHonors points is too high.... Large groups, adults need to be the adults and manage your kids. Hilton, correct the parking situation.....28 bucks is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome housekeeping staff”
Reviews.Author: 853jlb123
Reviews.Content: Can't really go wrong with a Hilton. I was on a business trip in and out in three days. I usually don't write reviews but I just had to in this case. The staff was very friendly and accommodating; however, Rosario in Housekeeping was fabulous - so friendly, polite and you can just tell "first class service runs in her blood."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience overall”
Reviews.Author: kevatotts
Reviews.Content: TC and William front desk agents very helpful and professional. Give them a raise. Room attendants were very acommodating as well. Restaurant service was just ok. Food was excellent but very limited menu. Loved our room 503 with great view of mission bay and Sea World. I will recommend this hotel to family and friends. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Colleen C
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel way too expensive. The dining room cost us $45 for breakfast and $100 for dinner for just two of us. The parking fee was hard to swallow and I've never stayed at a hotel where there was not a computer for guests to use. When we tried to get our discount tickets for the zoo, no one at the front counter could help us, and we didn't want to pay to go online and try to find it ourselves. Finally Patricia from the giftshop (bless her) found the passes on HER computer and allowed us to purchase and print them. Is it Hilton policy to charge for internet use? If so, we will steer clear of Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Yeh, its a Hilton...”
Reviews.Author: Pfwag
Reviews.Content: and you can't go too wrong with a Hilton and this one is a quaint older but sprawling property that was probably a happening place in it its day. Think of the big-band era... I "had" to go out for a convention and my wife wasn't going to let me go alone. We stayed in one of the 2 Queen beds, ground floor rooms in the Villa Bayview for 4 nights. A very nice and big room. It had a minibar with a small refrigerator and microwave. The "bayview" is somewhat diagonal and is, of course, of the bay not the ocean. However, it was nice to be able to walk out of the room on the practically immaculate grounds. The room had a very large HDTV. No free airport shuttle but they do have one that will take you to Sea World (a VERY long walk away) or historic Old Town. I don't know where else. As others have noted, very helpful staff and lots of on-site activities. And yes, the parking was $28/day and is a rip off. This facility was built 50 (?) years ago and isn't anywhere near downtown and all the expensive parking and is ground parking around the various buildings, not in an expensive parking garage. I don't stay in Hiltons that much but have about a million business flier miles so travel more than most. I can't ever remember ever paying $28 for parking, including at a couple 5 star rated places (this one is probably 4 star.). Internet access is $12/day. And the taxes on a $195/night room were also $24.48/night. But it is a Hilton....

Reviews.Title: “This is a run down "resort" and should not be a Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Longmeadow15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on points (120,000+ for two nights) and not do that again. A waste of points as other Hiltons in the area are less expensive. The room was dated and had an odor and this was a higher priced bay view deluxe. Thd patio screen door was falling off and thd patio curtains were falling off. There was trash and left over room service in the hall for days. I had to call at 4 because my room was not maid up. The pool area was unmanned and no where to get a drink or lunch at the "resort" pool. The chaises were mostly broken and pool towels were never available. I've stayed at both downtown Hiltons and they are much better quality and service. I left here and went to the Hotel Del Coronado. Now that's a resort. I wish I knew better as you do now do I didn't waste my valuable points!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Moore1818
Reviews.Content: We originally booked two queens (only room available upon booking) with the hopes of getting a king upon arrival. The staff was awesome, offering us a suite upgrade! Thanks T.C.! You were the cherry on top of our romantic weekend! Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fred A
Reviews.Content: Had a GREAT experience at this Hilton! It started with the help of William and T.C. from the time we checked in. Also had great customer service from the entire staff, as well as Wolfe in the boat rental area. Next trip to San Diego is a must to book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Check-in was a breeze”
Reviews.Author: liviluv
Reviews.Content: Thanks to William and T.C. our weekend vacation started off on a high-note. Both William and TC were all smiles as they helped to find us the most scenic room just steps from the beach. They talked with us about resort activities and ammenities. We even took advantage of the steam room in the spa followed by the lavendar scented towels -- how refreshing! This is a great couples or family get-away with fantastic staff!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, a great restaurant and spa all in one!”
Reviews.Author: TnEShlaes
Reviews.Content: This resort location is great for couple and families. A huge pool area and near the bay. A great trail to walk or skate on and it is next to a large park. The restaurant has great food and the services is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first impression...”
Reviews.Author: Dr P
Reviews.Content: Recently went on a work trip to San Diego and had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa. I had the good fortune of working with William, T.C., and Paige at the front desk. I have nothing but positive things to say about this team! These three individuals represented their company very well as they were very efficient, and professional. Among the other luxuries in this hotel, their staff made my first stay a extremely pleasant one. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: KiminDen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights (using points) with my daughter on a college trip. Beach location is great and the pool is beautiful. Unfortunately, we had bad weather, so didn't get to enjoy much of either.... Room was nice, just smelled strongly of cleaning products. Breakfast was good. I would definitely consider this hotel again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Mission Bay September 25, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Kerry R
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to call the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa when visiting my son at the end of September and spent Sunday night there before returning home. Concierge, Whitney, was very knowledgeable, providing me with maps and directions from Mission Bay to absolutely everywhere I wanted to go and ever so helpful with sightseeing and shopping ideas, and all with a gracious and welcoming smile! At Matt's and Whitney's recommendation, my son and I dined at a Mexican restaurant, Casa Guadalajara, in Old Town which served the best Mexican cuisine I have tasted since a business trip in 1987 to Mexico City! I live in Washington State; so to find excellent Mexican food is a fabulous treat! I have since passed along the recommendation to 3 other groups of friends visiting San Diego! I was grateful also to be treated so royally during my stay by Alissa, Paige and Alex, from check-in to morning coffee on my balcony, then a fabulous breakfast on the patio in the morning - a delightful stay in my beautifully appointed room with stunning view,and I hope to come back soon! And great weather is always important to a Washingtonian - indeed, as Whitney promised, the fog burned off by 11:00 to reveal a perfect California day! Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, however mixed review..”
Reviews.Author: mandjw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a nice room overlooking the beautiful green grass the the bay. On a positive note, it was just a one minute stroll to the beautiful bay and the rooms were nice and comfortable. However, only got one tea bag. When I called for more milk and sugar, they took 45 minutes to deliver some more. Note - they will charge you for everything here - $28 to park your car yourself per night (not even valet parking!!) and the food is waaay overpriced for what it was. Also, the business centre is expensive to use.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ME_from_IIT
Reviews.Content: Patricia in the gift shop went out of her way to help us

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kailee L
Reviews.Content: I've lived in California for about six years now and never been to San Diego on vacation. My boyfriend surprised me with a vacation to the Hilton Resort & Spa for our one year anniversary. The entire experience there was amazing - we stayed at one of the suites overlooking the water and had its own firepit, which was a great bonus. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. One of the sales managers in particular, Marc Francois was a great help and we could not have planned or asked for a better trip and it's because of his excellent customer service and willingness to go the extra mile. If you are looking for someone to help you with any service sale needs, Marc is the guy to ask for! We will definitely be coming back to this Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: 1GraciousTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for a recent 2 night stay at the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa, and sadly it fell short. My husband and I stayed in a tower room that unfortunately overlooked the parking lot. We were initially given a room that faced the nearby loud freeway, so we asked to change rooms, I wasn't happy with a parking lot view, but at least it didn't have the view and noise of the freeway. We were also disappointed with how dated parts of the hotel were. The hallways were very dingy, and I was surprised to see that the ceilings were "cottage cheese" that should have been redone when they remodeled. The rest of our room was very pleasant and nicely decorated, but seemed incomplete with the dated ceiling and a great flat screen tv that had a terrible analog signal that did not receive major channels without a lot of static. On the positive side, the service at the hotel was very good. They addressed our issues, and really tried hard to remedy our concerns. I'm happy to say that the bed and linens were wonderful! Exactly what I was hoping for. The pool area was also beautiful and relaxing, but the jacuzzi definitely needs to be resurfaced. Overall, I expected more from this Hilton property, and hopefully soon they will update the rest of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jpdo81
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely fabulous. From the resort itself to the staff everything was perfect. Ideal for a family vacation or my romantic getaway with my wife, I was very pleased with the special help of the manager Mr N. Villarino. Thanks for is extra care and kindness our honeymoon was a success.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night away”
Reviews.Author: jenjaye
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night recently as a quick getaway - we live in San Diego and wanted some escape from the kids and got an excellent last minute rate. Had a King Garden Villa room - it was spacious, a little dated, and not far from the lobby and parking. No wireless, but our stay was short, so it wasn't a problem for us. There were several weddings going on that night, so the place was busy - functions near the pool, etc. We had hoped to have a drink near the pool in the late afternoon, but that was not happening - we were surrounded by wedding guests. Some noise from the hallway at night, but not too bad. I'd stay again if i got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “It's 2011, Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnurse50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting this week. There is NO wireless access in rooms. Huh? The hotel is sprawled over the grounds and the first night I was stuck far from the lobby which is the only place I could get a signal. The next morning I was moved to another room closer to the lobby. Staff were friendly but the public areas are worn and scruffy. And in both rooms, the bath didn't drain and I showered with my feet and ankles in soapy water. Ugh. And the cafe was only open till 1 pm so no chance of a snack or hot beverage after that. There were coffee makers in the rooms - but only 2 tea bags provided. Conclusion? Would not stay here out of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of everything, miles away from extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: Stevedusa
Reviews.Content: First time I stayed at this property and my first impression is this hotel has a lot of traffic, and I don't mean by just cars. Let's face it, it's in the middle of Mission Bay, minutes from Pacific Beach and the I-5, easily access to San Diego but offers a good location to stay away from it all when you need it. The hotel itself is pretty big, spread out across few buildings. From the outside it looks like a resort to begin with and it doesn't look very aged even if it has that old charm feeling to it. Somehow it was very well blended together. Bottom line, from the moment you step into the property, you feel relaxed. However don't feel too relaxed as the property is popular for parties (the night I spent held 3 wedding together), and public does has access to the property (to a certain degree) 24/7. If you are not a big fan of the teenagers/kids, you might want to ask for a private corner room that's away from the bay. I stayed at the bay front room with a fire pit, and foot traffic is almost a constant thing especially with the bay front rooms. But the patio/fire pit has a lawn separating your private and public property. Bottom line it has a respectable distance from your privacy and the view (public). The room itself is very colorful and cozy. However the bathroom needs bit more lighting as the shower is almost impossible to get sufficient light inside. Oh yes and the water pressure can use a little more help as the shower head designed to work best with higher pressure seems just spitting out drips of mist instead of a down pour of water. Here's a tip you might find very useful, BE CAREFUL WITH THE KEY CARDS! And I mean it, they are very, VERY weak. Not sure if the cards themselves or the locks are causing the problem but if you keep your card close to anything that emits any electrical magnetic field (i.e. your cellphone, even your own credit cards) it'll deem your room keycard useless and getting a replacement card 2 in the morning at the front desk doesn't sound like fun if it happens to you. When you are about to get some rest, hit the bed and close your windows/sliding doors. You will forget about all the above and simply felt asleep quickly as the bed is just like all the beds Hilton offers, comfortable and great to sleep on. Beddings too! Entertainment wise, the pool is a great place to relax and well, swim. They do have a kids pool for the kids but it seems like the resident ducks are using it as their own pool. Better than rubber ducks if that's what your kids like. The regular pool is well lit, designed and very nice to swim in. Oh there are two, yes count it, TWO hot tubs. The poolside services are a bit slow but very professional and prompt. Personally I found the best entertainment is to purchase 3 to 4 bags of duck feed (at $1.5 each, no tax) at the shop next to the duck pound and just sit there and feed the ducks. It can provide at least 15 minutes of fun PER bag. It lasted me an hour and lots of silly, innocent fun. Now to the downside... PARKING. Let's be honest, it's not cheap to park anywhere in San Diego, tourist or not. This place is no exception neither. It cost a bit and if you really want a place to park, arrive early. You can try to park outside else where but do keep your eye on the parking regulation signs as getting towed or a ticket isn't always worth it. Over all this property offers a good view if you can afford it, great for family but business/couples do seek somewhere else (look north) as this place is filled with family and foot traffic might interrupt your privacy. However if you want a convint location with a good view of the Mission Bay, this is your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service a few minutes outside of city! Need transportation to see sites.”
Reviews.Author: VKaloidis
Reviews.Content: I would go back when I have children because it is a close to zoo and city at same time making it easy to accommodate parents and children

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sscc0404
Reviews.Content: Surprise that they allow families with 2 kids in deluxe rooms. We had 2 queen beds and a roll-in bad: the room was full! No space for laggages, nor for us! And despite it, not even enough space for a good night sleep. The common spaces were acceptable. The view on the bay depressing. Breakfast is good, but we were faced with an extra charge as we were together with friends (it is the "party of 6 or more" extra.) All in all, I will never go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, location and Food”
Reviews.Author: Jkiene
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I look for a good location, nice comfortable room, food and service. This hotel has all the above! I forgot my credit card and left for the airport. The Manager contacted me and drove to the airport to deliver the credit Card! This was above and beyond and I would highly recommend this hotel to business and family vacations!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Wesley S
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept 26th thru Sept 28th, very nice property quiet and feels secluded. Arrived early and was told that I would be notified on my cell when the room was ready. Was called about an hour later and was put in a room on the top floor of the tower facing the bay with the larger balcony, excellent room. The staff was very receptive to requests that were made. Enjoyed the pool area and several walks down along the bay shore. Didn't have any time during the day to use any of the aquatic activity items that are available but hopefully will on a future visit. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to relax - watch out for location”
Reviews.Author: smash413
Reviews.Content: recently visited this hotel, and it's a gorgeous hotel in a beautiful setting. the pool area is fantastic and it has everything you need on one site. the only down-side i would say was the location, we hadn't realised it was so far from downtown and being on holiday from England we did not have a car, so it was a taxi journey to Mission beach or downtown. the dinner service was expensive and although the food was good, it was no better than other restaurants we went to so we felt this was overpriced and ate from the pool bar the other nights. there is also some building work going on, which we were not notified of before our visit and caused some noise disturbance when we were around the pool. overall, for a relaxing trip and to stay by the pool it's definitely worth going, but if you want to be out and about I would choose somewhere closer as there isn't much going on around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flexibility”
Reviews.Author: Pam S
Reviews.Content: I was checking into the hotel on business. I arrived early and the room I was assigned was not ready. Angie and William were flexible enough to get me in a great room after a short wait. My only disappointment - I was not on vacation with my family to enjoy the room and property. It was a nice experience and a great place for an outdoor walk/run.

Reviews.Title: “My review from Sept. 2011”
Reviews.Author: Ev S
Reviews.Content: Overall somewhat disappointed. However the staff were wonderful. TC was great!!! The lady at the coffee shop was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Kindness without Questions”
Reviews.Author: Dennis P
Reviews.Content: KUDOs to Ramzi at the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa over the past weekend! Though I had paid for two rooms and would of been entitled to an additional complimentary breakfast ticket, when I asked Ramzi for the additional breakfast ticket, he only asked my room number and immediately gave me another ticket. This type of service, though small, is very important to me. Not only did Ramzi not ask me to wait while he "checked" the hotel register, he immediately asked if I needed any addtional tickets. This 'little' consideration goes a long way with this Diamond Club member who has stayed in a Hilton Hotel at least 100 days this year. Thank you Ramzi!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: Jere H
Reviews.Content: We've been staying here for years. The ocean view from the second floor of the 2 story suites is great. Service and food & overall ambiance excellent!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: dalyaspn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been spending a couple of months a year at this hotel. Fantastic staff. Lets start at the front desk. Edit, TC, Matt, Nick, Ramzi, And Mr. Personality: William. Pool Bar: Lindzee, JV and Jonathon. Housekeeping: Rosa, Slyvia and Maria. A special thanks to Elizabeth. Carol & Glenn Daly Aspen, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bokehbro
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying in lots of nice hotels. The ones that stand out the most are the ones with a caring and appreciative attitude from the staff. William at the front desk, has impeccable customer service skills and knows how to make guests feel welcome and want to come back as a repeat customer. Every time, I have visited, I have been fortunate enough to receive his excellent customer service attitude. He is kind, courteous, accommodating and very positive. Next time you are in time, stay at this resort and experience Williams gracious attitude!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trapped in Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Sue2000000
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we had a bad experience here. When we arrived, the two restaurants were closed for repairs, with a temporary setup in the ballroom. In addition the pool bar was closed -we were initially told this was due to the end of summer. We were not impressed, particularly as nothing was said before arrival or at the time of arrival - either to us or other guests (we watched as several turned up for dinner only to be greeted with a taped off area, no explanation and left completely confused). When we asked what was going on, the manager on duty actually admitted to not knowing what was going on in his own hotel. It went downhill from there and we contacted our travel agent to move us out elsewhere - which we did. Things happen but the way they were handled meant we had no faith in the management here at all. For the record, we were given a $50 discount for the inconvenience but for us, this in no way equated for it. Aside from this, the room we were assigned in the Tower for the short duration was very nice and well appointed. If you have a car, expect to pay $28 per night for parking. If you don't have a car, this hotel is ok if you are happy to stay on site or be prepared for an expensive taxi bill, otherwise you may feel 'trapped'. The drinks menu had no prices on it so we had to keep awkwardly asking staff which was annoying. Although the food was good, we were only offered the same, limited restaurant menu and I ate the same thing on the two consecutive evenings, so this would have been a problem for a long stay unless you have means to get off site - you cannot simply walk to an alternative here. In general, this hotel is a bit 'tired' and in need of some TLC.

Reviews.Title: “OK, bit dated”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: Room was OK, a bit dark despite the 'garden view'. No wi-fi, only cable at $12+ per day. Parking is also $28 a day so these two essentials add quite a lot to your final per day stay. Hotel facilities are dated and need a overhaul. Hotel map is illegible--tiny--which makes going around the facilities a challenge on day 1. Finally,

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lakrhot
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the room we had asked for did not fit our needs. We requested a change and within minutes we were settled in. The customer service could not have been better. Special kudos to Whitney, our concierge, who helped us find some specialty type of restaurant outside of the normal areas. She printed maps, showed us menus and kept on smiling. The only thing that was in short supply was handicapped parking near the villas. All in all, very relaxing and enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PatDSalemOR
Reviews.Content: We were treated very well from the minute we arrived. They upgraded our rooms to ocean view without an extra charge, provided tips on things around the resort, gave us free bottled water, provided written driving directions. Nice pool area. Good full-service restaurant with seating both indoors & outside. Friendly service in coffee shop both mornings. Bar pretty expensive, but they do have some specials at Happy Hour. Our housekeeper, Rosario, was fabulous. Easy on/off I-5. Close to Sea World, Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service and very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Ctrujillo44
Reviews.Content: If I could give a 6 for customer service I would! Since we first walked into the door William the hotel supervisor has done everything he could to make our stay as easy and relaxing as possible. Mid way through the stay TC the concierge was able to set up our car rental and truly made it feel like a one stop shop. We just needed to show up and sign the papers.. This was my wife and I's 1 year anniversary and we couldnt have picked a better hotel to celebrate it in. To add to all the great service was that the hotel was kept up very well. There seemed to be no window left uncleaned or carpet left unvacummed. I could go on and on. So simply put , this hotel was a fantasic choice and I would recommend it to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....mediocre room....”
Reviews.Author: danac_10
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I stayed here for four nights in August. We had a "suite" room, which is a slight exageration. The suite area was two steps below the bedroom and was completely unusable area of the room. The coffee maker sits nicely on the little wet bar, but there was no plug for it unless you wanted to pull the mini fridge out and see if it would plug behind that. The patio was never swept, nor the outdoor furniture cleaned of pine needles the entire four days, so you could not sit outside. We were looking at a slight water view if you didn't mind the metal fence. The room had horrible lighting...i.e there was none. The grounds though are beautiful, pool was nice, great walking area for daily strolls and many close places to dine. So overall, I would stay again, but I would not upgrade the room unless I saw where it was located within the complex.

Reviews.Title: “great way to end our crazy trip across southern California”
Reviews.Author: packupupandaway
Reviews.Content: We had booked another hotel but due to over booking we were told we could use Hiton San Diego. We were very happy we some how ended up in this great hotel. My daughter and I were very happy with all the staff and everyone that helped us while we were there for the short two nights. I would come back and stay here again, if given the chance. The Red Marlin was prices but the view on the water was breath taking, we only had breakfast but I have to say the food was very good. We enjoyed the large pool and hot tub. Location is great if flying in and out of the airport. We took the back roads and we were at dollar rent a car in 15 minutes. Almost forgot hotel is near Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Yessitalinda
Reviews.Content: A young lady named andrea who attended me she was very nice and helped me very well in the markt place. Even though she didnt talk spanish she helped us. She was friendly ,nice, loveable, attendable. If all the employees were like her this would be the best hotel of all san diego

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Stella P
Reviews.Content: The property looks like a petite Bahamas resort! It is beautiful!! Everyone is very nice, especially Ryan at the water activity rentals. He will train you in a few minutes in any activity that you might like to do. Cabanas by the pool are rented for a day. They come with the snack basket & TV. the food is great. They have music by the pool & fire at night. My husband & my 10 year old by want to got back every month!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Great Place to Stay for a Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Steven T
Reviews.Content: The service we received from the time we arrived to the time we left was outstanding. Please give special thanks to William Mathews for making out trip so wonderful. The room we received was fantastic in a great location with a fire pit. Breakfast was great! We wished we had more time at this Resort to try out more of what they offered. My wife and I did try the bicycle ride which felt great and used the pool quit a bit. We defiantly will return and stay at this facility. Thank You Steve Turmala Diamond Member Turmalasc2@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With the Family”
Reviews.Author: 2001elan
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hoyel in August 2011 with husband and 9 year old son. From the moment we arrived everything went perfectly. This is truly a resort with all of the bells and whistles. The kids evening activities were great. Friday night it was free movie night around the pool with free popcorn. Saturday night it was free smores by the fire pit. You are right on the beach witha a beautiful pool. Great happy hour specials at the pool bar and live music each night 5-7 pm. Jacuzzi is fabulous. The gym was great. All the basic machines you need. Fabulous jogging path in back of hotel that stretches for miles along the beach. What more could you ask for. Okay yes the only true bummer is that darn $28.00 per night parking fee. It does add up and it is an important consideration when staying here. Also - the $11.00 optional room internet fee. I took my laptop to the lobby each day it was fine and free:) The rooms in the tower are lovely. We were on the 7th floor (Room 776) with a view of the bay. We could see the fireworks at Sea World every night. The bed linens are soft and fabulous. Only feather pillows are in the room so you may want to bring a pillow from home. Shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, body gel provided. The Acqua restaurant breakfast buffet was great and cost $20 for adults and $10 for kids. You can always order off the menu if you do not want the buffet. Jet ski rental is $99 per hour. Staff are pleasant and professional. We had a minor television problem and the TV repair men were so sweet and kind. I wish I knew thier names. Top notch. Room is $110 per night with government rate!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: spruill1348
Reviews.Content: The Staff is responsive from the time you arrive. I have to travel to San Diego at least once a month. This is the place to stay. Beach is close by. Great place to work out and entertain as well. Easy Access to all locations North and South William Matthews is there to greet you every time

Reviews.Title: “This resort is fun for us with adult children and for those with kids grandkids!”
Reviews.Author: CJeannieB
Reviews.Content: right from the start TC @ front desk was welcoming and went the extra mile. It took awhile for our room to be prepared... But it was worth it. Kudos to TC!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, free room upgrade, beautiful pool area”
Reviews.Author: mattk76
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort for two nights. Great location. It's very close to activities on the bay and old town shops and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the pool area was great for the kids. Restaurant food, room service, and parking we're a bit pricey but would stay there again regardless. Don't hesitate to ask for a room upgrade. William hooked us up with an awesome upgrade to a larger suite when we arrived. Seems like they are willing to accommodate if they have better rooms available. Would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk supervisor William Matthews comes through again”
Reviews.Author: billorangecounty
Reviews.Content: We recently completed what has become a regular trip to San Diego with our daughters family, including our 4 small granddaughters. This has become their favorite trip of the year, but they aren't responsible for any of the planning and coordinating. All they know is they love everything about the hotel, from the breakfast buffet in the morning, all the way through the Sea World fireworks before bed. Being the one responsible for the planning, this trip has become my favorite also, almost entirely due to the helpfulness and efforts of front desk supervisor William Matthews. On a previous trip he stepped in and handled a problem, and followed up during our entire stay. This time I called in advance. Although he was off the day we checked in, he had everything set up perfectly. With 4 small girls, something seems to come up every 15 minutes. Without exception, during the rest of our stay he handled everything. It makes the trip for me stress free. Due to work I stay at a dozen or so 5 star hotels during the course of the year, and although all are very nice, none provide the level of service that William does. My biggest concern with this hotel is that another competitor steals him away. Needless to say, we wouldnt consider staying at any other San Diego for our family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and definitely recommend..didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: charlene o
Reviews.Content: Hello, this was our first visit to San Diego, Ca and we had no idea what hotel to choose. There were four of us two adults and two children, ages 4 and 11. Based on surveying the area...WE CHOSE THE BEST HOTEL...especially for family...very adult friendly as well. We were centrally located to all attractions, such as Sea World, Zoo, Mission Bay, and Old Town. We were greeted by Marlon and Jeffrey - they both provided a very warm welcome. Jeff was a great help as well. TC also known as Talisha was awesome, very friendly, and helpful with detailed information. William was a great help as well and was full of laughs and smiles. Also, the manager of Aqua remember us by our name for breakfast...that made us feel special. We enjoyed playing ping pong - table tennis, checkers, making s'mores by the fire pit, riding bikes along the water front. The hotel was room itself was a little above average but you truly received five star service with all the other amenities....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: PHXCUSTOMSDOTCOM
Reviews.Content: My wife, kids and I stayed for just one night late August. We were upgraded to the California Suite. The room was huge. The only downside was that it was a King but the couch opening up into a bed for the kids. The patio was bigger than my backyard. It had heat lamps, a fire pit, cushioned loungers, tables, benches. The only thing missing was a pool at that point. We ate breakfast at the Acqua. The service was great and Gary was the nicest guy and nice to chat with. My only complaint was that the patio area was dirty from the previous guests. There were old newspapers there and an extension cord laying around. It wasnt a big deal and the view of the water and fireworks from Sea World made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: schmusimausi73
Reviews.Content: We spent a whole week at this hotel. It is presented as an upscale resort style hotel and we splurged for a garden villa, expecting a true Hilton experience. I am sorry to say, we were disppointed and felt misled by the resort presentation on the Hilton website. First of all, the hotel seemed to be trying to squeeze money out of its guests at every turn. The website says each room features high speed internet. Nowhere is a mention of this being not free. Only when you click on individual rooms' info, do they have a tiny notice saying there might be additional fees. By the way, the internet connection is per cable (no wireless) and costs $11.95 per 24 hours. The breakfast is not included in the price of the room and adds up quickly, as does the parking charge of $28 per night. There is an outdoor pool on the property, with a small paddling pool for toddlers next to it. There are lounge chairs around the pool, free of charge, and then shaded cabanas that need to be rented and reserved in advance. I didn't ask how much they were to rent, but considering that there was no mention of the actual price anywhere in the hotel add or the notice at the pool, AND the outrageous prices of poolside snacks, I can only imagine it was just as overpriced as everything else in this hotel. A small ice cream bar cost $5 by the pool. There were notices telling people no outside drinks or food were allowed by the pool, I guess to encourage people to spend ridiculous amounts of money on drinks and snacks. There is beach nearby and Hilton has its own boat dock there as well. You can rent a jetski for $99 PER HOUR, for example. The front desk staff were lukewarm at best. One night I found someone's lost room key card, took it to the front desk, waited almost 10 minutes in line to return it, saying I found it lying around near the pool bar. No thanks, nothing, just a very bored "Oh yeah?" and the woman took the card and that was that. I booked the room as a package which gave me a 50-dollar credit towards the spa services, which the front desk confirmed at check-in. Later on I had a manicure at the spa, the manicure was $45 but they add 20% gratuity automatically to each bill, and that plus tax meant my total was $63. I told the spa coordinator that I had a $50 spa credit, she called the front desk to confirm it, and then told me should couldn't deduct the credit from my bill, but the front desk would do that at check-out for me. No problem. Of course, when the bill came the day of our check-out, the spa charge was there, all $63 of it. So I had to go to the front desk to get it cleared up. I told the man they forgot to apply the $50 spa credit, expecting a sincere "I'm so sorry". He couldn't have been less interested. Looked into the computer, then said "Yeah, there is a credit." He didn't say anything else, so I politely asked for an updated bill. He said yeah, all right, and I was still standing there and he finally realized that I wanted the correct bill, like, you know, NOW. He asked "Do you want me to print it now?" I said YES. He asked: "I can just send it to you as an email." I said I'd prefer it printed out right then. He FINALLY did it and gave me the updated bill. This whole thing was like pulling teeth. Seriously, is it so hard to do your job? Now, there were POSITIVE aspects to the hotel resort as well. We ate at the Olive bar one evening and the food was very good and the service fast and accurate. Our room was clean and had a small balcony. There was a small fridge and a safe. The housekeeping ladies were all very friendly and our room was always nicely cleaned and tidied. The location of the Hilton resort was good, right in the Mission Bay, near the beach and a park with picnic areas and a playground. The nail tech at the spa was very nice and friendly. We had expected more from the Hilton and it speaks for itself when I say that you can getter better value for your money at the Hampton Inn (by Hilton) than a Hilton Resort. In conclusion: we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Service”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler I see a huge number of properties and interact with a lot of hotel employees. I would like to compliment the property on being gorgeous and well kept, but more than that the service of the entire staff was phenomenal. In particular a particular team member stood out. Alyssa Lincoln at the front desk went above and beyond. This was particularly endearing, on this trip, as I was traveling for leisure with my children. Thanks so much and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “William is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Diane R
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Hilton in support of a business conference and during checkin William was exceptionally helpful and made the stay perfect. I would recommend this resort to anyone and definitely see William and tell him Hi from me :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Too pricey for what you got”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen N
Reviews.Content: My family ( husband, son and myself) stayed over a weekend (Friday through Sunday). Could not check in until 4:00pm (which was OK as we were at Sea World for the day). When checking in the "night" staff were most unfriendly, almost like robots. When we asked about the parking fee our question was met with (and I'm paraphrasing) "Well your other option is to park elsewhere and have to walk back which will be about 40 minutes." But it was more the way it was said as opposed to what was said, very curt. SO, we had no choice really but to pay the $28 per night fee. When we got to our room, there was absolutely NO spaces near our room. We had to walk a good distance with our luggage, and for that we could have parked "elsewhere" for free. So I did call the front desk and she was able to credit the parking back to us, but again curt. When booking online, the type of room we thought we were getting was " ... two queen beds in one of our two story villas...". For the price it sounded right however, it was a tiny little room with two queen beds stuffed inside that was in a two story complex (Villa??). SO, I called again to the front desk to see if there has been a mix up with our reservation, and, what a shock, curtly was told "..this is what was booked...". So I asked to be moved to a larger room (not to mention the light in the bathroom was out). WELL, I may as well have insulted someone's mother by the way that was received. I was being, umm, placated and they sort of considered my request. I only had to call back two times to get someone to call me back to tell me there was a room with a king bed available. Having three people and one being a teen, that wasn't going to work. So in our tiny over priced room we stayed. Now, the day staff...FANTASTIC!! From the pool attendants, to the Concierge to the gals at the front desk to the staff at the restaurants. No complaints whatsoever. The up side is, the Hotel is in a good location with close proximity to most things. Rentals, (bikes and water toys) are right at the back steps. But there are so many other hotels, I am sure with the same caliber or higher, which will most certainly get our future business. We booked with Hilton for their reputation, but this particular hotel did not live up. Customer service is really going by the wayside.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the kids!”
Reviews.Author: Erika G
Reviews.Content: We live in Los Angeles and was looking for a great staycation for the weekend and end of summer that was kid friendly and we found it! I felt like this is the perfect resort for families. I am not sure if I would enjoy it as much if I was looking for a romantic weekend. We were luckily able to upgrade our room from the garden view (primarily grass and a parking lot) to the waterfront....and what a difference that made. The view from the waterfront rooms is perfect and makes a difference with the trip. One of the major cons to this resort is there high priced parking of $28. We were only here for two nights, but could not imagine staying longer than that and paying more. The additional $60 damage was more than enough. I think they should give people a break especially since the Four Seasons parking overnight is less than that. Other than that if you have kids you will enjoy this place!

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelers321
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time at the resort! What we loved: Whitney at the front desk. She checked us in, and was fabulous and super accomodating with all our requests! Got us a great room, and went out of her way to give us a great experience. What a doll! The on site water sport rental - especially the complimentary acitivites offered there at different times throught the day. make sure to ask for a schedule at check in! Smores at the poolside fire pits! Toddler wading pool -if you've got a little one, you will love it! Location - right on the bay with beach access, close to everything The balconies The vaulted villa ceilings Helpful and friendly staff What we didn't love.. $25 parking fee Bathtubs need to be upgraded Pool area is too dark at night, Other than inside the pool (and fire pit), there are no lights Leaving! But hopefully we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cpseley
Reviews.Content: We spend a few days every year at the hotel and we're never disappointed. My thirteen year old son doesn't even miss his computer, which remians at home. The beach was right out our door and "groomed" every day. Fireworks nightly across the bay at SeaWorld while roasting smores at a beach firepit. The best buffet breakfast anywhere! Rooms were kept immaculate by an attentive staff. Front office personnel well informed, courteous, enthusiastic...overall we couldn't be more pleased. Thanks. PS Snorlking at La Jolla Cove is a must. Kelp beds, Garabaldi galore, in water 10 to 15 ft.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: TheWoodlandsMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel, with all it's amenities, is in a perfect location to enjoy the Mission Bay/San Diego area. We spent two nights in the Gaslamp District on a business trip and then wanted a more "vacation" area to relax and chose the Hilton in Mission Bay to spend our remaining two days and nights. The front desk folks were great and put an expidite on getting our room cleaned as we were checking in early. While we waited for the room, we got a key to the pool area and started checking out the area. The Hotel is located in the middle of the Mission Bay parks and there is an OVERABUNDANCE of great walking and biking trails. The hotel pool is adequately sized but of course crowded in the middle of the day in the summer. The pool bar/restaurant has reasonably priced drinks and food. The Hotel Restaurant, where we ate two nights, has a traditional hotel priced menu BUT they offered a prix fix menu of appetizer/meal/dessert which was a good deal. We were not disappointed with either meal we had. Breakfast is served in this same main restaurant or you can get coffe and a quick bite at a "Starbucks" type coffee shop. The hightlight of our short trip was spending Saturday "touring around" the Mission Bay area on bikes rented at the hotel. Dan, the bike tender, was GREAT and gave us a perfect map of the area and where we could bike. He had us get the best bikes and made sure the bike tires were perfect. Then he suggested a great place for breakfast/brunch, The Eggery on Mission Beach and fully explained all the little areas we could get tripped up on when following the bike trail signs. So, at 8:30am we were off our our biking excursion. We biked halfway around Mission Bay, around Seaworld, over the bridge and onto the beach boardwalk. We biked up and down the boardwalk, found the Eggery and had a GREAT breakfast, then walked all over the area, onto the Pier, got our feet wet in the cold ocean and did ALOT of people-watching. We got back on our bikes, were up and down the boardwalk again and then followed the other half of the bike trail back to the hotel. It was amazing to see the hundreds of locals taking advantage of the Mission Bay parks with picnics, birthday parties, company outings, baby showers....you name it! It was a SUPER workout and when we returned to the hotel at 3:30 - 7 hours later - , we calculated that we probably biked about 20 miles that day! It did not seem like it at all since the weather was PERFECT, with a nice breeze. I would HIGHLY recommend doing this to everyone. It is mostly flat, so even using the one-speed crusier bikes was fine. The hotel does charge you per hour for the bike but a full day maxes out at a 4 hour charge. Yes, there are a TON of other things to do in the area but our day of biking is something we will never forget and look forward to coming back and doing this again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for San Diego vacation”
Reviews.Author: Stevensmom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hilton for years. As a long time HIlton fan, I bring my family here every summer for a relaxing, and at the same time active vacation. The location is perfect, the jet skis and water activities are numerous, and the bicyling around Mission Bay is terrific. With two teenage boys there were plenty of activities here for everyone. They loved the freedom of the resort along with Fresco's grill (poolside), and we all have a great time. I loved the Brezzia spa, beach, and onsite Starbucks. But I must say that one of the reasons that this Hilton is a stand out (besides the facility) is the customer service. It is exceptional!. William at the front desk is without a doubt the best! We came during a rush hour, and he was amazing. Answering phones, showing someone how to get somewhere in Italian, and very pleasant to deal with. As a professional in Human Resources, he is definitely the consummate professional. Driving home last evening, we talked about our trip, and will look forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time at the best hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: urbanbeauty76
Reviews.Content: My son and I came from out of town. We had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Resort & spa in San Diego. Starting with the check in. I had the pleasure of speaking with a young lady by the name of TC. She was so friendly and she knew her stuff. I was really in a bad mood that day. I have to say she made my day. She was very nice. I felt like I was speaking with a friend. She really had my son and my best interest. The Hotel was quit beautiful. I enjoyed the spa and the service I received. You can bet I will come back next year. Thanks to TC Happy Customer

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Phil D
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel three times now and always enjoy our stay. The location is perfect, close to SeaWorld, Old town, and the ballpark. Service has been exceptional, and more specifically, William at the front desk was overly accomadating to my family and I. We will certainly be back again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “would have given 5 stars except for...”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: As other tripadvisors have commented, $28 is far too high a price for parking your car, even though it is very convenient being near your room.Also, 4 pm is a little too late to check in. 3pm is late enough. However, everything else about the hotel was great. We loved our room with private patio where you can walk straight onto the beach through a little garden. Lovely walks along the shore with Sea World in the distance.There was a welcome fridge and coffee/tea maker which we'd missed in Las Vegas from where we had just driven for nearly 5 hours. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was well kitted out but the hotel IS rather expensive and actually preferred the Bahia Bay where we stayed a few years ago as there was more to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best summer for family vacation in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jimboz3
Reviews.Content: We come down to this hotel twice a year. It has great service, clean large room and awesome location for family with young children. Bay or garden view in every room. Every room has a patio or fire pit. During summer we enjoy fireworks at SeaWorld which you can see from all hotel grounds. Daily activities for entire family to do. The marina has all the water sports for all ages. Kids spend every day on the beach which is less than 10 steps for some beach front rooms. Ask for TC when you check in, she is the BEST! Location and service are the reasons we keep coming back. Ask for TC at check in, Ryan at Marina and Ronald at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ambiance; on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: JustCruisin11
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place, completely redone a few years ago, and even better than in the past. Rooms are large and many have great views of the bay. Service is good, and you can tell them a two hour period for room service. The pool is large, and there are several whirlpools scattered about the gardens on the property. We like the rooms in the single or two story structures, but there's also a tower with better views. Every room has either a patio or a balcony. Many of the suites have firepits on the patios, and there's a large bonfire area on the beach for groups. Staff is friendly and eager to help. Parking is included in the rates, but you must place a pass on your dash to use the parking lots. They have lots of watersport equipment available for rental. There is also a wonderful, long beach walk right in front of the hotel that wraps around that part of the bay and adjoining parks, used by walkers, runners, bicyclists, and skaters. The main restaurant has indoor and outdoor dining, good views, and good food, but the menu is somewhat limited. The bar also serves food with lower prices. Sandwiches are served out by the pool in a cabana, as well. We need feather free rooms because of allergies, but the one down side is that we always arrive with the bed filled with six or so down pillows. If you need a feather free room, be sure to check the pillows and comforter upon arrival and have them changed out right away. The mattresses, however, are the best we've ever slept on. The downside? It's pricy, but it's possible to use Hilton Honors points. If you don't have enough, sign up for a Hilton credit card and they'll give you enough points for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service (Alyssa) very pleasant resort when with kids, great restaurant (acqua)”
Reviews.Author: Redondoredondo
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers (diamond) and have stayed in many Hilton resorts. The customer service by Alyssa at check-inn was outstanding. So went beyond and above to help us move into a great room for ourselves and our 3 little boys. And she did it with a big smile and never gave us the impression we were difficult. The resort has many amenities (tennis, spa, pool etc) and great activities (s'mores at the beach, movie night at the pool etc). The location of the hotel is close to sea world, balboa, zoo, gaslamp; but we actually spend quite some time at the resort itself because it was so pleasant and 'easy. We had a wonderful time and will for sure come back. And thanks Alyssa!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip - Thanks William for making the trip so special!”
Reviews.Author: aaron53875
Reviews.Content: Our one night getaway felt like days. The property was beautiful, pool, hot tubs, and fire pits were super relaxing. What really made the difference was William. He hooked us up - putting us in a beautiful room, recommending things to do, and doing a superb job answering all of our questions. His customer service turned our stay from average to outstanding and has virtually guaranteed we will be back in the future. Our room was great. The bed was super comfortable, shower was awesome, and we had an amazing balcony. When we come back, the only thing I would do differently is remember to bring my tennis racket - the courts looked really nice. And the location is great, it's 5 minutes from Sea World (which is perfect if you're staying for just a couple of days, since you can check out and then do Sea World in the afternoon for a few hours on your way out), while at the same time only 13 minutes from Downtown San Diego (we went out in the gaslamp district - great restaurants and bars) as well as just a few minutes from Mission Beach.

Reviews.Title: “WILLIAM, FROM FRONT DESK, MADE OUR VACATION AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Sterlingwhg
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and quietly checked in to surprise my mom for her weekend, August 5-7th. We woke up the next morning and spoke with William at the front desk. He proceeded to turn our vacation into one of the most memorable! He was helpful in procuring the perfect room, at a romantic resort where families joined in the evenings for smores on the beach. The location was ideal for those seeking biking, beach activities, water sports, great walks around the bay and the BEST SERVICE, SPECIFICALLY, WILLIAM AT THE FRONT DESK, choose this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location next to many Activities”
Reviews.Author: Annew1217
Reviews.Content: We walked in the hotel this weekend with no reservations to get the last room available! All the other hotels were booked .....August in San Diego is apparently a busy time! The rate was way more than we wanted to spend but luckily my husband had Hilton Honor points that we used for this stay. And parking was $28, high IMO. The room was clean and quite large and the bathroom had marble counters & nice quality towels. I couldn't get the tub to drain as I was showering so I stood in a puddle of water. Also the plumbing was noisy from the other room. However, these minor things did not bother me, just letting you know. The bed was comfy. The grounds were very nice, however, the common areas (the elevator & public walkways) need constant attention due to all the kids, water, sand & handprints. The location is great for bicycling, boating, jet skiing, & more because it is right on the bay. Close to Sea World, Old Towne, Marina, Gas Lamp. Very nice stay if you can afford the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed by Front Desk clerk TC!!”
Reviews.Author: suneagle
Reviews.Content: When my mom and I booked our rooms online we specified adjoining rooms, as we would each be travelling with a young child and my mom would be fresh out of surgery and may need my assistance during the night. Upon check in we found our rooms to be on the same floor but not adjoining. We told the clerk helping us, TC, that that wouldn't work for us. She spent 20 or more minutes trying to find a combo of rooms that would work for us and bless her patience and perseverence she succeeded! We ended up paying a little more for the upgrade from the tower to a villa, but she made it affordable for us and we couldn't have had more comfortable accommodations. In this circumstance we spent a lot of time at the hotel and the rooms she moved us to were not only adjoining, they were on a quiet path with patios and grass in front that the girls could run in. TC personally helped us with our bags as the bell desk was unmanned and she couldn't even get them by radio. What a godsend she was for us! As for the rest of the hotel...it was average. Pool area was nice but the menu, until the day we left, wasn't very child friendly. Could be our stay was right before tourism got hot and heavy, but we were prepared to eat at least 2 meals a day there and were pretty disappointed in the selection for our girls. We stocked our mini fridge with sandwich makings and ordered pizza from up the hill several times instead. And I must say the pool staff spent far more time wandering and fixing chairs to be lined up straight than they did offering food/beverage services. So they didn't make much money on us there either... Would we stay again? No. If TC hadn't upgraded us we would have moved hotels. She is the shining star of our trip. Other than that, this is just a hotel with services and amenities overpriced for business groups, not families. The location is pretty enough, but we had just moved from Hotel Circle which was a crummy location (I-8 in the middle of it all!) but very family friendly (kids meals were half what Hilton charged) and comfortable for our kids to eat and play all day at. If our kids are entertained, fed and happy...so are we!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mom17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going for a night away and wanted a resort like feel. Well, I don't feel that is was resort like at all. Not for $369.00 ( standard room) per night or 50,000 Hilton Honor points, that I used! Here are some of my complaints: 1. thin walls, heard doors slamming, elevator running, toilets flushing. I had a very hard time falling asleep. 2. The room decor was very average, the TV was a flat screen but with no HD tv! Seemed very cheap to me that they couldn't provide HD. Very slim trash cans, useless if you ask me. 3. There is a ordor...which is from being so close to water but they can't have some of those scented plug ins throughout the hotel? Mostly smelled in the tower while waiting for elevator. Also the docor in the tower as you walk to the elevator is almost nothing! 4. We arrived on a Saturday and the pool was filled with tons of familys and no chairs available at all! Had to go out and lay out on the sand. Found some chairs an hour later and not one cocktail waitress came up to us nor even looked our way to get her attention. Overall I would be very disaaponted if I took my kids there for a week stay in San Diego, again for the price, not a resort if you ask me. I wish I would have listened to the bad reviews here.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back.....ever”
Reviews.Author: HappyCouple005
Reviews.Content: Wow, poor customer service, old, and dirty. From the moment we checked in I knew that we had made a mistake. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member and this place is not up to the standards of any Hilton property I have stayed at. We did not get the room we had paid for even though they tried to tell me I was being upgraded to a bigger room, not true. The first day at the pool, not one of the staff asked us for a food or beverage order. With young children a problem quickly became apparent. The pool is not secure and the entire pool can be accessed by non guests from the bay walking path. It would be easy for you to take your eyes of your child for just a second and have something bad happen. We were unable to relax do to this fact. The room had been re-newed but was still not cleaned well. We spent four days here and we will never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back. Great family hotel and GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: YoungGuns123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my wife's family from Italy and had a fantistic time. Our experience started with William (front desk supervisor) who provided us with great service and made us feel greatly welcomed from the moment we arrived. We spent time at the pool and bay. We rented jet skies from the hotel and had an awesome time! We will definately come back to this hotel anytime we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Diane92660
Reviews.Content: Bought three days at this at a 4 STAR on priceline. Upon check-in we were informed that parking in the parking lot would cost us $25 per day....? We were placed in a nice room as far from the lobby and services as you could get. We checked in on a Sunday evening and listened to staff cleaning carpets in the PARKING lot for over an hour (really loud). Apparently our room location is the LAST rooms of the day to be cleaned -- so maid service was around 5 p.m. (we skipped room cleanup on the 2nd day as we had been out all day only to come back to an undone room). No internet service in the room. Coffee service in room had dirty styrofoam cups. Did NOT consider this a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Diego Resort: Better than home, it's our Hawaii on the Mainland with GREAT service!”
Reviews.Author: Stix123
Reviews.Content: Our stay looks and feels like being on Maui except it's cooler and more relaxing. Why you ask? Because in Hawaii we always feel like we need to be out and about seeing things. At this resort Hilton we have it all - great rooms, our own fire pit (s'mores were good last night!), watching fireworks last night-from our patio, tennis this am And outstanding service from William at front desk - so helpful with all the details - thanks W!) And Jeffrey the bellman remembered us from previous years even calling my son by name - most impressive! At Hilton on Mission Bay... it's better than home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Relaxing Atmosphere to recharge and relax!”
Reviews.Author: berta6696
Reviews.Content: Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa was a wonderful respite in a busy area. Amenities are wonderful, rooms great but the service is what made the stay. All the staff were great, but I would like to make special mention of William at the reservation desk. We arrived to find the room we had requested not ready as it was still being cleaned. William immediately, and without asking, began to search for a comparable room. He not only found a room that was availabe, but was an upgrade to our reservation, in his words "to compensate for our inconvenience". William did this while being asked questions, folks milling about and other distractions. Definately grace under fire! Thanks William!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Mission Bay!”
Reviews.Author: brown-I-gal
Reviews.Content: We live in Orange County and travel to San Diego several times a year. I have Always wanted to stay at this hotel. We finally had a chance the week of July 4th. We got upgraded to a partial bay view (the view was mostly of the neighboring park). The rooms were average and were not anything special. The pool was also just ok. However, you are literally right on the bay. All the sporting activities are just outside your door! It is great! Plus in the evening you can talke a stroll and watch the fireworks at Sea World. Location of this hotel is great! It is close to all the major attractions and Old Town. Great place to stay! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but nickel and dime you to death”
Reviews.Author: pagerawd
Reviews.Content: Clean, front desk was friendly and helpful but if you need something, I hope you have it. Bring firewood, they have fire pits by the beach which are great and me and the kids were planning on making smores. We bought everything except firewood and found out they wanted 10 bucks for 4 peices of wood. Struck me as a tad high even for a resort. Can't remember exactly what the other things were but there was a lot of that. If you want a nice room, with beautifully landscaped property and don't mind added cost then you will enjoy. Oh yeah, 25.00 per night for parking, not unusual in that area but once again, a little high, even for there. They have a connection for wifi there in the room, almost hooked it up since there was no little card telling you there was a charge but wised up and called and turns out it was 12.50 per day, and no notice anywhere that it was a premium. Rubbed me the wrong way.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, run-down, never again.”
Reviews.Author: Shae89
Reviews.Content: Eww, Eww, Eww - this resort is in desperate need of a fresh coat of paint, new carpet in the halls and a good dust of the furniture. It is a large resort - front with views of the bay - back with views of the Hwy and is in the middle of nowhere - there is nothing around. It is self parking ($20 a day for what?). Yes, there are rats - big ones that run out in front of you (I'm sure they just enjoyed hearing me shreek). The staff on the desk were rude, the staff at the pool were lovely, the staff in the cafe were clueless - I asked for a 'Quater strength mocha - weak on the coffee' - the 'barista' obviously had no idea and filled my cup with a quater full - yep, a teeny tiny amount of coffee in the bottom of a tall cup. One night we got back late, there was a car in the carpark with the door open and no-one around, after half an hour I rang the desk and notified them incase it had been burgled and expressed my concern about our car (hire car). They said they would send security, they never did and I never heard any more. If you are staying higher than the ground floor and you are lugging around heavy luggage, work out at the gym before you leave for you will need the muscles to drag your goods up the stairs. We had requested 2 x rooms in close proximity with 2 beds in each - one room had 1 bed and the other had 2 beds - one on the ground floor, one on the top floor. The ground floor apartment had a broken lock - the door was dented in as if someone had tried to break in. Both rooms had broken air con, the bath in our room had a blocked drain and flooded the floor (shower in bath). Other then relaxing by the pool, and meeting the friendly staff down there, the hotel was otherwise crappy and we would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JPortia
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old son and I, drove down from LA to stay here in mid-June for a few nights. We were meeting up with friends at the San Diego parks (Sea World, Zoo, Balboa). We wanted to be out of the city, but close to everything, and the Hilton is just that. The location was perfect. We were on the top floor of the tower, facing the bay. What a fantastic view! We even left the balcony door open the first night so we could feel the ocean breeze. The room was beautiful, very spacious, recently remodeled, and clean. I loved the wood beams that added a cool architectural element. The furnishings were dramatic--not the average boring hotel room. The beds had soft linens, feather pillows and were very comfortable. The bathroom had beautiful granite and tile, but a pretty typical bathtub/shower. Not quite ultra luxury bath like a Four Seasons, but really well done. Every hotel employee we encountered was gracious, genuine, and helpful. They each inquired about our stay and several engaged in short conversations that made it clear that they were not just “going through the motions”, but that they took pride in their job and cared about the guests. We had a very slight rattling noise from the A/C unit that most people probably wouldn’t notice, and they fixed immediately. In my experience, leadership makes all the difference when it comes to the customer experience in any business, and the Hilton’s General Manager is obviously dedicated and skilled at running a major resort. We were pretty worn out from touring the parks & swimming, so we ordered room service in lieu of going to the restaurant. Room service was delicious, fast and accommodating. My son is a pretty picky vegetarian, but they were able to prepare a special dish for him! The pool was huge, gorgeous, and perfectly maintained. My son is just learning to swim and the beach-like wade in area is very cool, awesome for little ones. He also swam in the 5’ deep area with my husband and LOVED it! There was plenty of lovely comfortable seating, big beach towels, and helpful hotel staff, ready to assist. Fantastic!! I looked at a few 5 star boutique hotels in the area before choosing the Hilton for location and amenities, but I’m very happy with my choice. It was an incredible value and we had a fantastic time at the Hilton Resort and Spa!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyDziedzic
Reviews.Content: We arrived, my wife, 2 year old daughter and myself, after spending 5 nights at a Sheraton hotel, and we initially impressed. Although we were not on their books, the front counter lady checked us in with no hassles. Room was nice, garden view villa. Very disappointed when we were asked to get out of the main pool as apparently children 4 years or younger are not allowed - yet this was not signed or advised by the Hotel when we booked ( and they were aware we were traveling with an infant) This took much of the 'shine' off our stay as spending most of our time in a pool with 1 ft of water in 30 degree heat isn't much fun ( for both the kids and the adults) I would suggest this is made much more obvious, particulary for families with young children - or don't bother allowing children to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chaseme303
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last night of our 7 day San Diego vacation at the Hilton, the staff was great, room was clean, view from our room was awesome! We had a better view of Seaworld's fireworks than we did when we were at Seaworld! The pool area is beautiful, my only complaint is babies are only allowed in the baby pool....which makes it difficult when you have older kids too since I can't be two places at once to watch everbody! Other than that our stay was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Consistenly excellent - very responsive staff”
Reviews.Author: dansiegel
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at this proptery, but the first in many years. We arrived and were given a room key, but never told that the room was on the second floor and there was no elevator. We had to phone the hotel to finally get assistance with luggage. At the time, the staff seemed clueless. The next day, after learning that it is prohibited to bring even water bottles to the pool, we vented and our complaints we're immeditely given to the hotel manager, who came over to us. The manager, Greg, apologized, offered a free lunch, but more importantlynmade it clear that the situation would be addressed. After that, the stay was beautiful. The staff treated us wonderfully, the facilities were excellent, although we know they can't install elevators. We scheduled and and a bellman at checkout, and overall had another wonderful visit. We will return, and this shows how making a complaint can be invaluable in getting a situation resolved and in learning how well we can be treated.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at pool”
Reviews.Author: KatyMomof2
