Reviews.Content: My family watched the Women's World Cup Soccer poolside and received excellent service from Lindzee. She was very friendly, fast and accurate. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Poor management and customer service”
Reviews.Author: Meadowsweet
Reviews.Content: This is a delayed review, but the service I received is still bothering me so I decided to write. My daughter and I stayed here 6/13 - 6/15 to celebrate my 50th birthday on 6/14. On 6/14 I went to the resort's spa, and then we spent the day at Point Loma (wonderful) and then decided on happy hour and dinner at the hotel. I wanted one margarita at happy hour. First wasn't allowed in pool bar due to private party. Went to restaurant bar and it was full. Went to restaurant and wasn't allowed to sit anywhere with a water view and get a happy hour price. Come on! I'm turning 50 & from Arizona, let me have one margarita and look at water! The GM of the restaurant was incredibly rude to us. No apology ever received for the hassle of being uable to get the advertised happy hour price. We ended up paying full price for one drink each and then left the property to go someplace with nicer people. Complained at front desk at check out and they reversed the charges for my one drink, but I still can't believe how rude the restaurant manager was. His employees later talked to me, apologized, and basically said he's horrible. Also, the property, despite a few upgrades, still seems aged and not very clean. I did have a good experience at the spa though. After this we moved on to our next reservation at Hilton's Torrey Pine property. What a difference! We were treated wonderfully! I'd suggest staying there instead and just making the short drive into San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego is paradise”
Reviews.Author: GalThatTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Diego during July 4th holiday and we stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. I was a little skeptical based on the other reviews that I read on TripAdvisor about this propety but we were very pleased with our room and stay. It is a beautiful location overlooking Mission Bay. The sunsets were great as well as the fireworks from SeaWorld every night (at least in summer). It was a convenient location with regard to getting around San Diego, right off I-5. We got to/from the airport in less than 10 minutes; LaJolla was an easy 20 to 30 minute drive; Old Town just an exit or two away; San Diego Zoo 15 minute drive; and of course SeaWorld was 5 minutes away! You do need a car if you stay at this location and want to get around. Although the location is convenient to the highway etc., the resort is in a isolated location i.e. nothing within walking distance. However, the hotel is full service and there is a restaurant/bar (Acqua & Olive), casual pool bar/restaurant, coffee shop (Aroma), full gift shop/convenience store, spa/gym/tennis courts (which we didn't happen to use), water sports. It does have a "beach" technically but it's the bay. So if you are looking for a true beach experience i.e. Pacific Ocean - you'll have to head out to one of the several beaches. It does cost $25 per day to park here which we knew ahead of time but it's worth mentioning again since it seems to be a surprise to some based on the reviews. It seems to be a family-friendly place - lots of kids at the pool and lots of kids activities at the pool. They had a family movie night one night at the pool; another night S'mores on the beach. The food is very good at the Acqua restaurant - we ate there for breakfast several times, dinner, and at happy hour (Olive is the bar). However, the service is very slow so just be prepared. Nothing is quick. The pool bar also has happy hour every day which was fun and affordable I can't say how much of a value it was price-wise as we stayed using Hilton points. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to San Diego and cannot wait to go back some day. it is a beautiful city with lots to do and absolutely perfect weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Fab65Roma_Italy
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located just few minutes from downtown and very close by to Seaworld. So if you want to plan a family's vacation focused on Seaworld is perfect but that's all. This is an average resort hotel you are not expecting from the Hilton. The infrastractures are old and mamy of the area are dirty, I spent many morning around the concierge to get connected with Wi-Fii and this area aws always full of paper, glasses, while the floor was really dirty. The breakfast was good, with just one machine (!!) for the toasting the bread. The rooms were large enough but it is almost incredible the lack of accessories in the bathroom, if you need anyhting else than body wash and shampoo you have to ask at the concierge. The staff was friendly and helpful out that the young waitress at the pool, they looked a little bit "spoiled".

Reviews.Title: “Personnel needs some work”
Reviews.Author: familytravel4fun
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Hilton customer so of course, I judge one against another. This resort just didn't meet up to others that I have stayed at just due to the horrible service we experienced in the restaurant. Over the course of three days we had one dinner and three breakfasts at Acqua. At dinner they wanted to seat us outside which I said would be fine as long as we had a heater and the hostess said no problem. We ended up having to ask the waiter after some time for a heater and he said the one next to us didn't work and there were no others available. There were only maybe 6 other tables and most of those were seated next to firepits! The sun went down and the fog blew in further and it was just too cold so we asked again. Turns out the heater next to us did work but the waiter hadn't been sure how to light it! It was just lazy of him. The food was fine. Overpriced as all Hilton restaurants are. It was the breakfast staff that really blew our minds. Very inefficient. Our waiter would walk all the way out to the patio and only visit one table at a time so good luck getting any drink refills or asking for the check. The hostess grumbled aloud every morning and couldn't manage a good morning or a smile. All the staff would shoulder their way through the doors and make YOU hold the doors open for them. I had overheard a table grumbling about this our first morning and thought that surely they were exaggerating but no, it happened the next two mornings to me. Thankfully, the last morning we had Daniel as our waiter and he was excellent. What a waiter at a busy, upscale resort should be. The buffet food was fine but the pastries were fresh and exceptional. Not a large buffet like the Cabo resort. We had a bayfront room and that was a highlight. Very spacious, really liked the decor, didn't like the mildew in the shower. Nice and quiet. There was a newborn next door and it cried alot but was very faint and didn't disturb us. The pool area was lovely but the pool itself was cool. My kids didnt mind. We liked the big checkers board. Poolside food was good (the chicken quesadilla was excellent) but again, expensive and service there was fast and friendly. Great location to see the Sea World fireworks every night. Nice to be able to jump on and off the highway but not hear the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tonyg536
Reviews.Content: Great: The front desk was exceptional and I want to make the point that William the front desk supervisor is friendly, and knows his stuff. His personal attention to my needs made may stay enjoyable and we will definitely be back. Additionally, the bar, Acqua, pool and beach personnel are all worth mentioning. Okay: my wife's experience at the spa was okay. She wants to be pampered at a spa and she was left on her own and forced to fend for her self at times

Reviews.Title: “Great Property All Around!”
Reviews.Author: ashdoyle
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort for training with my work and I loved it! It is a beautiful property and the staff was wonderful!! The Conference Center is in the middle of the property so it was easily accessible from any room. Also, I am a runner so it was nice to have the Bay right outside my door so I could go for an evening run and enjoy the cool weather. The Front Desk staff and Bellmen staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations to dining and other activities. I am looking forward to visiting the property again in the future with my fiancé. Ashley Doyle

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip at Wonderful Resort--Can't wait to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: Review4uLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from June 28-June 30th with my family incl 2 kids (ages 6 & 4). TC at the front desk was amazing. She kindly upgraded us for reasonable fee (originally booked rooms on priceline) to beach front villa with fire pit. Helped me keep my promise to my little ones to have sand just steps from their hotel room. Made s'mores in our own personal firepit (hotel store has firewood and smores kits) and memories that will last a lifetime. Loved that beach was just steps from our back patio. My kids couldn't stay away from the sand, sun, and fun. Beach/vacation music could be heard from boat dock nearby. Absolutely lovely. Beautiful sunset view and fantastic view of fireworks from Sea World, nightly. Couldn't ask for me. Rooms (other room was garden view villa) were clean and remodeled. TC waived charge for upgrade on this one. She was considerate of handicap accessibility for my mom too. Beachfront villa had wet bar and mini-fridge. Garden view double queen was small, but clean and modernized. Pool area was perfect size for kids and adults. The 2 spas were never crowded. Very family friendly without being overrun by unruly kids. Would be romantic for couples as well. Wish we had rented surreys and/or bikes and cruised around. Downsides: Didn't let us check in until close to 4 for one room and 4:30 for the other, but allowed us to check out late in one room. We enjoyed the pool area until our rooms were ready. Food prices were very high. Aroma cafe only open limited morning time with limited selection. Outside food places limited. However, the food quality was excellent. Happy hour deals were good too. Skip Sea World and have your little ones simply enjoy the beauty of the Bay from the comfort of your hotel room. Bring your own bikes, scooters, skates, etc. Parking fee of $25 was high. Free internet in hotel lobby. Best vacation we've had in a long time. Thanks, TC! Can't wait to come back!!! Don't hesitate to choose this hotel. Other Mission Bay properties do not have this beautiful and usable beach front.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware - Definitely Not a Resort or Spa”
Reviews.Author: Jr2012
Reviews.Content: This place is the definition of a poorly managed property that misrepresents itself as a "Resort & Spa". The negatives start with some noisy children running up and down the hallways, knocking on random doors at 11:00 PM. The worst part wasn't the noise so much as management's lack of concern after I and other guests complained. And we were in the villas which are supposedly an upgrade over the tower. I can only imagine what it is like in that building. In addition, the sauna, locker rooms and showers close at 8 PM which is ridiculous for those of us who wanted to end the day with a nice steam. When asked why they close so early, we were surprised to be told by management that the spa isn't owned by the hotel and they have no control over its operating hours. It seems misleading that this property rerpresents itself as a "spa" when they have little or nothing to do with its operation. There is a positive. We were so disappointed with this place that we did not want to spend a second night as planned so we checked out and were not charged for leaving early. Something tells me that this situation happens fairly frequently. If you are a seeking a hotel for relaxation, peace and quiet, romance or spa services, this is NOT the place for you. If you have a family or are with a group where you don't want to worry about keeping noise levels down or keeping your kids under wraps, then this might be a good fit if you can get a room for under $200 (and it's only that high because of it's location on Mission Bay), but be prepared to pay $25/day for unsecured parking and $11/day for internet. It's definitely not worth the prices they try to get during peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: adamafolous
Reviews.Content: My family's stay was fairly pleasant. There wasn't anything special about this hotel but the location. It was close to everything. You are about 7 miles from the zoo, 1 mile from Sea World, 7 miles from La Jolla Cove, 30 minutes from Legoland, 30 minutes from the best outlets Las Americas and about 10 minutes from downtown. Restaurants were also very close. The only two negative things about the hotel was the $25 a night parking and the dirty toilet in our room. It was filthy in places people can't tell unless they really look. Breakfast buffet was $20.95. I think that is a bit pricey for eggs. The grounds were lovely and the weather was pleasant. Tip: skip the zoo if you have a zoo at home. It is just like a regular zoo, nothing special. La Jolla Cove is a must. It is not far and it is beautiful. You are able to view seals. Don't forget your gps. You will never get lost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond121
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel with our 11 yr. old grandson. We loved the convenience to Sea World and Old Town. The food at Fresco's (the pool bar) was great, and the bartender, JV, couldn't have been better. He made a Roy Rogers (fountain cherry coke) for our grandson that was so good both my husband and I ordered one, too. The hotel isn't new, but our room was clean, and everything worked properly. The hotel grounds are beautifully manicured, and the fire pits conveniently located around the property are a nice touch for cool San Diego evenings. We found the staff to be efficient, professional and attentive. This was not my first visit to this hotel, and once again I was pleased that we had selected it. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Here...and we're looking forward to our 3rd/4th/5th...!”
Reviews.Author: Holiday143
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (6 & 4 years old) stayed here this past month (June 2011), for 4 days/3 nights. We were pleasantly greeted by William at the front desk who advised our party our complimentary upgraded room was available at 12pm vs the regular 4pm check in. We enjoyed the many amenities including paddle boats, paddle boards, jet skis, beach, pool, happy hour, spa....the list goes on. We decided during our stay to add an additional night which William again was able to accommodate our request even during the peak season. We look forward to our return to the fabulous resort and HIGHLY recommend you and your family to book a week of relaxation and fun at Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: suethenurse29
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the beauty of this resort, the grounds were lush and so close to the water. There were many activities you could partake in, but what a cost to do them! It isn't a quiet place, lots of kids, and weddings on the weekends, but if you don't mind that and the cost, it's a great place to stay. My one issue is they don't have WIFI in the rooms. For a very expensive place, that has a lot of business confrences, you would think they would be more up to date, dial-up is not acceptable! Also I really think that if you are going to charge so much for a room, you shouldn't have to pay 25.00 a night to park too! The best part was the free fireworks right out our terrace every night, compliments of Seaworld. It was an unexpected treat, and very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: kraybrig
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility with so much to offer, between the pools,games, beach etc it was difficult to decide what to do. Fabulous location for families and friends regardless of age. You can park your car and stay for days and you will love every minute. The staff was most accommodating and it was obvious that excellent customer service is a priority. It had a very nice design both interior and exterior, reminded me of a Hawaiian resort. Food was also great.

Reviews.Title: “thank goodness for the front office staff”
Reviews.Author: gg3229
Reviews.Content: My family and I went on our 5 day vacation and ran into a problem at a hotel in the Gaslamp quarter. We called the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. Rod at the front desk completely took care of us. He was so wonderful!! Then the next day we need some additional help and William was at the front desk. I could not believe how much he went out of his way to accommodate us!! I have never been treated so well. I just want to say that Rod and William really saved our vacation and we are so appreciative. We will come back to this hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Making fun memories”
Reviews.Author: ronaldk819
Reviews.Content: Our 16 member family had a wonderful weekend at the Hilton resort. It was like traveling to a south sea isle. We really enjoyed speed boating around the bay. The kids had a great time in the pool, playing checkers on the large pool side boards and feeding the ducks and Koi. The Fresco restaurant food was fantastic - tasty and hot served by friendly and caring staff. Whether we were at the breakfast buffet or casually elegant dinner, everything was perfect. We even saw and heard the firework display from SeaWorld. We had a better view than being in the park. Our rooms were spacious, comfortable and cool. We had a great view of the beach and just a few steps to the beach and fire pits. One night we had fire and ate Smores while the kids played. Our maids cleaned up the family mess everyday so we always had a fresh room and toilet area. Our patios gave us a home base for biking, walking and water biking. The hot water of the jacuzzi really helped relax us all at the end of the day. The pool side bar and restaurant has a very pleasant and helpful staff who gladly moved umbrellas and heat lamps around to make our visits very comfortable. You can really relax from the moment you check in to the moment you leave. This Hilton is truly a resort experience that makes memories that everyone will cherish.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa for a family vacation because It the perfect hotel to go to for par”
Reviews.Author: GBELL222
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa for the weekend with our family. There were 13 of us including 5 children from 18 months to 6 years. There was so much for all of us to do. The kids loved feeding the ducks and the fish. All of the Hotel staff were wonderful. The food and the service was A+. Kevin always welcomed us with a smile and had tables set up for our large group. He kept checking to make sure we were happy and the children had whatever they needed. Ignacio remembered what all of us ordered to drink the first morning for breakfast and brought it to us when we sat down for breakfast the second day. From the welcoming staff at the front desk, the staff who were very helpful in the pool area, the friendly ladies in the wonderful gift shop to the best food and wait staff, I would highly recommend any family go to the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa for their vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: avivaleah
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights while we were on vacation. There are five of us so we had to get a fold-out bed which made the room pretty small, since it wasn't that big to begin with. There was a musky smell to the room which we figured was due to the hotel being on the Bay. The beds were not comfortable unfortunately but the room was clean. Parking our car was sometimes difficult since there were not enough spaces near the rooms, but we were told to make a space. My husband gets free breakfast vouchers since he travels a lot, so we ate at the restaurant every day. The food and service was very good. Also, we were very pleased with the great location of the hotel. Most places we went to were only a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Overrated”
Reviews.Author: dallascowboys1960
Reviews.Content: The clerk at the counter @ ck.in TC was very helpful as she put us in our room 2 hours early on Sat the 4th when we arrived in San Diego.But the room for a Hilton Resort was overrated as the AC didn't cool, the door had an opening at the bottom as the door seal was missing and you see day light coming in.also the room had a very strong odor.we asked for another room and it wasn't until Monday the 6th that we were moved down the hall in to a like room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: trcscott712
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay last week it was our anniversary and Alyssa at the Front Desk was amazing. she accommodated our every request and to her a big thank you. she was both friendly and helpful, we will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT resort and location for my family with young kids!!”
Reviews.Author: themitchells8
Reviews.Content: I took my family to San Diego for the Memorial Holiday Weekend and we stayed at this wonderful resort. I have never stayed at resort that accommodated our needs as much as this place did. There are all kinds of activities to do, plus they are centrally located to all the parks and ocean. I was very impressed how clean and updated the resort was. As soon as we stepped foot on the property I was greeted by a friendly staff and helpful service. I instantly new we had chosen the right place for our family vacation. The front desk staff was very knowledgeable about the area and answered all questions that I had. When we arrived at our room, we were able to park directly in front of our door which was a huge plus considering parking in San Diego is hard to find. Once we were in our room we not disappointed. The room was very clean, large and it had a huge sliding glass door. When that door was all the way open, it seemed as if the entire patio and outdoors were part of the room. We had a garden view room which allowed us to watch our children play in a large grass area while my wife and I had a glass of wine on the patio. When the kids were bored with the lawn area we were only steps from the pool and the beach. With this hotel being on the bay it allowed my two boys to play in the sand and water yet not have the fear of them being tackled by large waves or the crowd of Mission Beach. The pool and restaurants are top notch. The pool is large and has an awesome relaxing atmosphere...a real oasis (plus it has a kiddie pool for the little ones). The restaurant on site has spectacular views of the bay where my family and I were able to watch wind surfers from the patio and enjoy our meal. Because the resort is on the boardwalk we had the opportunity to explore all of Mission Bay by way of walking or by bike. We actually rented a four seater bike (through the Hilton) and cruised the boardwalk for an hour. What a great way to cover lots of ground yet still be able to appreciate your surroundings. Finally, what is a San Diego trip with the family without visiting the parks? This place is is practically on Sea World's grounds it's so close, it's around the corner from the San Diego Zoo, and a few miles from Old Town and Mission Beach. Perfect location!! But to be completely honest, my family and I would have been perfectly content staying at the resort all weekend and never attempting to battle the holiday crowds. We will definitely stay here again and I will be recommending the Hilton Resort and Spa to anybody headed to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great family getaway but room was lacking in the details”
Reviews.Author: CAvacationmom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our experience at the Hilton as a family (kids 11 & 7). Pool is good, fun enormous checkers games, beach and yummy mojitos. Ate at the resort and food was good. Our room, however, looked nice as we walked in but after spending time there, noticed that the table was pretty beat up, the upholstered headboard had half the brass studs missing on one side, the closet was the old closet doors only with updated handles. It's a nice resort but I think lacking when you consider it is a 4-star with a $250/night plus $25 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: BKahler
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego with our family. We rented 5 rooms and had children from 4 months to 15 years and the property is amazing. The grounds were beautiful with a great pool and beach access. We rented bikes and also went to Sea World for a couple of days. The location was great we were to Sea World with a short 5 minute drive and we were able to watch the fireworks from the beach in front of the property. This was great with the children because we were able to get back to the resort at a decent time. We will definitely go back to this property it is A+.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Family Destination”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuyInAz
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip back to The Resort, this time we had a different agenda. Our first trip was to celebrate an anniversary and our 2nd trip was to take our daughters to Sea World for the first time. I cant say enough nice things about this resort that make it the "total package" regardless of what it is you want to do. I do have to highlight an individual that was superb and made our time at the pool effortless and relaxing. I believe her name was Emily and you could tell that she really enjoyed where and what she worked for. Wow! Keep up the good work out there... The housekeeping and maintenance crew was also great, you could tell that they took great pride in the cleanliness of the rooms and grounds. I cant wait to go back! My family is already talking about the "next trip to The Hilton Resort and Spa".

Reviews.Title: “Pool covered in Duck excrement!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wilko2211
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2010 as a relaxing break prior to a not so relaxing trip to Las Vegas. The hotel was nice, the room was lovely but the customer service was just shocking. Being an animal lover the ducks in the pool were a novelty for the first few minutes but it became apparent that they were not leaving anytime soon and pretty soon the bottom of the pool and the whole edge of the pool was scattered with duck excrement. I went to speak to reception at around 11am and was told that it would be cleaned up soon, but hours went by an no cleaner arrived. I went back to complain again as was greeted with 'well I am sorry you feel that way but the ducks were here long before you' and that 'you don't need to worry there is so much chlorine in the pool that you wont catch anything'. I was horrified at the terrible customer service. Eventually my partner went it to complain and was told that the cleaners had gone home and would be back at around 3pm to clean the pool. They eventually arrived at around 4pm. We went out every evening and asked for a taxi and was given the 'house' car which turned out to be 50% more expensive than a taxi. From that night we insisted on a taxi being called for us but the guy was clearly unhappy with this and once he ignored us altogether and called the 'house' car. We refused to get into it on the grounds that it was too expensive and eventually had to get a taxi number from a return journey, call it before we went out and meet it away from the hotel (they would not come to the hotel). There was however one nice gyt and on the day he was on shift he called us a taxi without any issue and didnt even call the 'house' car. I wish I could remember the rude ones name - but he wore glasses and had blonde hair. It is such a shame because the hotel in itself was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amaze79
Reviews.Content: A little far from the action. The room it self was nice and tidy with a nice balcony. Pool area was really excellent with two jacuzzi's, heated pool and loads of sunbeds. They also have fireplaces with gas/vulcano-stones - where we enjoyed margaritas before dinner. The restaurant however did not impress much. The service was not up to Hilton standards, and the food was'nt all that. The gym is not so big, but well equipt. The steam sauna did'nt get that hot.

Reviews.Title: “Service, especially front desk supervisor William Matthews, was 5-star”
Reviews.Author: billorangecounty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our daughter's family including her 4 young daughters (ages 2-10), stayed at the resort recently, booking multiple rooms. With multiple rooms, and young children, also comes the worry and stress over our assigned rooms including adjoining rooms, proximity to the pool, etc. On our recent stay, there was a misunderstanding on an early check-in promise made over the phone by one of the younger front desk employees. When we tried to initially check-in, we were told our rooms would not be ready for several hours. William Matthews overheard the conversation, during which I admittedly was annoyed. He stepped in, took control, and did everything I could have asked for, before I even had a chance to think, or ask for anything. During the rest of our one week stay, he repeatedly contacted me to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. Through my work travels, I frequently stay in 5-star hotels throughout the United States. The level of service and professionalism shown by Mr. Matthews was above and beyond the call of duty, and certainly more than could be expected by anyone. This was Spring Break in San Diego, and as one would expect the hotel was very busy. In spite of the demands on his time, he went well out of his way to show he cared about our personal experience. He really made our trip outstanding. We would not consider staying anywhere else in San Diego. I would highly recommend the resort to anyone looking for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Customer Service Ever! Will Never Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: sheng0
Reviews.Content: This has been the WORSE hotel stay I have ever experienced. My fiance and I checked into the hotel on Sunday, May 30th and had a room in the 100 villa. Our patio was walking distance from the pavillion, where a wedding was going on. By 8pm, you can hear the loud music coming from the wedding. I called front desk to ask when the volume was going to be lower and when the party was going to be over. I was told that the noise level will decrease by 10pm as it was their "hotel policy" and that the party should be wrapping up around midnight as the guests and vendors had to leave by 1am. 10pm came around and the noise level was louder than it was at 8pm. I gave wedding until 12am to decrease their volume before I complained about the noise again. Midnight came and all I could hear are drums and loud music coming from the wedding. Called the front desk and was told that they would call security and have them lower the volume. 10 minutes had past by and nothing. I got so frustrated that I went to the front desk where one of the workers and the night assistant manager, MATT, rudely told us that he could do nothing for us. Another couple complained about the noise (they were in the building across from the pavilion) and as we were complaining he rudely told us that he could do nothing for us if we continue to talk. Then he told us that he could do nothing about the situation. He was getting so defensive. What kind of Manager gets defensive when you have a irate customer who is trying to get some peace and quiet at a hotel they paid money for? He was so unprofessional and rude. He lacked the customer service skills that managers need to solve issues and complaints made by their customers. That was the WORSE customer service I have ever had. Worse of all, the party ended around 3am and they would not do anything about the noise. They did comp our night, but that wasn't until many complaints and frustrations about the noise issue. It was as if they let the party go on until 3am because they comp our night. They should have thought about the noise level before assigning guests to the villas and rooms near pavilion. How inconsiderate! Worse of all, they charge and arm and a leg for parking...$25 for a night. I would stay away if I were you!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service from Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: terrth
Reviews.Content: The location is beautiful. The restaurant and gift shop staff were friendly and helpful. The food was good. The pool area was clean and very pretty. they are on a good walkway for beach walking and there was plenty of sailboats, wave runners and bokes to rent. The room itself wasnt real clean. Room service was quick. My main issue was the Front Desk staff was so rude and had no customer service skills. From the moment I checked in - I felt as if it was an inconvenince for them to assist me. I tried to check in early as I was coming from one San Diego Hilton to another from business to pleasure. The Staff member checked me in and then told me he would call the cleaning crew to see if they would get me into my room early. He took my suitcase and then said he would call me. I waited 3 hours and didnt hear anything. When I called back I got someone else that said they NEVER let anyone check in and I could wait 10 more minutes. I felt I had been lied to. When I went back at check in time - another person made me go through the full check in process again and when I said I already did all of it, he said my credit card was declined..which I knew was not true. When I asked for my luggage I was not even directly responded to...and stood and waited, and had to ask again. When the desk rep gave me my key cards - he didnt even tell me what room number or how to find the room. This is a hotel which is spread out in several buildings. He called a bellboy to help with luggage and as soon as we got outside of the check in area, thebellboy passed me my key and said I could find the room and pointed the way.I struggled with my luggage as he went after what he thought was a better tip.When I got to the room, the maid was just coming out. Seriously! 4 hours later... After leaving this hotel, I realized I left my Kindle in the bottom of the room safe which was ontop of a closet shelf. (I am short and couldnt see what was in it) I called and was forwarded to Security. It took them over 7 hours to call me back. They said the room was occupied and nothing was turned in. When I asked if they could call the room and ask them to take a quick look, I was ignored and told..we have your number if it shows up. Very very lazy...and poor service. My friend called the other Hilton as she lives in the area and misundersstood which hotel I had left my Kindle in..and they called her back in 10 min and actually called the rrom and asked the guests to take a quick look...and then called back again. They were top notch...so it isnt any Hilton..it is just that Hilton that has terrible service. I wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: couturegal0818
Reviews.Content: The hilton bayfront is the best hotel in the downtown san diego area. I just spent 3 days there for memorial day weekend with my husband and 16 year daughter and let me say that the only bad thing about the trip was that we couldn't stay longer.The pool area is great the fox sports grill is excellent for a nice afternoon dinner.The best thing of all is there customer service they treat everyone like a VIP .Hilton Bayfront ur the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: johntremblay
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, Alyssa greeted us with a big smile that made us feel very welcome. It was a special occasion for our family and with the guidance of William, together they selected the perfect room to meet our needs. As a Hilton Diamond member, I expect excellent service, however Alyssa and William exceeded all of our expectations. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Always exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: fritzcorner
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend travels to San Diego a lot for work and I've gone with him many times for the ride. We have stayed in almost every Hilton-related hotel in the San Diego area and I always suggest and request that we stay at the Hilton San Diego Resort before any others. This was probably my third time staying at this hotel and although it is not really walking distance to any attractions, I feel like I'm on a vacation each time I stay there. They have a really nice gym attached to a spa (with free access to a steam room) and their outdoor pool area is really beautiful. I have yet to take advantage of any of the water sports, but I hope to do that sometime when my boyfriend has a day off. He travels so often that he is considered at Hilton Diamond Member. While I know the hotel considers these Hilton members to be somewhat of VIPs, I feel that our experience at this hotel is always exceptional, and much more than the other Hiltons we have stayed. I'd like to give two shout outs - TC at the front desk and Patricia in the gift shop: Both of these women were amazing and extremely helpful and professional. I don't always write reviews for hotels and this one is about a month overdue, but I felt it necessary to write a positive review and mention their names because our stay was really one of the best we've had in San Diego. If you are looking for a relaxing getaway that is far, but not too far from the downtown San Diego nightlife, I'd really recommend this hotel without question. It's about a 10 minute ride to the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and customer service”
Reviews.Author: bigmow33
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awesome. The location is great for anytime of year. Walk the boardwalk, you have all food, fun, sport in one location. Staff is great all around, especially William at the front desk. He provided great assistance throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place I could spend with my Family”
Reviews.Author: Araik
Reviews.Content: The Best Place I could spend with my Family!! I Enjoyed staying at Hilton! Clean, comfortable and great service. Would love to go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelnaps
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and 2 year old daughter. The rooms were great, the staff was very friendly, and the location was ideal. They have a great pool deck with a small pool for little children. The little pool is only 1 foot deep and it allows little children to play away from the bigger kids. We took our daughter to Sea World which was about a 5 minute drive away. As you can imagine, a 2 year old needs to nap. It was so nice to just be able to return to the hotel, have my daughter nap, and then return to Sea World. The hotel is also located just a few minutes from Old Town. We went to Old Town for lunch and it was a great place to walk and spend a few hours. I must admit, it is a little expensive to stay there and the $25 dollar a night parking fee is a bit excessive. There were a lot of cars and it was difficult at times to get a parking spot. For that kind of money, a parking space should be designated. We will definetly be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “honey when do we have time to go again!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleRydquist
Reviews.Content: we got married at this hotel. wonderful job they did. We decided to make sure we stay for our anniversary weekend every year. When permitted we try to go just for a short getaway as well. The staff is wonderful, Nick and Jeff are someof the regular staff members who i see there ar always awesome. It's important to us that we see employees who are still there, it gives a homey feeling. They remember us as well. Always had a great meal from the resturant, to poolside Frescos, and roomservice. They even had an easter egg hunt for children and a movie night at the pool for the family. For those in the san diego area consider this asw a wonderful way to save money and appreciate your hometown for your next vacation. have fun...Michelle and James Rydquist

Reviews.Title: “A great escape for the family”
Reviews.Author: SFWorld
Reviews.Content: Anytime I see the word "resort" I immediately think of something bigger than what many resorts can deliver. For me, resort means offering everything you need on the property for a complete vacation. If you use that idea then this property is certainly a full service hotel but not a resort. So before I go too far and you think this is a terrible hotel let me say we would go back. It's just that you need to temper your expectations. This is not a luxury resort. It's a very nice hotel in a good location (near Sea World and on the bay) that fits well with families with young children. There is a small kiddie pool (1 foot deep) and the main pool only gets to 5 feet deep and is 3 feet deep in most places- so our 4 year old had a great time by just avoiding the middle of the pool. It also draws a family crowd so he had plenty of kids to mess around with whenever he was poolside. Their kids camp is only offered in the summer months (another reason they are not a resort in my opinion) so that was not available, making the poolside encounters that much more important. As we experienced with HIlton in Hawaii we do wish they would put a bit more heat in their heated pools- it was not ice cold as it was in Hawaii but it could have been a bit warmer to make staying in a bit easier. They also had a great food option for those not wanting the full service restaurant: a 7-day happy hour with half price starters and drinks. It made grabbing a quick meal each evening much more affordable and was certainly good enough for us on several occasions. The issue is there is only the 1 restaurant and the bar area so leaving the property was inevitable unless you are really a creature of habit or just there for a long-weekend. Where is the hotel lacking? First, they charge $25/day for self parking. This is essentialy a suburban hotel so that struck me as way too expensive. Second, our expectation of the beach was quite different than the reality- it's not a sit out and sun yourself beach- it's a narrow strip of sand separated from the hotel by the bay-side walking/biking trail (the trail was a nice feature for getting out of the hotel). The rooms are spacious enough and in good (but not great) shape. The TV was new but the signal sketchy if you touched it. The two reading lights besides the beds didn't work at all and the chain on the lamp by the window pulled off on Night 1 (thankfully in the 'off' position). They also went a bit too far with the cheap flourescent bulb in the can light near the doorway which gave a harsh light when it was turned on (and was the only light in the room besides 2 lamps) that made us prefer to leave it off- and we were down to 1 table lamp for the whole room. They would fix things as you called- but you had to call. The shower on/off handle clearly looked like it was added on when the original one broke as it simply didn't look like it belonged there. They also have the old, what I call atomic toilets whose sound resonates for several floors - you will know when your neighbors above have gone to the bathroom and only a sound sleeper can sleep through a toilet flush in the room. So a bit more attention to detail would be nice. But the rooms are comfortable (though with the usual glut of pillows on the beds) and spacious enough. They also have two other features I wish they highlighted more clearly: refrigerators and an in-room safe. Being able to stock the small fridge was great but we were not aware it was there when booking. The safe is always nice given how much we just seem to have that has some value. The food was fine- good not great. It met our needs but we headed for other places just for variety. The larger number of CPK and other food boxes/bags suggested others felt the same way. It was nice to have poolside bar service though we found it odd in this day and age that the female servers were blonde and in short-shorts and short-sleeved shirts while the men practically had no skin showing besides their hands and faces. It's not offensive to me but it is a bit too obvious to go overlooked. So for a good hotel in a great location consider this property. It's not a value option by any means but it was a nice, comfortable base for our 7 days in San Diego. Hopefully they can smooth out some of the rough edges and it could be a really great place.

Reviews.Title: “LIARS!”
Reviews.Author: Zandronovo
Reviews.Content: The front desk people are liars! First we booked thru the web and never informed us of the parking fee for $25???? So we talked to one of the front desk lady and she told us she'll Just charge us $25 for 2 nights We just complied and out of trust we nod. When we checked out, we were surprised to see that they still charged us 25/night! We talked to this guy WILLIAM at the front desk and told us he'll call the lady that we spoke to about the discount and he just acted as if he was calling but actually did not!!! Please stay away from these LARS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: Zaydo
Reviews.Content: We were there for an amazing party hosted by Austin Campbell w/ Sola Salons. Beautiful day. Beautiful people. Beautiful hotel. Everything was taken care of by the staff which was very professional and friendly. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 99kev7784
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa for the third time during April 2011. The purpose of our stay was to visit with our Navy Son/Wife prior to his upcoming six month deployment. We stay at many Hilton properties during the course of a year for both business and leisure. This Hilton Property surpasses all for their focus and attention to customer service. From the maids to grounds keepers to front desk, we never had an interchange that was not met by a friendly greeting and the accommodation of our request. The leadership at this resort really has a focus on customer service embedded at all levels. What a great experience from the staff and the beautifully landscaped property. We will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Great facility,Hilton should be ashamed.”
Reviews.Author: Jgitto
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't want to spend much time on this. So here it goes: Service Sucked! They didn't know which way they were going, they didn't seem to know who was in charge. Some highlights pool wasn't heated to any level of comfort. Room service left our old trays with half eaten food outside our room for two days. I'm done.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay . . .”
Reviews.Author: megkfrank
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hilton Resort San Diego. The hotel was fine. Nothing too special. I enjoyed the grounds and the freedom my children had in running around. We especially enjoyed roasting marshmallows in the fire pits on the bay. The pool was nice, but it was pretty cool while we were there, so we didn't spend much time there. The rooms were OK as well. Definitely, an older property, but with some updates. My first room had hair all over the shower. The hotel promptly moved me to a new room with a better view. I certainly appreciated it. The new room however, had a broken TV. Once again they were very prompt in fixing it. All in all an OK hotel, but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - OVERRATED!”
Reviews.Author: rjung10
Reviews.Content: It was a decent hotel. Definitely not a 4 star in my opinion (a 3.5 star at best). The cost of parking alone made my experience go from "bleh" to "I'm never staying here again unless it's free or significantly cheaper!" The rooms were dirty and I had incredible mucus production from the dust in the room (yes - that is meant to sound gross). Some staff were 'ok' but there was one who couldn't speak English and another who was very rude to me personally. There wasn't a very resort-like feel to this property so needless to say, I won't be staying here again. I can't believe that I paid 50 bucks for parking for the 2 nights I was there. If I stayed longer (which I was considering but quickly came to my senses), that would have been $125 for 5 days - when did Mission Bay turn into Manhattan!!! Space is not at a premium here so my problem is with the price of parking, not the actual fact that they are charging. And is it just me or is it that whenever I get a deal through priceline, I NEVER get the free upgrades that everyone in front of me and behind me in line was getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, but a few details need updating...”
Reviews.Author: 2boysrus
Reviews.Content: The Mission Bay location of this hotel cannot be beat! We enjoyed being on the gentler waters of Mission Bay rather than the busy loud neighborhoods of some of the oceanfront hotel areas. On Saturday night we even got to see the fireworks from Sea World off our balcony! It was also a great spot to get around town from, with easy access to major roads and sights. We were on the 6th floor of the tower portion, and wished we were closer to the lower main hotel area. We had asked for a water view and it did qualify as that, and we were thankful not to be on the east side which faced Hwy 5! We got in after a long day's travel so we were just thankful to get to bed that night. The tower was obviously an older section, redone nicely, but the room's ventilation system smelled old damp and musty. It was too cold out to leave the screen to the balcony open to get fresh air all night. That would be nice in the summer though. We would request a non-tower room for that reason and one other. The motor noise and exhaust from shuttles, buses, limos taxis and etc that were allowed to idle between the tower and the front entrance created more echo and smell than they realize! Even a beer truck pulled by and honked me out of bed one morning at 8 AM. Thanks, Bud Light. Yeah, I should have complained. The restaurant was very nice, but maybe too nice. The whole family enjoyed the breakfast buffet, but it was too expensive for us to do every morning. It cost us almost $100 for a family of four each day with tip! That was a bit of a problem at dinner too. After tramping around the theme parks, zoos and etc. we would have loved a more casual option in the hotel for dinner. By then the restaurant was just much too formal for frazzled foot weary families to relax in. On the positive, everything we did mention to the staff, was promptly handled and things were clean and staff friendly. The breakfast was excellent and service very good. The pool was fun and the outside fire pits were great for cool spring evenings. Overall I would recommend it for those who want a way to get away from overcrowded beach areas and yet still be close to it all.

Reviews.Title: “A Tremendous Long Weekend at the Hilton Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixDesertstar
Reviews.Content: We arrived Saturday expecting little. On departure we raved we could not return quicker. The Villa Garden Room was enchanting. The few request we had were immediately granted by the gracious staff. We lingered at the bar during happy hour enjoying the ambiance and the fun crowd watching the NCAA tournament. We lounge by the pool , and the evening viewed the spectacular fireworks and fired Smores in the beach. By the way the bed was the best we ever slept.

Reviews.Title: “Best room ever!”
Reviews.Author: kp350
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member, I was hoping for a reward upgrade when I arrived at the resort. William, the desk supervisor who helped me, hooked me up with the most amazing villa, private fire pit by the beach and all! Thanks, William, you're the best! Great food, wonderful service, I'll be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: SnapDragon777
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hilton for a quick family getaway to Seaworld for the weekend. The plan was to arrive on Friday afternoon and leave Monday late morning for a return to LA. After getting to the hotel, it was clear that we would leave on Sunday morning after Seaworld. The hotel was very uncomfortable and not up to expectations. While the room seemed to have been updated with new furniture: modern style headboards and flatscreen TV, the mattresses were old and uncomfortable and the room smelled heavily of mold. The carpets had a gross damp feeling and the balcony railing paint was old and chipping. The walls were paper thin - I could hear the next door neighbor so well that I was forced to keep my television on while we slept! This hotel is in severe need of a real makeover. I would definitely not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or $$!”
Reviews.Author: remsmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night getaway to the Hilton. I can't recall the last time I've stayed in a worse hotel. To begin with, there was a huge convention going on, and so the staff couldn't be bothered to help my little family. No matter that we had 3 huge suitcases and a baby! No bell person or anyone at all to help with the bags. Then, we had to wait until after 4:30 for our room to be ready (no matter that check in is supposed to be at 4:00). Once we finally got to our room (which had banged up furniture, worn out carpeting and quite possibly the least comfortable beds I've ever slept on in a hotel), we realized that the photos on the website are totally misleading. They must have had a spectacular photographer because this hotel is, at best, the quality of a Super 8, and certainly not worth paying more than $59.00!!! Bottom line? Believe the bad reviews and stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Resort perfect for a family vacation or business trip”
Reviews.Author: fabs92130
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa for a business lunch. I was so impressed with the customer service provided by all staff members that I felt compelled to write a review to give them kudos for caring so much. During my visit, I was even greeted by the hotel's General Manager and Director of Sales. Wow, they make time to greet business people who visit the property! I asked for a tour to familiarize myself with their hotel, and was able to see a room in one of the towers. The view is amazing and could imagine watching the fireworks from one of these rooms during the summer season (think Sea World Fireworks, the best I've seen). The room decor was contemporary and nice. I'm very picky and dislike old carpets in hotels. This is not that kind of propety at all. What I liked the best, is how nice, clean, flat and calm is the ocean water in front of this hotel. This is the perfect place for a family wtih kids since it offers privacy and a calm beach front. This is completely the opposite of those busy beaches in Mission Beach. They also offer rooms with fire pits, which I think would be the best because I have boys and we love doing this kind of thing. if you eat at their main restaurant, the food is amazing, and their tuna tartare is delicious, you must try it! I highly reccommend this resort for anyone who wants to relax for a few days and disconnect from a hectic life. I know I'm coming back and bringing my family next time.

Reviews.Title: “Surly receptionist, lack of decent lounge/bar”
Reviews.Author: JOHUk
Reviews.Content: Checked in by very friendly receptionist and was given an upgrade so that we were near the pool, which the kids loved. The corridor to the room was a bit grim and I was a bit apprehensive but our room was small but nice. Next day asked different receptionist for details on the trolley bus tour and she basically threw a leaflet at me and grunted that we'd already missed it! Breakfast was included in our package and was good and the staff were very friendly and helpful. In the evening the one bar was very dimly lit and short on space, it really did seem to small for a hotel this size. If I was visiting San Diego again, I think I would definitely stay closer to the city as this hotel is a good car ride out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Meeting Venue with a Lovely Resort Feel!”
Reviews.Author: trihud
Reviews.Content: I am a meeting planner who plans meetings all over the country and I love to have my events at the Hilton SD Resort! I plan medical meetings for lab techs and doctors and the venue satifies both the needs of our physicians who travel with their families and our techs who are usually single female attendees. The accomodations are lovely, the staff is friendly with great can-do attitudes, and the meeting rooms are just what we need. I have planned multiple events at the Hilton SD Resort and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs attention at the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Honors Diamond member and stayed 2 nights this month on Honors reward stay. Upon arrival, I'm greeted at the entrance by the bellmen and I wan't offered any luggage assistance. They saw me carrying 2 suit cases and a computer bag, but chose to keep conversing with each other. At the point of check-in, the front desk agent didn't offer luggage assistance either, so I had to ask her if someone was available to help me (this took a few minutes). I called the Guest Service hotline to have my room serviced at 11:00am. only to come back at 12:00 and it still wasn't done. I placed the card on my bed for a linen change and the housekeeper left the same dirty pillow cases on my bed. I checked in to find someone elses hair on my bathroom floor as well. I tried to ask for an hour later for checkout as I was moving to another Hilton hotel my day of checkout. The male front desk agent was very quick to cut me off and say "we're full tomorrow and have to get all the rooms turned quickly". This is what you don't want to hear when you're a Hilton Diamond member and patronizing other Hilton properties. The view was nice from my room and the restaurant served great food. Other than this, I will not be returning to the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa until they improve on their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You for your Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: SDAngie1983
Reviews.Content: In the past year our family has stayed at the Los Angeles (airport) Hilton, The Anaheim Hilton, the Torrey Pines Hilton and most recently the Hilton on Mission Bay. I just wanted to comment that the Hilton on Mission Bay was by far the most enjoyable experience of the four. The room and view were awesome, however the courtesy shown by all your staff was greatly appreciated. Your hotel would be first on my list to recommend to all my friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend rendevous”
Reviews.Author: supataco
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by the hotel personal. Really nice, courteous and professional. Our interaction with the front desk staff was also very friendly and quick service. they gave us good directions to our suite to make it easy to get to. the room was perfect. we had a bayfront suite. the view was amazing and the size and comfort of the room was undescribable. it was fully furnished and clean. i would highly recommend the bayfront view rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant!!!”
Reviews.Author: ammcclin123
Reviews.Content: I have lived in San Diego my whole life and never once been to the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa, man have I been missing out! The hotel itself was goregous, right on the beach with a beautiful pool and many fire pits. In addition the beautiful grounds, the hotel has an amazing restaurant. The food was fabulous, I have not one complaint about it. If you are planning on eating there ever i highly reccomend the Tuna Tartar. All in all I would say this is an awesome hotel to stay at if you are visting San Diego or a native like myself!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Janly
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the resort were very kind and helpful. The housekeeping service was excellent, every evening when I returned, the room was spotless. The location is close to everything but requires a car. Unfortunately he weather was not as warm as I expected so I did not get to enjoy the pool or the beach front. The resort is also showing it's age, the walls are thin so everytime a toilet flushed I could hear it. I was also entertained by a marital argument in the adjoining room, not so great if you are trying to sleep. Knowing what I now know about San Diego, I likely would have stayed closer to downtown and taken the Old town Trolley Tour to Balboa Park. Would have saved on the car and the daily $25.00 parking fee at the resort. If you are just in SD for R&R and the weather is good, then this is a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A chill zen like extension of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this resort for an extended period (approximately four weeks) and combine the ambiance that is San Diego with the chill aura if this hotel and you have a winner.  Our manager Justin McCabe was very accommodating to our work group and the entire staff made this a highly enjoyable stay during my offside assignment.  I found the staff to be very eager to make my stay a perfect 10. I stayed in room 310 the entire stay which opens up to a beautiful stretch of Mission Bay.  Night was my favorite time to chill in my little pod chair next to a blazing fire pit- awesome zen like experience.  It is a spectacular location but you should be prepared to have a car.  It is an expansive resort but not easily accessible by public transportation to the sights and sounds of Downtown San Diego.  I'm an Hhonors Gold member and would not hesitate staying there again.  And Justin if you're reading this- thanks again for everything you did to accommodate us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: runningaround_456
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego to participate in an athletic event. I had gotten the group rate (for 2 queens) and as I was alone, I was upgraded to a king room, complete with a kitchenette and patio. It was a very beautiful room (a bit of cork on the floor, so not immaculate, but very clean) and I had a nice view. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quite large. I was sad that I only got to stay one night as it was near the "adult spa" with a hot tub and I didn't get to use it! I dined with a friend at the on-site restaurant as we were both car-less and the food and the dining experience were both excellent. Granted, I got a great deal on the rate as part of the event, but it really was a lovely hotel and I was sorry to leave so soon. I had a great nice of sleep and would have enjoyed a longer stay and someone to share it with!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sleepyforestcottages
Reviews.Content: We love to stay here. It is absolutely beautiful and beyond expectations. We stayed with our family and a friends family and had 2 rooms facing the bay. Out the back doors were fire pits, huge comfy chairs, a huge beautiful lawn and the water. When we arrived we got some wood bundles and smores kits for the fire. Less than 5 minute drive to Sea World! The service is great, and the kids LOVED the pool and spa. Beautiful area, our favorite to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location if you are a tourist.”
Reviews.Author: AAwa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not centrally located. Each cab ride will cost 25 to 35 dollars to go one way to tourist destinations. Some of the staff was friendly and the hotel was decent. I expected more of what the pictures showed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a National Sales Meeting with a little fun on the side!”
Reviews.Author: cocolick
Reviews.Content: We hosted our annual sales meeting at this location in January. The weather was great, particularly loved by our East Coasters currently living in inclement weather. The conference center is centrally located with a variety of room sizes to fit various needs. We had a number of role playing scenarios in which we needed to customize the layout of each of our rooms. They were very accommodating and instrumental in supplying additional furniture needed. The food is NOT your typical "hotel' food. I cannot express how important this is when you're hosting a 5-day meeting. The onsite restaurants/snack shops (Aqua and Aroma) were nice options as well. Great wine makes people happy! The hotel staff from AV, catering, concierge, etc., were always present, ready, and willing to assist as needed. A great bunch of high energy folks! It really attributes to the success of a meeting. The beach front property (Garden by the Bay) was gorgeous and was the point location for our volleyball team building event. The food was catered by the hotel, again very tasty. The hotel partners with a company called Arrangements Unlimited. We used them to plan and facilitate this event as well as for ground transportation to bus our team to and from the Gaslamp for a night out on the town. Lastly, after all that, you cannot come here and not go to the spa...I get relaxed just thinking about them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galileo321
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying in this hotel; it was clean, luxurious, wonderful bed, sheets, pillows. The only issue I had was that I was charged $25.00 for parking unexpectedly. I called down to the front desk in the morning after I saw the bill slipped under my door. They said I initialed it the night before. I stated I was never told I was being charged $25.00 to park in this hotel. It wasn't until I called Hilton, that the manager was kind enough to remove the untold charge. He was kind and courteous, but it wasn't the initial response.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, for a "resort" it is just ok...”
Reviews.Author: Pharmrep79
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego "Resort"...what can I say---I wasn't impressed. Overall, there is nothing inherently wrong with the resort, but it just underwhelmed me. First, off the pictures on the website made it look as though this resort was on the ocean proper. Yeah, I guess if you look really closely and read very carefully you will be able to discern that the water in the pictures is from more of a river that is located behind the hotel. Just know---this is not the ocean. The water is dead still and the beach isn't that great. Yeah, they have boats and things to rent, but the water is pretty unimpressive, unless you have never been to a real ocean before. The Hilton is located in the middle of a large park, as well, so there are plenty of people around and the walkways are filled with people riding bikes--not very nice to walk on (good for riding bikes though). The grounds look pretty nice, so I can give that a plus. The pool seemed too small for the resort, and though it was nice, is guaranteed to be crowded, all the time. This is a pretty good area to check out some beach bodies, however. I am a Hilton Diamond VIP and though I wasn't treated poorly, I never felt as though I was being treated any different than the average Joe, despite the hundred plus nights I stay at Hilton properties yearly. This is ok for a Hampton Inn, but at a resort I feel as though this is a bit of an insult. The hotel check in time is 4pm, which is fine, but I tried to check in about 45 minutes early, and was told that the room wasn't ready and that it was a nice room and that i should wait and they will call me when it was ready. Other people were checking in and going to their rooms, so I thought "this must be a really nice room and I am getting upgraded like I should be given my Diamond status". I wait till 4pm and they call me to let me know my room is ready. I go to the room and it is just a regular room (#406 on 02/12/11-02/13/11)!!! No different than any other Hilton hotel in the U.S. No different than any other regular room in the hotel, except that the outside area, which are nice and have a couch/bed thing, is connected to another rooms outside area, because we are a corner room! The building we are in is shaped like an L, and our room and the room next to us are on opposing sides of the inside of the elbow. So our outside area is virtually unusable, unless you like being that close to your neighbor with no separating feature (the rest of the rooms have a wall). That was a disappointment, especially after I waited thinking I was getting an upgrade to a "nice room". The room wasn't bad, again standard Hilton, but wasn't "special", I expected more from a "resort" though. It was particularly noisy, however. It seemed to have a "water running through pipes" sound that never ceased, even at night. Anytime anyone walked by and was talking we heard the conversation loud and clear, because the front door had qaurted inch gaps on all sides between it and the jamb. Not a big deal in warm San Diego, but not a good sound dampening system. There is only one restaurant (that I found--the hotel info book is useless), which is the same as any other Hilton. We ate breakfast at the restaurant, "Acqua" (Diamond VIPs get free breakfast, which is nice), and it was really pretty good, so I can't complain there. You will need a car, though, if you plan on eating anything that isn't $30 a course. I wasn't charged for parking, but you are normally supposed to pay, and so I give them credit for not charging me, I guess that makes up for any other lack of VIP benefit. We also were given two bottles of water at check-in for being VIP members, so again they did give me some benefits. This hotel is nice for what it is---a hotel, but as far as being a resort, just know that it has that title predominantly because it has a spa. I probably wouldn't recommend it unless you got a great deal and you just need a place to stay,---like a regular Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DFNizzi
Reviews.Content: Arrived at check-in early and was warmly greeted by William and Angie. I requested and received an upgrade as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary for a 3-nt stay. The grounds are beautiful, much like Hawaii, surrounded by Mission Bay parks and walkways. The hotel is right on the bay with it's own dock with daysailors and paddleboats for rent. Amenities within 10 min are SeaWorld, Old Town, downtown, Fashion Valley, and LaJolla. Very close to ocean beaches. The only negative was an unhappy daytime bartender who was put out by being asked (as recommended by the desk and restaurant) to fix me a latte. He grumbled and went into the kitchen, returning with a small cup of unflavored latte, only 2/3 full, with the rest foam. The charge was $4.89. The room was spacious, clean, and had a wonderful balcony facing the bay. We were not charged daily parking as thought. Checkout was a breeze. We had small dinners but regular breakfasts each day. The food was very good. I would not hesitate to stay here again and would refer others to it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton San Diego is like going back home every time I visit”
Reviews.Author: fionahendricks
Reviews.Content: I have personally been using this resort for 14 years booking conferences. I have worked with the same wonderful staff and know that the service and quality will be consistent. The location is a nice change from being downtown yet easily accessible. Feels like you are also on vacation and has great walking trails close by. Highly recommend the resort for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “the hilton resort offered the right combination of luxury and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: mheskin
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the hilton resort for a week to host a business function. the resort staff was extremely accommodating prior to my arrival and throughout the week. they did everything in their power to ensure our meetings occurred smoothly and never hesitated to assist at any given moment. the resort grounds were lovely and the the views of the water in the background were very nice. the aqua and olive restaurants served delicious meals. i hope to return and enjoy the resort when i'm not there on business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheriecrafts
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel numerous times and have enjoyed it everytime! The rooms, the pool, the surrounding, are perfect!

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel and surrounding area!”
Reviews.Author: bahash
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was GREAT! Excellent service, nice beds, and great pool area. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: tdiomede
Reviews.Content: My company does 50 big conferences/yr and we just wrapped up 1 at this hotel this week and am in the process of planning our next for week long event in March. We do about 3-4 events/yr at the Hilton SD Resort because we Can. The Service, Meeting Staff, Space, Leisure Atmosphere all add to the Amazing Experience for our Events. We look forward to booking each & every SD conf. we do at the Resort because we know not only will it be seemless for us meeting planners but the attendees will Love it too... I Highly Recommend this property to Anyone looking to travel here on business or Pleasure. It Truly is a welcome oasis especially to anyone looking to escape the brutal winter alot of us are experiencing in many parts of the country.

Reviews.Title: “Unique business and incentive travel location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: latinlee
Reviews.Content: As a corporate conference director, I did a site visit to check them out at their location right on San Diego's Mission Bay. Although the hotel is only a few minutes from the airport and SeaWorld on Interstate 5, it is a quiet, even idyllic property that is one of maybe a hand full in San Diego that is right on the water. The function space has what most lack in San Diego, which is windows with a view of the bay and the palm trees around the large location. Even though it is a mega-sized location in terms of number of guest rooms, it is spread out among several buildings covering a lot of lush gardens so it doesn't have the feel of an urban conference hotel. I like the sleeping rooms and the fitness center, but I really enjoyed the food, which is sort of California-Spa-Austrian (their executive chef is apparently from Austria and has a nice wine collection.) The only draw back I could see is that I was eyeing the tennis court, the pool bar and rental boats -- not to mention the spa -- and might be tempted to bug out on meetings (if I weren't the one organizing them!)

Reviews.Title: “Service and hospitality impeccably delivered”
Reviews.Author: Sharon010244
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my gratitude to my conference mgr., banquet mgr. and conference room set up staff. Your service and hospitality was impeccably delivered with friendliness and expediency. Every issue was addressed with a "can do" attitude and resolved to my complete satisfaction. It truly was a pleasure doing business with you and your wonderful staff. Thank you for a very successful conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and staff, location; nice rooms - the complete package.”
Reviews.Author: jb98102
Reviews.Content: We've been using the Hilton Mission Bay Resort for many years for our meetings and find their service to be great, with friendly, helpful staff -- a number of them who have been there for many years. The location is great on the water -- a good business hotel with a resort feel, but close to the airport and downtown too. It is nice to be able to step outside your door after work for a quick run along the water and surrounding parks. The sleeping rooms are spacious, comfortable and functional. It is the complete package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: guesswhati
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe the beauty of this property. Great Sunsets from your beachside lanai. A fantastic Pool with Cabanas and a faux Beach entrance to the pool The staff under the management of William does everything to accomodate the guests. No task is too small you are left to ffeel very special and important.

Reviews.Title: “The overall quality and service at this hotel is unbeatable! I can see why groups want to bring their business here!”
Reviews.Author: vthein
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel often and hold many conferences here. The service is excellent! You couldn't ask for a better catering and banquet staff. They anticipate your needs and help you create the perfect event. The sales staff is wonderful to work with. They work with any budget and put together a contract that is win-win for both sides. They are flexible if dates need to be changed and will work with you on any addendums. The hotel is conveniently located on the 5 freeway and is only 15 minutes from the airport. The hotel rooms are new, clean and comfortable. I love the decor! The property is very serene and calming and in a beautiful location in Mission Bay. The executive chef is amazing! The restuarant is upscale and trendy yet reasonably priced. The banquet food is just as great! I can't wait until my next event there this year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property! Amazing food! Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: nocturnal00
Reviews.Content: We have several conferences at the Hilton San Diego Resort and I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this property. The staff are so helpful, friendly and accommodating. The restaurant has amazing food because Chef Herman prepares delicious and healthy food which can be enjoyed with a beautiful view of the water. The location is right along the bay and has a great running path which goes along the entire bay. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, stinky rooms - shame on Hilton”
Reviews.Author: AroundGlobe
Reviews.Content: Overall, it's a good hotel. Very scenic location, beautiful villas, very good restaurant, great a la carte breakfasts. But all of these means nothing when you enter your room. It's worn out but what's more disgusting it's incredibly stinky! I think it's because of their old carpets that have absorbed all the disgusting smells in this humid climate. And each night up to several times you wake up from this choking smell even with the opened terrace door.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DrTom47
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here for a week. This very special hotel has wonderful amenities (including fine food) and great staff. Its attractive location is easy access to wherever you want to go in San Diego or further up the coast.. We'll book there again without looking elsewhere. It's a Mecca worth discovering!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations - great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: maryann11
Reviews.Content: My husband & I decided to take a trip to San Diego as our Christmas present to each other and our two children, who are 20 & 26 years old. We booked two rooms at the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa as part of a Southwest Vacation package, and we stayed from 1/1/11 to 1/6/11. Our package included two free nights per room, which turned out to be a great deal. I was completely satisfied with our room accomodations, and would highly recommend the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa.
