When we checked in, our room was not quite ready, as it was early in the afternoon. The young lady at the desk asked for our cell phone number and told us they would call when our room was ready. She gave us a key we could use to look around the hotel property, then we headed for Balboa Park. When we got back at 4:00 p.m., we had not received a call, so I just assumed they forgot to call. Actually, the room still wasn't ready, so they upgraded us to a better room! We got a very spacious room on the second floor of one of the wings with a great view of the ocean. We thought it might be noisy, because I-5 is very close to the hotel, but our room was exceptionally quiet. The boys had a room on the first floor which wasn't quite as spacious as ours, but still had a great ocean view. The beds were awesomely comfortable - I slept like a baby. We had one minor maintenance issue (the bathroom door squeaked which was annoying when we had to get up at night), but that was quickly resolved when I told the folks at the front desk. The property was lovely. Even though it was unseasonably cold in San Diego, the boys used the pool (which was heated nicely, according to them) and the hot tub, which they really enjoyed. I used the fitness center, which was nicely appointed with treadmills & ellipticals and weight equipment. I struck up a conversation with a local woman who was on another elliptical, and she told me that she had a membership to the fitness center there. It is pretty upscale. It even had a changing room with a sauna, lockers with digital locks and showers. There were plenty of towels. We did not eat at the hotel, but I did get coffee and danish at the coffee shop by the registration area. I waited in line for about 15-20 minutes to get my breakfast items - that was the only thing I would say could have been improved. There was only one gentleman working behind the counter, and although he was friendly, he seemed a bit overwhelmed. There was a steady stream of people waiting. There was a $25/day fee for parking, but since I knew about it and was expecting it, there was no surprise. Because the hotel was right by I-5, we were able to easily access all parts of the city with our rental car, so we explored from Coronado and points south to Torrey Pines State Reserve to Temeculah and the wine country north of San Diego. We had a wonderful trip to San Diego, and the hotel stay was part of it. I would certainly stay there again, and I would also go back to San Diego. It is a lovely town with friendly people and a more small-town feel to it than other major cities in California.

Reviews.Title: “They tried to make it newer but it didn't work.”
Reviews.Author: oualumni
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was probably one of the best in the hotel (the villas on the waterfront with a firepit.) Although the room had recently been redone, it was obvious that they spent money only on a superficial redo. For one thing they should have revamped the air ducts because it smelled old. Also,as you walked through the hallways, it looked and smelled old and my husband said that he happened to look in an open door of the housekeeping only to see paint peeling off the walls and dirty, dirty floors, etc. The grounds have not been groomed. The palm trees have not been groomed for years. We built a fire in the firepit and roasted marshmallows. (Advice, go to a nearby grocery store to buy firewood, they don't provide any, although you would expect them to for $270/night.) If you must stay here then definitely stay in the waterfront villas, but if you have a choice, don't stay here at all. It is hard to find a hotel in San Diego that is not old and run down, but listen to TripAdisor because there are obviously a few. We will listen to the reviews next time. Three cars got broken into while we were there only two nights. The restaurant was good, and the only bright spot. Hilton needs to invest a lot here or just throw in the towel. We will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “The day we left was a sad day, indeed.”
Reviews.Author: jayluvsu
Reviews.Content: Whenever my husband and I travel, I am the designated trip-booker; I love making travel arrangements, and my husband loves to let me. For our 4-night stay in San Diego, his only stipulation was that our hotel be at least 4 stars and that our room have a water view - all this, and we still wanted to stay under $200 per night. Determined to find the best deal to match our wish list, I scoured the Internet for days. The Hilton Resort and Spa was one of the first hotels I found, and it was also the one to which I ended up comparing all other possible hotels. In the end, the King Bayview Tower room at the Hilton won our reservation, and it did not disappoint. Our room was located on the 6th floor of the resort's Villa Grande Tower, facing Mission Bay. The view was everything we'd hoped it would be. The room itself was clean and tastefully decorated, and included a large, flat screen TV and a mini refrigerator. Adjacent to the resort is a public park, with a walking path that runs the length of the bay. Interstate 5 also runs along the bay next to the resort, offering easy access to San Diego's other unique districts. The only drawback to our stay was the $25 per day parking fee, but even that could not overshadow the location, the view, the amenities, and the overall experience. We would most definitely stay at the Hilton Resort and Spa again.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we had stayed one more night”
Reviews.Author: 4ComoxTravelers
Reviews.Content: The room was larger than expected, with a separate sunken kitchenette area by the patio door. We were in a first floor villa which was supposed to be oceanfront, but was set back about 4 rooms from the actual ocean. Still a very nice location. What a beautiful spot and we would have like to stay longer to enjoy the surrounding area more. Beds were very comfy. Bathroom was lacking a fan and there was no separate area to get ready in the morning which is always nice. We didn't eat at the restaurant, although the fire pits outside seemed very inviting. We did order room service which was prompt and quite good. The recommendations on dining locations were excellent. We ate at Caffe Bella Italia, The Broken Yolk, and Perry's Cafe. The free WiFi available in the lobby was not adequate during our stay. It was incredibly slow, however, the fee for in-room internet was a rip-off, especially considering it was per device. With a laptop and 2 iPhones, it was not an option. Luckily the lobby receptionist came to our aid when we were trying to check-in for our flights (thank you!). Parking is also expensive and a definite consideration when staying here. Honestly, I would rather have internet and parking included in the room rate than feel 'nickel-and-dimed' for everything. And considering these don't cost the hotel much, why are they charging for them at all? In Canada, WiFi and parking are usually free which seems more progressive. We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Need to make some changes”
Reviews.Author: pskart
Reviews.Content: The experience starts out badly when you are informed at check in that there is a $25 per night parking fee. This feels like a low-class scam, not something you expect from a higher end hotel. They also need to join the 21st century and get free Wi-Fi in the rooms. Many devices are no longer able to connect with an ethernet cable. Even cheap Econo-Lodge hotels have this feature. How hard can it be? The free breakfast is nothing special and comes with surly service. On the upside, the rooms are nice and clean and the grounds and pool area well kept and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, 3 Star Motel at best, Older property, Much better places elsewhere/by the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: osharke
Reviews.Content: ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW PROS ===== (1) Good central location for San Diego activities. Easy access to I-5 within minutes. (2) Nice Pool (3) Well manicured grounds (4) Friendly check-in hotel & maintenance staff (5) Parking in front of the room is very convenient (6) Starbucks on resort property is a plus (7) Maid service was first rate (leave a small tip each day, it is the right thing to do) CONS ===== (1) Not a true 4(four) star hotel, 3(three) at best as this is an older place that does show it's age. Bathroom are the worst, mold/grime is clearly visible on the caulking and ceiling; the need to be gutted. Upon room review, make sure to check the bathroom first and immediately request a different room at the first sign of disrepair! (2) Parking is ridiculous at $25 a night. Even if this place had a 24-hour security guard/gate it still would not be worth it. Hilton take note, Disneyland charges $15 dollars a day and they have FULL security with cameras, come on, get with it. Stop gouging us!!!! Had to budget around this cost all week, dissapointing! (3) Restaurant albeit good, WAY too expensive. NOTE: if parking were less, perhaps it could be justified. (4) Extra cost for the exercise room, nonsense for a supposed 4(four) star hotel this should be included. (5) Bay is not that pretty at all; very murky resembles more of a retention pond. Having a bay view just is not worth it....don't pay for it. NOTE: this place is not near the OCEAN, don't be fooled! (6) There were bugs in the rooms, several small spider bugs and pinchers were present. FINAL THOUGHTS =============== (1) Hotel staff during my entire 8(eight) day stay never bothered to call to check in and see if everything was ok. Very poor customer service. Four(4) star hotels are concerned with their guests comfort.....didn't seem like they were interested. (2) If you can get room for $70/80 a night, it is ok, otherwise pass on this place as there are much better places to stay in the San Diego area (Imperial (Cornado), Mission and Solana beaches, LaJolla, Carsbad, Del Mar and or Oceanside. (3) Ask for a Villa instead of the tower, you will be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my time.”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMonkey1969
Reviews.Content: I rarely get to go to a Hilton for business but was happy to get to go to this one. The rooms were comfortable and I loved to sit and be able to smell the ocean when stepping onto my balcony. My only regret is that I didn't have enough time to do anything fun and didn't get a chance to really explore the property but it looked like a great place to take a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Did the big things right but many little things wrong”
Reviews.Author: MaryBluEyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets high marks for many things like it's location (very close to Sea World and close to many San Diego neighborhoods) and it's decor (recently renovated and very large rooms). The pool area and fire pits were lovely as was the beach/park access. However, there were a number of annoying things that keeps me from giving them an above average rating like $25 mandatory (self) parking and $12 internet fees per day. There is nothing around it that justifies the need to pay for parking and you certainly didn't get any security to watch your car. As for charging for the internet (wired at that), come on it's 2010 and you're a "resort". The walls are paper thin and we could hear every step in the hall and floor above plus the adjoining room's tv and phone conversation. Also, the concierge was gone by 6pm daily.

Reviews.Title: “I'm very picky and wouldn't stay anywhere else when in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: skyman511
Reviews.Content: As a San Diego native now living in Houston, It was necessary to travel back to San Diego on October 28 to October 31, 2010. I chose to stay on your hotel during these days and was very impressed from the moment I walked in. Admittedly the entire staff, including those in the restaurant took away the California stigma we Texan’s have on Calif. They even reheated a pizza bought from somewhere else and put it in a box for me. While this may seem trivial, it was not to me. The Manager, Mr. Villarino was outstanding and always checked on us. We felt welcome from the first moment we arrived. He even made sure the bar stayed open late on the evening of our arrival, this is usually unheard of. (There was several people in our party ) The firepits in front of our rooms were cleaned out every evening, I will recommend this Hotel to anyone from now on. Thank you very much for running a business the way it should be run.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: WtoCtoTO
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at this hotel because it was selected for us by Priceline. So overall we can't complain because the price was right - about half the listed rate on their website at the time. We would NOT have been happy if we paid the regular price. This hotel is poorly located within San Diego if you don't have a car. For us, obviously a rental car was a must, and since we had one, we were able to get around easily. However, it is a scam the amount they charge for parking. This hotel is not downtown and has a huge parking lot, so having to pay is ridiculous. The hotel is situated in what seems to be a trailer park area. This is not a high end hotel by any means. It is more like a glorified motel. When we arrived, our room was not ready. They said they would call us, but didn't. So we had to wait. This is likely because we booked with Priceline and were not treated like Hilton guests. The staff at the front desk was a bit stuck up. Most other staff were more polite. The pools were very busy - good luck getting a chair during peak season. But the towels are free and easy to access. We would not stay there again unless the deal was great. There are better places for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, view, value, and clean.”
Reviews.Author: gnmartin
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel after checking out from another that did not meet our expectations. In short, we got an exceptional military rate, the room was nice, clean, with an exceptional view and patio. We did not stay long enough to utilize any of the ammenities, but it was close to Sea World, the airport, and we felt safe staying there. The view was stunning...and we would have liked to stay another day just to utilize the walking paths in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: CarmenD4
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in in my life. We stayed for 3 nights in October as part of a trip around California. If it hadn't have been a non-refundable rate I would have checked out immediately. However I also noticed that there is a $75 per person charge for an early check out so I presume I'm not the only guest that has felt this way! The main reception area is fine and doesn't indicate what awaits you. We stayed in the tower rooms, or the tower block I should say as it looks like a run down block of flats! The lobby area of the tower is disgusting, dirty carpet, scuffed walls and the dreaded pebble-dashed effect roof. There was also a funny hospital like smell which I presume is bleach of some sort. The elevator was very old and dirty looking. The room itself was certainly cleaner and the sheets were fresh but the bedspread looked gross and I dreaded to think of the dirt on it. Needless to say it was discarded immediately. Our 'view' was of the car park. Enough said. The bar/restaurant is souless and uncomfortable with average food. The location is dreadful as you are NOT on a beach as the description implies. It's on an inlet that I personally would never swim in. The pool was ok as an alternative but small. You need a car to get anywhere and the taxis were expensive. They even ripped us off there too as one evening we tried to get a taxi and they told us to take a people carrier van of theirs instead as 'ot costs the same as a taxi' the van cost $20, the same return journey in a taxi cost $13. Also they charge $30 a night to park in their carpark. Again it's a disgusting attempt at extortion. The car park is large and spaces are not in great demand. It was more expensive that car parks in 5* LA hotels we stayed in on the same trip. Would NEVER go back. Its not a hotel, a 2* motel. Give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mgaeta23
Reviews.Content: This Hilton property sits on Mission Bay in San Diego, very close to Sea World and just a few miles from Old Town. The pool area is very relaxing and the walk path just off the property is a great place to take a sunset stroll. The rooms have recently been updated and are decorated with modern furnishings. The only downside to this property is the cost for parking which is approximately $25 per night. As there are no other parking options in the area, all guests are required to pay the fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: kneemac4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hilton on Mission bay drive. When our family of 4 (kids ages 7 and 8) checked in, they put us in room 330 (located at the dark far end of the complex) but a quick phone call and we were moved to a room by the pool just as we requested (610). The room was spacious, and the bathroom was fine. There were 2 comfortable queen beds with nice linens, a sitting area with a small bar sink and frig, and a nice patio with 2 recliners. There are 2 pools, one for very young children and the other a nice large pool with zero entry. The water temp in the pool is great. There were also a couple of hot tubs which we all enjoyed. We didn't check out the restraurants. We only went to the coffee shop - the baristas always greeted the kids with a smile when they hung out for their morning cocoa. The kids loved the beach area and the proximity to sea world. Parking was a ripoff but we knew it before we went, so budget for it. The staff was pleasant and helpful. All in all - a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Failed Miserably”
Reviews.Author: PatrickHardy
Reviews.Content: From the very start this hotel failed miserably. The front desk employees could have cared less about customer service, absolutely no friendliness / interaction with any guest. The $25.00 a day parking fee and the $0.54 per minute Internet fee is a total rip off. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon and went directly from our room down to the pool for a drink and a swim. The first thing we saw was a nice inviting big resort style pool, but then we notice a large part of the pool was full of ducks and their feces and dirty towels every where. So we skipped the pool and went to one of the two Jacuzzis. The whole bottom was nothing but sand. I know that the resort is on the bay / beach, but that is unacceptable from a four star hotel. So we then tried to have a drink, but not one of their pool bars were open. The only thing open was their restaurant away from the pool area. This is the reason we chose this hotel, for the resort / pool area on the beach! The bedroom and bathroom was nice and large with a comfortable bed. The lanai door screen was completely torn up. There was mildew around the air conditioner / vent. Also this hotel is on the bay, which is completely away from any restaurants, bars and or place of entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Fur coat & no knickers, costs a fourtune...”
Reviews.Author: GSjim
Reviews.Content: Fur coat & no knickers, costs a fourtune and charges extra for everything. Rip off £20 for parking but you can't get there any other way. Below average service ( grumpy waiter) food in the returaunt ok but over priced. I I've just toured the Californian coast and this is the most expensive and worst hotel out of seven others.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called HiltonDishonors”
Reviews.Author: Ryost44
Reviews.Content: I made the unfortunate mistake booking rooms at this so called 4 star, category 7 (according to the HiltonHonors website). When we first checked in at 4:00 PM (official check-in time) room was not ready. I booked a BAYFRONT room. What I was given was a BAYVIEW room at Bayfront prices. I am a seasoned traveler and I know the difference between BAYVIEW and BAYFRONT. Apparently the people at Hilton do not know the difference. My room was room 310 in the villas. It was on the side of the building, not the front. The so called bayfront view was blocked by a three foot cement wall so you really couldn't see the bay. The room (310) was a disgrace. Wallpaper peeling the bathroom, toggle on switch missing, lamp not working, tv reception crappy, floors dirty, sprinkler in hallway outside the room leaking, dark rooms. What a dive! They should be ashamed flattering themselves by giving a 4 star rating. I don't like being lied to and deceived into trying to convince me that room 310 is a BAYFRONT room and tried to charge me accordingly. The room is a BAYVIEW. After arguing with the front desk for a second time, the manager was called and also tried to lie and deceive us into believing this was a BAYFRONT room. He finally agreed to give us the room at bayview price, but still insisted the room was bayfront. To quote Judge Judy "Don't pee on my leg and tell me it's raining." The last night we were there we were upgraded at no charge to a Bayfront room. It was too little too late, since I was aggrevated from the start by their lies and deceitfullness. I don't think I will stay at a Hilton again. So much for their loyalty program, HiltonHonors. More like HiltonDishonors. What a bunch of liars and dishonest people. The only good thing about this dive is the location. Have since cancelled my American Express Hilton DIshonors card. Do yourself a favor and stay at either a Marriott or the Best Western on Harbor Island. Nice rooms, honest people and have more respect for their guests. Their rooms are also bright, clean and updated.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but nice”
Reviews.Author: World-Explorer81
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of October I spent only one night at this luxurious hotel just right outside San Diego. It is located right at San Diego’s famous mission bay with direct access to the beach. If you like water sports, the hotel offers a large variety of possibilities such as bots and jet skis. The hotel pool is alo right next to the beach. Right on the beach one can find a public jogging trail with a great view on the bay. The downturn of this hotel is that the parking fee, which was 25 USD per night during our stay. Given the remote location there is no way to get around the parking fee, since parking outside the resort is no option. Another complaint is that the hotel did not offer free internet in the rooms nor in the reception area. Other than that I really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms were quite large and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort & Spa with all the amenities!”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuyInAz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to San Diego for our 5 year anniversary. The service levels of the front desk/concierge/bell staff at check-in and check-out were at a high level. There were other many staff members that we came across that were pleasant and it was apparent that they enjoyed where they worked and what they did (Nick the Front Desk Manager). The pool area is truly an experience and offers the lush atmosphere that you look for when relaxing by the pool. The location right on the bay offers easy access to recreation activities for everyone! We will definitely consider the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa in our future travels to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Southerntraveler9
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this great Hotel and we were upgraded to a suite on the bay , the view was wonderful and the Hotel staf was excellent. The staff was very informative and the resort was great.All rooms were very nice inside and could not be happier.Except like every hotel we stayed at you had to pay $19.00 parking in a standard parking lot . Oh well you can't have it perfect ...Oh and there is way to many choices in San Diego,could have spent weeks out there and not done it all.. Rock Hill SC

Reviews.Title: “The service was incredible, and the location is perfect for a family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: mamma03
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this Hilton. We loved being right on the bay with all of the activities to choose from, and the atmosphere was resort-like. The fire pits around the hotel made the evening fun, and the kids loved roasting marshmellows by the fire. The service was superb throughout the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hilton I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: GIHK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed over 60 nights in Hilton Properties, this is the worst. Rooms are dull, dirty and badly serviced. We changed rooms to a somewhat better room, but still found we had to ask for clean towels and the room to be cleaned. The pool was dirty and the restaurant and bar way over priced. Parking is also charged. We complained and the manager offered us a free night if we return- No way the Hilton Garden, Marriott and Double tree hotels in the area are far better. I do not recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great staff food and amenities.....”
Reviews.Author: shorehambeachUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business and overall the hotel was very good. Firstly, its on an inlet, a not very attractive bay, and just off the main high way but... The rooms very good, well serviced every day Great food - very good service from all the staff Great pool and jacuzzi Jetski/sialboat and wake board/kayak hire if you want to go on the bay (note- not the pacific sea, just the inlet) its $25 a day for park ! Ouch, but at least you get the best of being on the coast and not down town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: MauidAmy
Reviews.Content: After we picked up our rental car at Alamo, we were off to the 32nd Street Naval base. I had picked the naval base because we were splurging to stay at the Disneyland Grand Californian later in the trip. My husband is military and this is one of our final trips before he deploys. The are surrounding the base was less than desired and because my husband had just gotten off work when we left for the airport he needed a nap. I decided to bid on priceline for a 4* last minute and was given the lovely Hilton Resort and Spa for only $10 more than what we were paying at the base. I was a little worried as the reviews are mixed. I would definitely give this hotel a 3.5*/4* for its wonderful amenities. We were given a villa in the Remo area which was on the ground floor and had a patio and a HUGE lawn area that our son could burn off steam. He didn’t need to do this as the beach was right there and he rather spend his time playing in the sand. The beach looked like it was racked every morning and there was a pathway that went up and down the beach and many people used for running. The pools were wonderful too. There was a kiddie pool and bigger pool with a zero entry. There was a also a spa, with a wonderful view of the beach. Some areas of the hotel could have used a better cleaning (i.e. the waterfall and pools and wine glasses sat by room for 2 days), but they were not that bad. The room was an average room, with a refrig. The room had some areas that were worn as the other reviewers had stated, but I found them good enough. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was updated with granite countertops. We were not in the room that much as we utilized the beach a lot. We used the refrig to store milk and drinks for breakfast. The front desk attendant also mentioned that if we needed a microwave that we could rent one for $20 a day or I could just ask the restaurant to heat up my sons toddler meals. There was free wifi in the courtyard area and happy hour from the bar is everyday from 5-7pm. They will even give you a drink in a plastic cup so you could sit outside by the pool. The parking was the only outrageous thing at the resort ($25 a day) and to be honest we are not even sure they went around to look for the ticket hanging in the window. I had left it off most of the time and we didn’t have one problem. All and all, I would highly recommend this resort for anyone with little ones (our son is 2 1/2), looking for a hotel on the beach (although I wouldn’t swim in the water-too cold), a wonderful pool area, especially with the zero entry and a kiddie pool. I would also like to mention that EVERY staff member at this resort had a smile and their face and were so pleasant. I find that refreshing these days as it is hard to come by. My only regret is that we didnt have more time to stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: resortlover99
Reviews.Content: From the staff, to the service, to the location directly on Mission bay, to the pool, grounds and our suite, THIS RESORT EXCEEDED ALL OUR EXPECTATIONS ON OUR ANNIVERSARY WEEKEND. And, it feels so funny to say, but the bed was so comfortable! I rarely wake up in a hotel bed where i don't have some kind of kink in the morning, but the king bed I slept in at this Hilton (along with the pillows) put me to sleep so easily and I woke up refreshed. It was AWESOME! We've traditionally stayed at the Marriott on Coronado for our anniversary, but I can guarantee you we'll be back to this specific Hilton from here on out ... and for years to come. We were THOROUGHLY SATISFIED and the weekend proved to be relaxing, and a time of renewal and reconnection for us personally. I know there are plenty of options to choose from in San Diego, and we've been to a lot of nice resorts throughout the west coast, but I strongly suggest you stay at this particular Hilton ... there's just something special about it and you will not be disappointed. In fact, there's a great chance it'll become your favorite spot ... just like it has for us. Troy - Poway, CA

Reviews.Title: “the resort was absolutley breathtaking and made our weekend very memorable.”
Reviews.Author: bonnienichols99
Reviews.Content: our weekend was so fabulous!!! From the room to the grounds to the service of the staff, it was above and beyond all that we could have expected. The resort was layed out perfect and attention to every detail was clearly paid attention too. We will be visiting this resort many times a year for sure. It was absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort, could use some TLC and a parking”
Reviews.Author: Rollergirl37
Reviews.Content: We stay here for two days in Sept. The resort is lovely. Our room was spacious with a great view. I was a bit dissapointed in the fact that the outsides of the building were dusty and dirty. The steps had what looked like dried body fluid on them and all the landings outside the rooms were dirty as well. I was suprised they were not clean. With the $25 parking fee you would think they could keep up with the maintainence. They charge $25 a night for parking is such a rip off. And of course you cannot park on the street for 2 hours during the night. Its a pretty resort and we had a nice time. The pool area is beautiful. It felt like Hawaii, including the prices....

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your Money!”
Reviews.Author: TrishTucson
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to San Diego and what a disappointment. Room was not clean...examples: paper coffee cup had been used previously but had been put back for use again (doesn't get nastier), no liner in our ice bucket, the bottoms of our feet turned black in just a few passes across the tiled floor, our patio came with two of the most uncomfortable bar height stools and one low table so there was no way to get comfortable or sit on the stool and set a drink down, the propane tank in the fire pit (couples retreat area) had no gas after the first night and was never filled the rest of the week and the towels weren't stocked daily for the spa in the same area - just got to look at a heap of used towels for a few days. Asking for assistance - forget it - very rude. The very worst is that they had our parking area marked off limits for three days and made you walk a very long walk to your building - why were we paying $25.00 a day for parking and then we learned it was off limits to us because there was an "event" on Saturday (after we checked out!) and they were using our area for valet parking for event attendees. What????? What a nice time - listening to all the guests in our building complain for the same reasons! OK - the pool area was nice. Would we return? Absolutely not!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not 4 *”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travelalways
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice enough, the room we stayed in was clean and had just been updated, very spacious. pool area was lovely, great for children. The hotel had a film night around the pool and handed out popcorn for all the children. Dining wasa little pricey, but there was a small coffee shop selling coffee and muffins for breakfast. One disadvantage was location, you needed a car to get into downtown. Old town was not too far away, so we did hire a taxi that evening. Tour bus collects passesngers each morning at 9 and 10.00, but the return was far too early, returning between 4 - 5.30. Although a nice hotel, I wouldn't stop there again, preferring something closer to the amenties and restaurents of San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: ron_elvins
Reviews.Content: It tries hard to be a four star hotel, but many aspects fall short. The location is fine - nice beach and walk behind the hotel, but it is a long way from Downtown and the more holiday active area of West Mission Bay. You need a car, and to have a car they charge you $25 a day to park which is nothing other than a rip-off and a significant supplement to your bill, especially if you are staying for several nights. the other area of rip-off is the charge for internet services, which lets be honest most places now provide free of charge. Rooms were good and spacious and the housekeeping was faultless. I agree with an earlier reviewer who said about the smelly corridor - it smelt of dead animals to me! Likewise you heard everytime anyone near your room went to the toilet. If you are in the tower-block you are definitely in the 'cheap-seats', whilst the 4/5 star guests have access to the beach fronts, restaurant and pool. Pool was nice and well used, shame they charged you (rip-off culture again) to use a cabanna. We used several hotels in California during a prolonged holiday and this was the worst - we were glad to get out of there. Not untypically eating when compared to retaurants outside of the hotel was expensive. American hotels do seem a little obsessed with 'musack'. The Hilton's was particularly gruelling and constant everywhere you went - we do not want to hear this rubbish!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, but could provide guests with more info”
Reviews.Author: Holoholotutu
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel property--stayed for 3 nights. Everything was Hilton-quality and there are only a couple of negatives: first, there are no elevators, but we toughed it out cause the bay view from the 2nd floor was spectacular. Also, our room was situated at the furthest point from the lobby and so we did not know (until we were checking out) that there is a Starbucks coffee service available in the morning hours (we made the room coffee, ordered room service, or drove somewhere). Would've been helpful to include map of the hotel property and grounds, as well as a flyer about coffee and breakfast items being available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest Room I have ever be in anywhere in the world”
Reviews.Author: gpiccininno
Reviews.Content: I never imagined that a carpet could be as dirty as room 516. 15 minutes after my son’s took baths, there feet where black. To test how dirty they carpet was, I wet a towel and rubbed the carpet for 5 seconds and it came up dark gray. I wanted my wife to video this since I believe seeing the filth is the only way to understand the level of filth. Location was great, service is average at best and at times, they seemed understaffed (at least that is what they told me when I wanted to get a bite to eat at 8 pm at the restaurant (I was a party of one) The hotel was the only negative of a great family holiday. It is a real shame because the location is great for doing all the SD located theme parks and the small beach and bay is just right for our 4 and 6 year olds. Taking out the filth of the hotel, I can't imagine topping this family holiday with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Everything in our room was broken”
Reviews.Author: cstrom
Reviews.Content: The first night we stayed at this hotel our toilet broke. At four in the morning it made this horrible honking noise. It kept us up all night. The next morning we went to call the front desk and the phone in our room didn't work! The sliding glass door in our room was broken, and the remote for the TV didn't work. The walls were very thin and you could hear what the people in the next room were doing! It was awful. Worst money I ever spent. I will NOT be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but inconvenient without a car”
Reviews.Author: sci01
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for the hotel through Priceline. I have had great experience with Priceline in the past but this was my least favorite experience. The staff were nice. The room was very nice and generally clean (with the exception of the cabinet containing the small fridge). Unfortunately, my room was right off the parking lot (even though the hotel was not very crowded) so I could not enjoy a view or the patio. Internet in the rooms was expensive. The biggest downside to the hotel is the lack of bus or shuttle service near the hotel. There was a livery/car outside each morning -- convenient, but the rates were even higher than a taxi. If you drive, you have to pay $25 for parking. It would be nice if the hotel operated a small shuttle or made a deal with a livery service. Particularly without a view, I felt this turned out to be an inconvenient location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “High price for quality of stay.”
Reviews.Author: salar36
Reviews.Content: First, the positives....1--good central location, near Seaworld and the bay, though proximity to expressway is noisy, 2--nice family friendly pool area, 3--friendly staff at restaurant, 4--room was clean, 5--bed was exceptionally comfortable (rather firm, but not hard), 6--close to airport, 7--nice walkway behind hotel along shore of bay, 8--small dock with boat that you can rent. Areas for improvement.....1. Always have soap in the bathroom soap dispensers--it was missing from bathrooms across from Front Desk near Business area. This is not optional and is one of the first things that I look for in a quality establishment. It is absolutely unacceptable to have no soap in soap dispensers. This separates quality establishments from Friday night bars. 2. Service at restaurant was slow and rather inattentive, wine delivery took 30 min, and 20% gratuity was automatically included despite fewer than 6 people eating (child of 2yo was included as sixth by computer) and slow, inattentive service, 3. Food did not come as ordered (hamburgers well overdone (ordered medium), fillet mignon greatly underdone (ordered medium well). 4. Walls are thin and whenever anyone nearby flushes a toilet, everyone is aware of it. 5. Though the bed was exceptionally comfortable for me, some clientele are not mindful of others at odd hours--I was treated to loud banging on a nearby door and a string of F-word expletives at 5:30 in the morning. 6. As others have mentioned, $25 for "self parking" here???? It's not downtown by any means. Of the three hotels that I stayed at in the past 2 weeks (Marriot spa on Coronado, Ritz Carlton at Laguna Beach, and the Hilton), the Hilton was a distant third, though the price that we paid at the Ritz Carlton was actually the same as the HiIton.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but not four *”
Reviews.Author: stayfree
Reviews.Content: It seemed to me that the hotel was in two parts - the rooms which were more like 3 star and then the main part of the hotel/pool/restaurant which was 4 star. The pool and the restaurant (both outdoors and in) were lovely, the ambience in the evening was very relaxing - loved the fires, and I guess in some respects you pay for the setting. We thought the breakfast was very good, and an evening meal though expensive was enjoyable, we decided it was worth the extra for the ambience. However, we stayed in the two storey rooms on the corridors overlooking the gardens and the corridors were quite shockingly tired, the corridor we walked through to get the hotel (100's I think) was very smelly, rather like a sewer and reminded me of a youth hostel - definitely not 4 star, more like 2. Had we stayed on that particular corridor I would definitely have asked to be moved. The rooms themselves were nice, but so dark and very damp. The beds however were very comfortable and the housekeeping was good. The bathroom was tiny for an upgraded lanai garden room. Overall, a nice stay but we felt a little ripped off, the $25 daily parking charge is not really justifiable at all and is offputting when reflecting on your stay. Also when we ate in the restaurant one evening, the waiter added on $10 gratuity after we had signed the bill (without our knowledge) and we had already left him a tip! We noticed this when checking out and queried the bill. Not really acceptable, although the Manager apologised profusely. I wouldn't say don't stay there, just lower your expectations of a 4* slightly.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Value Minded”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine103
Reviews.Content: It was nice but not worth big bucks. Our room was huge for a hotel room (a definite plus)but somewhat dated and in need of some general maintenance (bulging wallpaper, tub could use a regrout and the place could generally be updated). Pool umbrellas fading etc... It could be that I just prefer value but I really hated being charged for every single basic service that is typically included in a 2 star range. Parking $25 a night, internet also outrageous (I guess they don't want you Googling for nearby restaurants lest you not pay $13.50 for the basic burger –cheese is extra - that your kids wouldn't appreciate anyway). Grown up meals start about $40. Maybe it's just me as there we're plenty of folks partaking. It was nice on many levels but for the prices I would have expected much more. Also, don't expect early check-in. On the bright side, they happily allowed us in the pool area early with a temporary key and said they'd call when our room was ready. That turned out to be 15 minutes prior to when was contracted (4:00). Great location near Sea World right on the bay. Only a few minutes drive to all San Diego attractions. Don't plan on using the internet unless you want to swipe your credit card. As of July 2010 use was $8.16 minimum for the first 15 minutes and .54 a minute after that. Bring snacks and don't plan to eat there at all - crazy expensive. There are plenty of places within driving distance that are worth a try. We loved Su Casa near La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: taeyasmom
Reviews.Content: The thing about this hotel is that it is literally in the middle of no where. You are about a 5 or ten minute drive (by highway) from restaurants, etc. definitely too far to walk. The restaurant at the hotel was good, but expensive. We got the room for $139 a night which was fine, but in my opinion, it is not at all worth what they normally charge to stay there (upwards of $200). The room was nice, but not spectacular and the pool area was pretty. I probably would not stay there again simply due to the location--too isolated.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experiences ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotels12
Reviews.Content: Attention to Hilton Management: The customer service is excellent at the San Diego Hilton Resort and SPA (1775 East Mission Bay Drive); including the staff members at the registration TC, Ramon and Josh Morrison! With their smiling faces and grade confidence of knowing their professional responsibilities, TC and Josh made our stay very welcoming, pleasant and enjoyable! If your organization has customer service rating scale of 1-10, I would give 10 to TC and Josh's services! Thank you again for your outstanding services! Sam S. Yeremian

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE PERFECTION!! Our entire stay was exceptional in every way”
Reviews.Author: tomtristen
Reviews.Content: The weekend was a non-kid weekend with my husband for my 39th B-day. We were in room 327 which I highly recommend to anyone planning to visit, it was amazing and the views all around were perfect-the view from the private patio at Sunset is beautiful. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left our stay was a great one. The employee's were all very friendly and accomodating. The General Manager personally checked on us to see how we liked our room and if there was anything they could do to let them know. The grounds of the hotel are beautifully landscaped and well maintained, it was nice to walk around and relax. Overall the weekend was terrific, we will definately be returning to this Hotel in the future. THANK YOU TO EVERYONE AT THE HILTON

Reviews.Title: “Have the best time of your life”
Reviews.Author: jasonsueart
Reviews.Content: As a family, we have been coming to the Mission Bay Hilton for 25+ years and have always enjoyed our time at the Hotel. From the moment we drive in we see the same familiar smiling faces of the bellmen, to the ever so courteous reception at the front desk, to all the phone operators including Penny, Marc, and Becky who are happy to assist you in any way possible, to the best and friendliest housekeepers, and to Justin who is always there to lend a helping hand. The mornings would not be the same without our daily trip to Aqua for breakfast.. All the waiters and waitresses have become part of our family including, Maria, Terry, Mariano, Luis, Ernie, Nacho, Nemma, Roberto, Carol, and Tony. We look forward to seeing all of them. Lastly we can not forget the resort. They make us feel right at home. The bartenders by the pool at Frescos are the best. We do not want to forget to mention are friend Chris, the building engineer who makes a point of visiting us at least one time during our stay just to get the latest family updates. The hadest part of the trip is saying goodbye to the front desk staff including Josh, Ramon, Edit, and William. Sincerely, Jason, Sue and Art Rosen

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families, but details are”
Reviews.Author: Tripster101
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the tower section of this hotel and found it to be comfortable with nice clean rooms with balconies. The walls are a bit thinner than you'd expect from a hotel of this class, however. The overall feel of the resort is good, with lots of open areas and seating. The pool area is nice but becomes a bit crowded during the day, but the beach is just a few steps away so it's easy to find a spot. It's along Mission Bay which has a great walking trail. As for location, it's great for what it is. You're not in the middle of everything but Mission Bay is beautiful and offers lots to do. If you're looking for nightlife or shopping you'd be better served to look elsewhere. We have 2 small children and they had a great time at the pool and at the beach, and unlike at some other properties we did not feel uncomfortable having our children with us. That said, the service leaves something to be desired. There were a number of little issues that left us feeling like this is a 3 star service hotel, not a 4. A few examples: some of the restaurant service was quite slow, although the waitstaff was uniformly friendly. Also, the bathrooms in the restaurant were not well maintained. Of 3 sinks, 2 did not have any soap in the dispensers, and my wife informed me that the waste baskets in the women's restrooms were overflowing (and not during a particularly busy time). The food was very good to occasionally exceptional, however, though quite expensive. As for other staff, they were mostly helpful with an occasional exception. For example, a linen cart deliveryman was at the the elevators and occupied the 1st to arrive without offering it to waiting guests. It was not like there was an endless stream of people waiting, either. It's things like this that can make people paying premium rates feel less than valued as customers. If the resort were to fix these small but quite important details it could, given its location and otherwise good offerings, be considered a true 4 star resort. And of course, no review would be complete without a complaint about the ridiculous charges assessed by most hotels in this class. No free Internet in the rooms? $25 to park when this is not a downtown location? These things leave one feeling as if Hilton is picking one's pockets. Coupled with the overall level of service, I would have to say this is a 3 star, not a 4. Good, but not great. We would only return if we were paying a good bit less than what we paid (which was north of $275 a night).

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the world!!!"”
Reviews.Author: cpseley
Reviews.Content: I thought the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa was AWESOME!!! The pool is beautiful and the rooms were just perfect. They had a breakfast buffet that was so good, and a bunch of amedities that everyone would enjoy. It has a great view of Mission Bay and I would recommend it to anybody. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location for our needs”
Reviews.Author: 65Mustangman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very expensive as most goods and services are in California. Our son was married in the San Diego area and the Mission Bay area was a good central location. The pool, bike and jet ski rentals were a nice option.

Reviews.Title: “Try glorietta bay inn... If u think the Hilton rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Lissethp
Reviews.Content: This place doesn't provide any type of breakfast... The restaurant ... Location is bad, theres nothing In walking distance...Internet is $11 a DAY!...( most places provide it for free).... Parking is $25.00 at the DAY... We stayed at glotietta bay Inn( here in San Diego) Where breakfast is included and is THE BEST... FREE Internet.... FREE parking.... Exellent location.... What a mistake to come to the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “MORE LIKE A MOTEL NOT A HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scotland021
Reviews.Content: This was our last hotel to visit on our two week holiday to California and what a disappointment. Location is terrible it is on the outskirts of San Diego and unless you are visiting Sea World there is nothing else close by. There are no restaurants in walking distance except the Hotel restaurant which looked nice but cannot comment as we did not eat in it. Our room was very dull and musty smelling, our balcony had two ridiculous high chairs and a high table which were not inviting to sit on. Parking was 25$ a night to park your own car. The two previous hotels we had stayed in were beautiful hotels with valet parking which were the same price. The positive about this hotel is the pool is nice. Hope this review is helpful to people who like to be in the centre of places do not book this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place, Great Location, Nice Amenities, What's with the music ?”
Reviews.Author: augustwest73
Reviews.Content: Nice place to hang out, have a drink pool side and be as active or not as you like....Great time playing with the kids in the large grotto like pool....Lots to do with the family at the hotels terrific bay front location.( jet ski..sail boats..water craft..power boats etc.) Great paved path all around the bay for biking/walking/jogging. ... We stayed in the 300 series of Villa rooms with a patio over looking the gardens / bay. These rooms share a private "quite area" with lush landscaping / fountains / private hot tube..,,I recommend you pay up to get one over a room in the older tower..(Take note. Rarely, if ever will folks that book rooms at online discount sites have access to these premium rooms for cut rate prices.).. We stayed 7 nights and used the hotel as our base for the short drive to major kid friendly attractions such as Sea World, the SD Zoo, Balboa Park, and a little further,,the Scripp's Aquarium, Lego Land, Coronado Beach and much more......Food on the resort was expensive but always very good. You will need to jump into the rental car to hit the IN and Out Burger in town or any other store or restaurant..(10 min drive)............Only a few turnoff's.....1) In most parts of the property you hear fairly loud, new age "hipster" music all day long. There is no escaping it other than in your room.. It GRINDS on you after a while....2) Service was mostly competent but over 7 days I found there was an untenable level of sachrine sweet and insincere interaction with most (though not all) of the line employees. It was not suprising to find out that these folks were part of the malaise of mediocrity that being a unionized property inflicts on them...Most supervisory/management personel went the extra yard with graciousness and many times with out having to be asked....3) Considering the cost of rooms and food..$25/day to park your own car...and...$13/day for internet access in your room seemed somewhat punitive...,OVERALL, we enjoyed our stay,, would come back and feel the property is worthy of your consideration,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: RenNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Hilton. We tried to check in early and the the room wasn't ready, but we were able to freshen up in the spa's locker room. All our request were met at check in. Only problem was we were on the second floor in the Villa's and there was no elevator, so my husband had to carry all the suitcases up himself. The room and bathroom were both a nice size. The view from the balcony was a nice garden view with a partial view of the bay. The grounds are beautiful. When driving up to the Resort it reminded me of some of the Hotels in Hawaii with it's open air tropical lobby. We also enjoyed the gym and tennis courts. They will supply you with tennis racquets you just have to pay five dollars for the balls or bring your own. I would definitely stay here on my next trip to San Diego if the price is right. I really don't understand why such the terrible rating. I almost stayed some place else and I'm glad I didn't!!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Best Vacation Getaway”
Reviews.Author: IZZYCROWES
Reviews.Content: I am a resident of San Diego who was looking for a weekend getaway and chose The Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa because of its coastal location. Boy am i glad i did! The experience was phenomenal. The resort itself is beautiful. The staff are all extremely kind and helpful and the room was great with really comfortable beds. I was just feet from the bay and was able to watch the fireworks across the bay at Sea World. Killer place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome pool, and good service at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Chicago2SD
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Hilton with our 2 young children. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was ready and had a beautiful courtyard and view of the bay. Our children loved the pool and also enjoyed playing in the sand/beach area by the hotel. Our family enjoyed the private firepit outside our patio. The gift shop had firewood available. We ate dinner on the private patio with a fire on a beautiful San Diego evening. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing and relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: FarrinMarie
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hilton for our honeymoon and were amazed at the treatment we received! The restaurant on property was amazing, along with the people working their and the food was unbelievably good. I highly recommend it. The room that we stayed in was right on the beach with a beautiful view. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and would be back for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “We cannot wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: mgousha
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa was phenomenal. We needed a roll away bed and it was delivered immediately. We had several appointments in the spa and each was delivered professionally and beautifully. Relaxation at its finest. Our incredible room was perfect for us because we had six ladies sharing a suite...plenty of room to enjoy being together and having plenty of space to fully enjoy our weekend. Access to the pool was convenient and we loved having towels provided. Additionally, our dinner on Saturday night was delicious! On the way out, we stopped to buy a souvenir and loved the gift shop. Everything we needed. We look forward to a return visit soon!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway for leisure and activity”
Reviews.Author: pjstlo
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, friendly and attentive staff, great food - relaxing, yet a perfect location easy access to entertainment. A definite repeat destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: KatyMomof2
Reviews.Content: My room overlooked Mission Bay with outdoor seating. The location is awesome, right on the water. There is a walking tract along the beach the runs right next to the hotel, so you can just leave your room and begin walking. The breakfast buffet was excellent; plenty to choose from and the service was good. I had lunch and dinner at the restaurant and bar which was very good. There is an adult retreat area, which included a hot tub. The pool was clean and they had a bar attendant for your orders. I loved the fire pits outside the pool area at night while I drank cocktails. I also enjoyed a massage at the spa. I would definitely return and recommend this hotel. The entire staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, short drive time to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: 2lilmonkeys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid June with two children aged 10 and 12. The property is beautiful with lush landscaping and open air lobby areas. The kids enjoyed the pool and the "Dive In" movies shown at the pool several times during the week - free popcorn at the towel kiosk. After a day full of sightseeing, we relaxed around the pool area and watched the SeaWorld fireworks every night at 9:50 p.m. The man working the front curb (bell captain maybe?) was so nice and helpful with maps and suggestions. The room was fine and clean, the beds were comfortable, bathroom fairly large. There is a charge for wifi in the rooms, but I would take my laptop to the comfortable lounging areas in the open-air lobby or around the pool to take advantage of the free wifi there. The Aroma coffee cafe serves Starbucks coffee and drinks. We had room 514 in Villa Paloma, which had a small lanai with two comfy lounge chairs and a view of the bay. Some of the rooms in this section had private fire pits on their lanais -- sweet! If you don't have a room with a personal firepit, there are public ones on the beach around Mission Bay and the Hilton gift shop sells bundles of firewood. The only problem we had was that when we arrived around midnight we found they were overbooked and did not have a room for us. They put us up at the very nice Paradise Point a few miles away and comp'd the first night and all parking fees for our stay, so I really have little complaint about this.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape for both the adults and the kids”
Reviews.Author: Wheaton60189
Reviews.Content: I traveled from Chicago with my wife and two children to visit family. We are familiar with the L.A. and San Diego area and thought it would be nice to stay in a nice hotel for a few days. Our purpose was to relax and explore the San Diego area. We arrived early and our rooms were not ready. They took our cell phone numbers and said they would rush one of the two rooms we reserved so that we could get settled. My phone rang within 20 minutes which was a pleasant surprise. Our rooms were great. 1st floor, large, and walked out to a patio that had a fire pit and looked over the bay. When you have kids... the first thing is the pool. The pool was gorgeous and had a zero depth area which was great for kids. For the adults... two hot tubs and prompt pool side service. That night, we were so excited about the fire pit that we did S'mores. That evening fireworks went off at Sea World beyond the bay which was a perfect end to the night and way to start our time in the San Diego area. During our stay we rented a Catamaran, hung out at the pool, took walks on the bay, and went site seeing. One of the more relaxed trips I have been on in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Geffrey25
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay with the family. This was our third time staying at this location and have never been disappointed. The Hotel is located close to Seaworld and the Zoo reducing travel time in the car for the kids. The pool area was great for the kids after a day at the Zoo. We spent the extra money and got a bayfront view with a fire pit which enabled us to roast marshmellows and watch the Sea World fireworks every night. The spa prices were resonable and I was able to get an appointment without any problems. The location is easily accessable to the highway for eating and exploring the surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: vrcuc0329
Reviews.Content: Very Clean and well rounded hotel. Has alot to offer in terms of amenities for both kids and adults. Location is fabulous too; easy freeway access, close to the ocean beaches as well as the city. You will not be disappointed to stay here. We've tried other hotels in the area for our trips to southern california and won't choose any other.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway and Fireworks Viewing”
Reviews.Author: jlourenc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay for the whole family, except for the little ones. The rooms were updated with wonderful beds and roomy. The pool area was facing mission bay. The beach at the hotel provided great viewing of fireworks from all over San Diego and Sea World. Dinner at the bayside restaurant was pricey, but very good. The only negative was when the pool attendants insisted we remove my two year granddaughter from the pool, even though she was wearing a swim diaper. Their worry was contaminating the pool if she had an accident and the diaper failed. She was upset that everyone else could swim in the big pool, but her. The kiddie pool was small and off in a corner with no sun. We may go back when my granddaughter is older than 31/2.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely mother's day weekend retreat”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamilyGal
Reviews.Content: I was delighted when my husband surprised me with a quick weekend trip to San Diego. We stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. Our suite had a private patio that faced mission bay. It was also next to a public park, which made for some interesting people watching. There were people walking dogs, rollerblading and enjoying the bay. The first night we had a romantic dinner at Acqua restaurant onsite. The appetizers were to die for! Tuna tar-tar and a summer squash soup garnished with lobster. For dinner my husband had the risotto and I had angus sliders. The next morning we took a quick drive to La Jolla beach. We returned to the resort in the afternoon and spent the day at the pool. The pool area was beautiful and relaxing. The drink service was a bit slow, but overall it was a nice experience. That night we ventured out to Old Town for some mexican food. When we returned to the resort, we enjoyed the view of fireworks from our patio. I'm guessing they were from Seaworld. Our final morning we enjoyed the room service breakfast on our patio. Everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: rmvilla
Reviews.Content: We went for forth of july weekend! My family loved it! They had smores on the beach!!!!!!!! The assistant manager came over to us twice over the weekend to ask us how everything was and if there is anything more he can do for us! We had so many things planned but ended up just enjoying are stay at the hotel! Cant wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: RealtorRita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a total of 8 nights. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is very nice, recently renovated rooms. Like most resorts they do charge for parking $25/day and Internet $12.day, but otherwise don't nickel and dime you. Beautiful pool area right on the beach/bay, bike and boat rentals right here, great food in their main restaurant (pricey of course). Grounds are gorgeous and well kept. Plenty of grassy areas for kids to run around. Hotel is right down the street from Sea World and only 10 mins to Balboa Park, the Zoo, Old Town, etc. If you like quiet don't get a room near the pool--loud music all day. One plus is you can watch the fireworks from Seaworld every night at 9:50 pm. This is a really nice hotel and location, and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place.”
Reviews.Author: Bob3800
Reviews.Content: This hotel (HILTON SAN DIEGO RESORT & SPA ) is not on the beach. Do not be fooled by these dishonest people. Before we got Google map, I once made reservation here, and to my great disappointment, once I arrived there I found that I was miles a way from the closest sandy pacific ocean beach. Now of course this is the first thing you can see from Google map. But still mangers and owners of this place are hoping to still get un-expected travelers to come here by lying about being right on sandy beaches. Shame on them. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: JonCllns
Reviews.Content: Wow, the breath-taking shot on the Hilton San Diego Resort website make this place look like it's right off the ocean. It actually feeds into a smaller bay area. So, that was a disappointment. I gave this hotel a 2 mainly on value. These are Holiday Inn or Hampton Inn type rooms for resort prices. No free wi-fi, no free breakfast, and parking is $25 per day. It was also noisy there during our stay. We stayed four nights and there were disturbances on two of those nights. The final night, a drunk group of people wandered onto the property from the nearby beach around 11pm and a fight nearly broke out in the parking lot. On the good side, the staff is friendly and helpful. The Acqua (I forget how it's spelled) restaurant is fantastic. It's expensive, but the food is first class. Overall, I think I would have rather stayed at a hotel where I didn't have to pay bloated prices for things I could have gotten for free or cheaper at a non-resort hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: DoveLuv
Reviews.Content: Loved our bay front view room!!!!!! Great way to get your mind off of everything and just relax. However, the staff at the front desk made us wait for hours until we got our room and they were really rude. We also had to carry luggage to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff, average stay”
Reviews.Author: coguy72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with spouse and 3 year old. Be advised parking is $25 per DAY you stay, cost me $100 to park my rental car in the hotel parking lot. My fault for not checking this, but this was an expense I had not anticipated. The staff was friendly and helpful. Location to I-5 and Sea World is very convenient. About 10 minutes from Mission Beach, water in front of hotel is small inlet. We went to the Acqua restaurant one evening for a drink and snack. My wife had two glasses of wine, I had two martinis and we ordered a seared tuna dish from the 3rd course menu, it cost us $92 with tip, a bit expensive for a few drinks and what was really a snack, not much food. Had to pay about $12 per day for ethernet internet access in room, free WiFi available in lobby area. Room was clean for most part, it is an older facility and it shows in the rooms. All in all it is OK I probably would not stay here again, I would look for something closer to the open ocean, and that did not nickel and dime you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: JoeyLeonardo
Reviews.Content: got the deal online...very affordable (under $100 per night) for one cozy hotel. pools are just adjacent to our rooms, which is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, tranquil, peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jfamilyof8
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say this place is centrally located to everything!!! With a rental car, seriously, you are 5 minutes from all San Diego tourist attractions. We went to Old Town, Coronado, Ocean beach, Seaport village, Pacific beach, La Jolla cove, Cabrillo National Monument etc.. and were able to be back to our hotel super quick!! Upon checking into our room, we received a room in the tower.... SCARY!!! The balcony had a group of seagulls nesting, and was covered in bird poop...GROSS!! I returned to the front desk and was shown a room that I could pay an additional $50 to upgrade to which had a bay view... not worth the price of the upgrade. I returned again to the front desk and was given a room (for an additional fee/night) in the Triana villa. It was beautiful!! Nice views, lovely landscaping, quiet, perfect. The front desk staff was very helpful, and friendly. Ramon was patient and kind. Bummed that others received a free upgrade, but I had to pay additional $$$. The housekeeping staff was excellent, and very friendly!! We stayed a week, and our room was always cleaned and smelled nice when we returned. Every staff member we encountered was very customer service oriented. The walking/running/biking paths were great which followed along the bay all the way to Sea World. The poolside fires, as well as the hot tubs at night were great.... here is a tip that we discovered, when the pool closes @ 10:00 pm, go to the adult hot tub in the adult retreat area it is open later. Plan on eating one night at the restaurant Acqua, very, very, very good!! The risotto with truffles is amazing!!! Probably the best meal I had in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but somewhat impersonal”
Reviews.Author: cmsinc
Reviews.Content: This location was very nice the restaurants, the lounge, as well as the pool were as you would expect very comfortable and tastefully apportioned. The young lady who served us for 8days poolside was wonderful, and very deserving of recognition, in addition there were several others who made a very warm effort to make us feel special, HOWEVER, the air and overall experience was impersonal and dismissive. There was some sort of a convention there and I felt as if we were relegated to nuisance status by the bulk of the folks especially several folks at the desk. Overall that was disappointing, the Internet service is horrible! Poolside I had good reception but was told, "we don't have any codes until summer", really, what if your customers need it, and the wireless you tout is only useful within 20' of the front desk. Service in the room ibahn through eithernet which is useless to my iPad. I would still stay here as the beach access and amenities are very nice, but I would not expect to be treated as special or as if Hilton, was honored to have me and my wife come for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeLee11
Reviews.Content: First of all, we booked through Priceline and got a ridiculously low rate. So, with that in mind, I can say that I really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Resort. I had originally requested a quiet upper floor room, away from the elevator. The first room we got was on the 8th floor in the Tower. It was right next to the elevator, overlooking the freeway and was very noisy! I immediately contacted the front desk and requested a different room. They moved us to a lovely bay/garden view room in the Villa Triana building. Compared to the first room, it was much, much better. Very quiet, nice view of the bay and the room opened up to its own patio and to the lovely gardens. The walking path along the bay was conveniently located a short distance away. Each morning I took an very enjoyable stroll along the bay. The room itself was very nice with updated decor and comfortable beds and pillows. The room was a little musty-smelling but not unbearable. The resort is a little outdated, but again, it wasn't too bad. It is centrally located within the San Diego area. My biggest complaint is the $25/nite parking fee. But most 4-star hotels in San Diego charge for parking, so I expected it. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Resort. It was definitely worth the low rate we paid. If we had to pay full price, I might have had a different opinion. I would definitely stay there again IF we got the same rate and a similar garden/bayfront villa room.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: ImeldaL
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure to stay at this hotel! It's close to our favorite stops to visit, the beach, 10 mintue drive to the gas lamp district, museaums, and the best place on earth Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Money, Money, Money...”
Reviews.Author: amedway
Reviews.Content: It's all about the money at this hotel. First of all we booked through Hotwire and the price was pretty good at $95 per night. This is an old hotel that has been renovated some time ago and it's starting to get shabby again. While the rooms are clean, that old musty smell still lingers in the room and in the bathroom the paint was peeling from the the shower ceiling. it's not a bad thing but it just tells me they don't have a very good maintenance program there. Now about the money. The hotel is located pretty central to everything but the cost of taxi's to anything is minimum $15 each way, these start to add up so you'll be spending a hundred dollars a day on them. We rented a car to save on the taxi cost. Hilton charges $25 a night to park your car there. This is an absolutely outrageous cost for a parking space especially when we came back a little later at night and there were no spaces close to our room and had to park quite far away. I was also dismayed to find I had to pay for internet in the business centre, I just wanted to pre-check in for our flight home and found you have to swipe your credit card to get acces. No way. The restaurant is also quite expensive but all resort restaurants are. All in all, next time I'd probably stay at different hotel, one that offers breakfast included and one that doesn't charge for parking or internet.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT waste your money here; poor facility, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: wildcat567
Reviews.Content: I have been craving a beach vacation for years, and even though I used Priceline to book the room, it was still splurging. However, once I booked it, I had a feeling this wasn't going to go well before we even got there. The hotel didn't return my calls for starters, then we got there and were given a single King when I had requested a double Queen. They brought a rollaway instead - after we waited quite a while for it. (Granted, I did get a call from the front desk asking if it had been delivered yet, which it hadn't). They didn't even bring it IN the room; they knocked and presented it to us (I was traveling with a friend), and WE had to roll it into the room, move furniture around so it would fit, and set it up, which then made a desk and chair unusable because it was too tight. When we checked in, I asked for a manager to call me in the room to discuss the parking situation. They charge $25/day for parking (ridiculous, given they have plenty of room for guest parking). I am disabled and have a disabled parking permit. I wanted them to reduce or waive the parking fee. The manager never called me. I ended up with a "supervisor" being brought out to speak with me as I checked OUT (not a manager). He did halve the parking fee and said "next time" I stayed there, they would be sure to "take care of me" - shouldn't they be "taking care of me" from the moment I make the reservation?!? I even told him we were not done with our vacation but were so disappointed by the room and service that we had decided to stay our prepaid 3 nights because I couldn't get a refund, but that we were going to stay at another hotel for the 4th night. That was an opportunity for him to comp a room for our last night, but he didn't make that choice. My travel buddy had breakfast there one morning: $22 for a measly meal. And I had martinis at the bar one night - $14 each! Crazy! Even the bartender recommended not ordering certain desserts because they were "the size of a MINI Reese's peanut butter cup". MINI, mind you. Peace and quiet? Only rarely - on the one hand, seeing the SeaWorld fireworks every night might have been fun, but they didn't even mention it on check-in, so we were startled every night by the booming noises from across the bay and didn't get out in time to see the whole show. Not to mention the "young adults" who were running around our small building of units, outside our door, and knocking plates and glasses over on the room service tray we had set outside by our door. Oh, don't forget: there is a fee for EVERYthing. Parking, wi-fi, gym access, etc. A total ripoff. The room was dated, very dark. There was a floor lamp that I couldn't figure out how to turn on; ends up it has a foot switch, but it was so dark on the floor in the corner where it sits that I couldn't see it. Why didn't someone come and orient us to the room? We did have "Doug," a kind of shabby but nice older man unload the bags from our car but that was it. There was also mildew all over the shower curtain. The positives? The king bed was comfy, the linens clean, the towels big and thick, and the big oval, cushioned lounge chair on the patio was very comfy to lay on when outside. Oh, and their location is good, but there are better places to be, especially if you don't plan on doing Seaworld (we didn't).

Reviews.Title: “This motel masquerades as a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: rbinsydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at this excuse for a Hilton Hotel. On arrival we were informed that we would be charged $25 per night for parking and were told to 'just park ourselves' (just likje the local motel - only much dearer!). The room was quite nicely decorated & spacious, but the service was woeful. The web site says tea & coffee making facilities - there is a coffee maker only & no tea bags or fresh milk. I rang & was told to ring room service for a cup of tea. The in-room booklet says there is a mini-bar - there is not, only a small noisy little fridge (empty) in the wardrobe. I spoke to the Concierge (who tried to be very helpful) and said she would get room service to bring hot water, tea bags and fresh milk to our room - an hour later, she gave up and bought a cup of Earl Grey tea at the adjoining coffee shop and brought it up to our room with sachet milk. Half an hour later, room service finally turned up with hot water only. How hard can this be!!! We went out between 10am & 2.30pm - no maid service - there is a notice in our room on whilch you can request a servicing time - we requested 5pm. When we arrived back at 11pm - no room servicing - we rang and asked for fresh towels. We noticed also that the top sheet had stains on it. I went out the next day and purchased my own tea bags and fresh milk. Full marks to the concierge lass for trying so hard to please - she must be awfully frustrated workiing in such a pathetic establishment.
