Wireless internet is also available at a cost of $13 per day - most reasonable hotels don't rip off their guests these days - even the cheaper motels include internet. Travel tip - pay half the price and find a decent motel - the only difference will be the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nothing like the glamorous website pictures, spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: norafabiana
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I chose this hotel based on a great Travelzoo deal we got, and changed from another hotel reservation we had on Harbor Island. The hotel does not look as pretty and “spa” like as pictured on their website. It overlooks a blah lagoon, and the scenery is average. Our bell boy looked literally like a bum, dirty shirt tucked out, pants hung low, and in dire need of sleep. That was not a good start. The garden view room is okay – clean and dated, nothing spectacular. If you have kids and are going to SeaWorld, this is probably the place for you as the location is convenient. Romantic it is not – we could hear kids running and screaming around at night before their “bed time”. Don’t let the pictures deceive you, and only stay here if you are going to be nearby. I wish we would have stayed at Harbor Island, our original location, as we were in San Diego to go sailing, and not to go to SeaWorld. Not to mention, they charge you $20/night for parking. I can understand for hotels downtown, but in Mission Bay? Not reasonable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Run!”
Reviews.Author: Capeguy24
Reviews.Content: Completely overprized, no value for money at all. I paid USD 450 for a socalled King Room Lanai Sea Facing ... its a big joke. No valet parking, nobody that takes your bags to the room. They don't even tell you where to go. Building work and one actually expects the Griswalds to show up any minute. The bathroom is about 1.5 x 1.5m ... they managed however to get a bath, a toilet and a basin in there. No space to get a person in too ... except of course if you leave the door open to stretch you legs. Restaurant ... so so ... food is ok, service is not existing. Their socalled hostess kind of demands "your roomnumber!", "your surname" ... the word PLEASE is not part of her vocabulary. And while you eat, a bunch of hungry guests steers at your plate to hurry up so that they can have a table too. All in all ... Never ever again. For that amount of money, you get much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMooses_Mom
Reviews.Content: Just found bed bugs! Noticed someone else in the exercise room with the same kind of marks on their leg so it is more than just my room. There are no restaurants within walking distance other than the hotels. The food is way too expensive and high calorie. Should have stayed closer to town where I could have walked to activities. Exercise room is nice but there is a daily fee.

Reviews.Title: “Older property with pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: mosh
Reviews.Content: The San Diego Hilton in Mission Bay is really an older hotel and probably a misnomer to call it a resort; it's really an average 3* older hotel with some resort amenities. You get the sense that the owners know their location is great for families and they do just enough upkeep to keep people interested in staying there. There are definitely pluses: the beds are very comfortable, staff tries to be accommodating, and it has a pool, spa and conference center. Plenty of hot water and good water pressure, in room safe and refrigerator were all pleasant surprises. Great access to I-5, Sea World, downtown and coastal beach towns. The property sits right on the beach with a large (cement) "boardwalk" walking/biking path running alongside the bay. If you like taking a walk/riding a bike on a scenic path right outside your door this is perfect. Mission Bay is beautiful and very peaceful on winter weekdays. The pool looked very nice, and the conference center seemed to be in better shape than the rest of the facility. Free wifi connection was sporadically available in that lobby and in the registration area. The minuses are significant. First, as others have noted the buildings are older, rooms and halls are dark. Several rooms had a musty/mildewy odor as did the halls. Our building's outside door locks didn't lock at night so it didn't feel very secure knowing anyone could walk into the building at night from the nearby parks or walking paths. The recent renovations in the rooms are attractive but we tried several rooms due to musty odor, malfunctioning phone/TV, or absurdly poor location of the parking lots right up to the first floor patio door. There's a huge tent sitting in the parking lot which is used for special events. If you are in the tower building on the first floor be prepared for the intrusion of car lights shining right into your room. The 2 story villa buildings have no elevators so they assume everyone is ok hauling your bags to the 2nd floor room or being in the tower. The worst is indeed the noise. The doors must be hollow since we couldn't escape any hallway noises of housekeeping carts and personnel shouting to one another in Spanish or the heavy footsteps above our room which awakened us each morning. The bathrooms were renovated but the paint is chipping, and there's a panel over the tub area that is reminiscent of a 1970's era apartment. The halls and rooms are dark, and they only illuminate the ceiling hall lights and not the wall sconces, despite the unappealing dark appearance. The front desk staff are impresseive since they appear to be doing everything. The Hilton charges $25 a night for parking, plus $12 a day room (ethernet) internet connection. There is no concierge on duty for this "resort" ; which even 3* hotels frequently have, so to call this a resort seems outrageous for what you are getting. Overall, it is challenging to stay here, but the accessibility of the parks and paths, location right on the bayfront, hard-working front desk staff personnel, and general location made it a better experience. If you have patience and a patient front desk staff it has the potential of being a good vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful, helpful staff anywhere”
Reviews.Author: ooonor
Reviews.Content: Wonderful bay-view room, large, clean. The breakfasts can't be beat. The eggwhite Florentine omelet is my favorite, and maybe I am fooling myself but I think it's healthy too. My friends say I need to try the garlic fries in the bar at night. But here is the real thing. EVERYONE who works there is kind, friendly, and helpful. This trip it was Stephen at the front desk, who helped find four perfect white roses to surprise me in my room. He had to go to three florists, but spent the time and did it happily.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy...literally”
Reviews.Author: annemurphey
Reviews.Content: Crappy service, rooms, ammenities, cleanliness, and oh yeah, the ducks and their crap in and around the entire pool area. We got this hotel when stupidly doing one of those, priceline.com hotel requests. (which we'll never do again) We put in our price and area expecting a 4 star or better hotel, and this place did not match that. It looked great upon arrival, but then we went out to the pool area and it was completely full of duck poop, and a maintenance man that was trying to chase the ducks out of the pool. Figuring we'd just head back to our room and get settled we were greeted by a dark and smelly hallway, and mediocre room. We tried to get wireless access to get online and find a spot for dinner and were told that they only provided wireless in the common areas, which ordinarily would be fine, but our many attempts to log on were futile, as we could barely establish a connection at any spot, and were too busy swatting swarming flies that were everywhere to sit for very long. The staff made every request seem ridiculous and refused to provide what we would consider, 4-star service. A few other things that bugged us; Horrid, blaringly loud and unavoidable music in the pool area and bar area, rooms that still hadn't been cleaned by 4pm, $25 parking. DO, however, go here for the restaurant, Acqua. We had a phenomenal dinner here really out of this world with food and ambiance (sans the annoying music) It's definitely 4 star dining and service in there, just need to figure out a way to incorporate that into the rest of the resort. Don't stay here either unless you have a rental car, and the desire to spend most of your vacation driving from place to place. Really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “MEDIOCRE”
Reviews.Author: Traveler201085
Reviews.Content: stayed at the san diego resort for a seminar. Got in 11 pm dead tired. couldn't find my room as the directions the lady drew was on a tiny map for about 10 minutes. You have to drive to your room no bellman service. Was walking around the parking lot in the rain. Not fun. The hallway and room smelled bad. rooms are old and run down. At the seminar I spoke with a employee and told her the bathroom stalls were out of toilet seat covers. the trash cans was full and there was no soap, she said she would take care of it. 2 hours later, the problem was still not taken care of. Fortunately, the seminar was over. $25/night parking charge! for a run down small resort with limited amenities. Hotel is run down. I wouldn't advertise as 4 star. no way. accomodations were not 4 star. 3 star at best. would not recommend this hotel at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and pool”
Reviews.Author: Lexidove
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel in a great location. The pool area is really well designed and kitted out. The rooms are spacious and trendy. Watch out for the antequated hairdryer. It looks like someone stole it from 'Grease'. I could have blown on my hair quicker! I really didn't understand that. Lovely trendy modern rooms and then a hairdryer from the 1950's that has the gentle hum of a mild breeze! The reception were unable to assist and I had to trail along to the Spa to dry my hair in the changing rooms. That aside this is a large hotel and has a very business feel to it. It felt very impersonal. The rooms were reasonalbly priced but we were in a tower block opposite the main hotel which looked like a cheap block of flats from the outside. One side of this block overlooks the main road and could be noisy. We enjoyed our stay but I might feel differently if our stay had been any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Large updated rooms, nice pool, lots of families, $25/day parking”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveler007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for an extended holiday visit to my family and we had an enjoyable stay. The room was comfortable and the pool area was great. The hotel also has a small gym, which was nice. Although the hotel is not convenient if you want to go out downtown (or anywhere, really, without a car), it's a nice place to stay. Parking is a joke at $25 a day - but San Diego thinks it's a big city and most hotels these days charge outrageous parking fees. The city colludes with the hotel by not allowing parking on the bay between the hours and 2 and 4 am. Aside from the parking and somewhat isolated hotel (if you're accustomed to city living and public transportation), we had no complaints. The hotel even has a really good happy hour. The pool area can be loud with children, and we never found a quiet place to escape the playing.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your wallet -”
Reviews.Author: whitegerman
Reviews.Content: This was a nice enough hotel, but everything was expensive (parking, coffee, food, amenities, etc). Renovations were nice, but still seemed a bit "tired" (popcorn ceilings, very small bathroom, noisy toilets). The grounds were beautiful (on Mission Bay) and the location was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “All around Great Resort Except Parking Fee!”
Reviews.Author: MartyArizona
Reviews.Content: Great 4 Star Service from the moment we arrived Christmas Week. Loved the location, within yards of sand & water. Easy commute to Sea World & Ocean! There really wasn't anything we didn't like except the per day $25 Parking Fee! We knew about the fee going in, and was the only downfall of this resort for us. Rooms were nice with a welcome feel. The heated pool had a great layout and looked out to the bay. The Staff was very professional, curteous and made you feel welcome. I loved the Free Internet in the lobby as i'm used to paying for it in the room. This was our 1st Trip to San Diego & Overall our experience was a 9 out of 10 with the parking fee the only downfall.

Reviews.Title: “PHM Society Conference and Symposium”
Reviews.Author: LouR2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel...great facilities and well positioned for short taxi trip to Down town, old town, ets. It is also right on the beach....food great too

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: RITravelingMama
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Priceline for $90 per night. After getting the room and reading the reviews I was a little concerned about how old the hotel would be. We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. We got a villa, a huge room with two queen beds and a full living room with a patio overlooking Mission Bay. There was a large bathroom, a fridge & coffee maker. We couldn't have asked for more for $90. The property itself was surrounded by a park which made for easy exercise or a leisurely stoll in the morning or at sunset. The fitness center had newer equipment and was open before the stated hours of 6 am. The pool area was nice, however, it was a bit chilly during our time there, so we did not actually swim. Aqua (the restaurant) was a nice atmosphere, but a bit on the pricey side. The only downfall was the $25 per night parking fee. That is a bit ridiculous considering the hotel is the only place in the area and has plenty of parking. Given how many cars were in the lot each night (Tues-Fri) they must make most of their profits on parking fees. We did attempt to get them to reduce or waive the fee, or part of it, but were unsuccessful. Other than that, this hotel was a tremendous bargain for the price. For the record, this hotel is within about 15 minutes of downtown, Old Town, Pacific Beach, Balboa Park, and all of the other tourist areas to see in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Narlo_Schiesser
Reviews.Content: The friendly environment and th Hotel features are the MUST! Lay down by the pool was great, everything runs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for our anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler864
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. We were celebrating our anniversary and were upgraded to a large view room. I'm not sure what people mean by "dated interiors," perhaps they don't understand the "retro" look of the freshly upgraded rooms. We were thrilled that it wasn't the standard hotel decor. The property is large, the pool area is wonderful (unlike prior reviews, we LIKED the music, nice touch). There is a hidden "adults retreat" with a tucked away hot tub and waterfalls. We had dinner the first night and breakfast both mornings and it was great (try the crabcake benedict for breakfast... wow!). We also had massages at the spa, very nice. Once you figure out how to get here, the location is very convenient to the attractions of San Diego. The only drawbacks we saw are minor: the $25 parking fee is odd since this is a self-contained property, we did have a little bit of surly service one morning for breakfast but it was a delight the prior morning (perhaps the guy was having a bad day), finally if you are looking for ocean crashing waves... this is not your place. We knew what to expect being on Mission Bay NOT the Pacific Ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Not much WOW factor to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SolarEcoGeek
Reviews.Content: My room was nice -it had a walkout patio overlooking mission bay. Mission Bay is a great place for running and biking, but it is Definitely not my favorite beach. I wouldn't stay here if you want a great beach vacation. I also liked the pool and the grounds were landscaped nicely. But there just isn't much of a WOW factor with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, smelly, non-stop repetitive background music, some nice bits”
Reviews.Author: assequor
Reviews.Content: Travelled on business - 8 night stay. Setting promises to be good but Mission Bay is not a particularly beautiful place. Grounds very well kept. Room was huge but dark, dingy and had old era decor/furnishings. The block I was in smelt bad as you entered the hallway, and the smell was almost overwhelming in the bedroom. Best areas of this hotel are the pool, the bar an restaurant terrace. But you never really want to stay long because of the music. I really like my music and here I'm not talking about volume. The BIG problem is that you've got the pool music from the pool area and the bar-lounge music for the bar restaurant area. So at the bar-restaurant terrace you've got one ear hearing the pool music and the other hearing the bar music, all at the same time ! It drives you absolutely mad. A continual, repetitive, droning, non-stop noise calamity !! Who decided that this is a 'good idea'. Despite repeated requests, the hotel refused to sort it out - apparently the music is Hilton 'Corporate policy'. Goodbye Hilton… this is where companies lose it completely. Oh and pool music starts at 7.30 ! Food OK but way overpriced as was the wine. I'm sure you can do better in San Diego ! Assequor

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep on a park bench!!”
Reviews.Author: wutsurnim
Reviews.Content: It's all in the title. This place was absolutely atrocious. They have the most unprofessional staff I have ever dealt with. I travel between 25-30 weeks a year and I can tell you I will never stay at this hotel, nor any other Hilton or Hilton affiliate again!!! Dirty room, busted fridge that never was replaced, hallway reeked of urine, I think I'd rather eat McDonald's over the crap they serve at the restaurant, and $15 for a well martini?!?! GTFO! To top it all off, it is terribly located, parking sucks and they charge $25 a night for parking! Wow! I didn't know I was staying in downtown San Francisco. This place is putrid.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review...great time...mostly pros...some cons”
Reviews.Author: jobean2002
Reviews.Content: I think I must have stayed at a different hotel than some of these reviews!! Pros: From check-in on we recevied excellent service - even some above and beyond! The room was very clean with nice ammenities and a nice balcony. We probably received the worst location since I booked on hotwire and the hotel was 97% full but we were still pleasantly surprised. The beds and pillows are wonderful. Location was far away from everything but there were alot of activities to do just near the hotel. Great bike path and a great pool. Pool was packed...lots of kids and families. One of the pool guys - Dan - tried to help us find lounge chairs (towel wars - saving of chairs). He tried a couple of times - great service!!! The pool was cool and refreshing. One morning we had bloody marys at the pool (great ones!). They don't start bar service until 11:30 which was kind of late (need that bloody mary on a sunday morning!!) but you can walk to the very nice Olive Bar (very funny bartender) and they will give you a pool drink. The beach out front on the bay (it is not on the ocean) was really pretty. They have public fire pits so we bought a bundle of wood (which they sell at the resort) and sat on the beach with a fire - it was very beautiful. They also have really nice little conversation areas throughout the hotel - and a gas firepit they light at the pool until 10:00. Cons...(minor) there was rust around the bottom of the toilet, hallways and elevator were HOT, paying $25.00 for parking, asked for a wake up call one morning and it never came. Overall we had a great time, enjoyed the grounds, the pool and the people!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: HoustonBusyMom
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very toddler friendly, good proximity to Sea World, located on Mission Bay, our room faced the bay and we watched the fireworks from our patio every night and had a bon fire on the beach; loved the $99 spa treatment; water & bike rentals on hotel property; short walk to mission beach playground Cons: $25 daily 0parking, hotel very busy and room service is slow, patios needed cleaning and had old patio furniture, breakfast buffet is good but $20pp, room was not ready at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!! Horrible experience, not even close to a 4 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: vinny2
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience has been a horrible experience. The rooms are extremely dirty. There was something brown and disgusting on the wall, lights burned out, inadequate parking, horrible cust serv. Our room wasn't cleaned one day and when I called they never showed up. I do not recommend this hotel, there are many nice hotels in La Jolla, Coronado and Del Mar, I would not waste your time or money here. I have never been to a four star hotel that is this dirty, unorganized and rude. Even the cleaning gal that had to bring us towels because they didn't clean our room was rude!!! Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not great”
Reviews.Author: Hollykutty
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice in this hotel but the common areas weren't very clean. It's a short drive from all the sites in San Diego, which is a pain if you don't drive, but it is California and you have to drive everywhere anyway... The spa was having a $99 special, but they still tried to charge us full price afterward. It was a nice hotel but I thought they charged a little too much.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: wr943
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are actually nice and clean. The location in Mission Bay, however, is not great it was loud and not really that close to anything we like to do. If you want to go to sea world it is ok. To be sure, I can't stand the Mission Bay area of San Diego and will never stay around that area ever again. That is why I give this a two based upon location, location and location. Stay either in downtown or la jolla - Not Mission Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Biusiness”
Reviews.Author: norwayChicago
Reviews.Content: I generally liked the hotel but found it difficult to get around. The staff was great and the rooms were good. All in all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay if you get a good deal on the price”
Reviews.Author: CCSOrangeCounty_Ca
Reviews.Content: We got a good price for a garden room villa ($129)and got a $25.00 daily credit from zootravel.com. Since we are Hilton Honors members, we even got complimentary breakfast vouchers at the restaurant there. Breakfast at the restaurant was much better than the dinner. I don't mind paying money for a good dinner, but neither my husband nor I were happy with our dinners. The rooms are small, but are OK. It seems like they skimped in the wrong places in the rooms when they did the renovation. The front door to our room revealed layers of paint that made it look old and tacky. The bathroom also revealed crumbling paint. Nevertheless, the staff was nice. Not overly friendly, but they did their jobs. I would have to say the gardens are the best asset about this place. The landscaping is well maintaned and makes one feel as though they are at five star resort. We took our 3 & 5 year olds and they loved the kiddy pool. My only complaint, was the charge to use the business center computers. I have never been charged anywhere to use computers at a business center. Therefore, If you get a good deal, take it, its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: chad44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 4 years ago and it was not good! But with the renovations the hotel seems 1000 times better we had a room that was amazing and just had a great time and we will be back! It was a great Fathers Day weekend!

Reviews.Title: “all around great hotel for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: Phillyflygirl62
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was nervous about our "Hotwire" find. Turns out this hotel is fantastic. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was clean, the rooms VERY comfortable, the amenities were awesome. We used the spa, the fitness center, the tennis courts, the kayaks, the pool, the restaurant and found all outstanding. We came away after three days there extremely rested. My only complaint is that the spas were not that clean and small children were allowed to go in and out. We will go back with our teenage sons.

Reviews.Title: “A Stop for the Roadies”
Reviews.Author: TripInsider
Reviews.Content: We comparison-stopped at a series of Hiltons while driving from N. CA to Houston, TX. This hotel reads better in the brochure than it actually appears. The guest rooms( on higher floor with balcony) are furnished in heavy, dark decor--this struck me wrong; i was expecting airy and light or bright. The bathroom was extremely small, perhaps the smallest Hilton hotel bath ever. The room had been made up, but was lacking washcloths, bath mat and bath soap. These items were received promptly and a call was made to ensure i had received the items. On-site Acqua was nice, had outdoor seating with fireplaces and heat lamps, genial waiter, but the menu items were not appealing after a day of driving.(Big entrees with big prices, cream soups, complex appetizers-i wanted light and vegetarian) We finally settled on scallop appetizers and salads, which were nicely presented and also tasted good. Paved walking path is accessible from hotel. Pretty pool, but ducks were also in it! Strip of beach on inlet, but wear shoes. We spent one night, so i don't know if a longer stay would have provided more of a resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay-Great Spa”
Reviews.Author: PittMonkeygirly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a "reward stay" for our anniversary. We had a beautiful room with a large patio and fire pit. I would have liked the firewood to have been included, instead we had to buy it at the grocery store. I LOVED the spa treatments I had. If you're wanting a special treatment, I highly reccomend the Milk and Honey wrap. It was to die for! The pool area is lovely, although they could have had a waiter/waitress serving food/drinks. Overall we enjoyed this resort and would stay again. The maids and front desk people were very friendly, helpful and worked hard to make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money....”
Reviews.Author: colieanders
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline & was excited to stay at this "4-Star Resort". Although the grounds were beautiful the hotel itself looked old & worn (even after a multi-million $$ renovation). Parking was $22, staff was rude, not convenient to San Diego attractions. Even after paying 1/2 price through priceline we were disappointed...would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: srat
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at this hotel and did not want to leave. I really don't understand all the bad reviews. All of the employees at the hotel were extremely friendly, always speaking whenever I passed one of them. The pool area is beautiful and the location on the bay is wonderful too. Our room was cleaned everyday by the time I got back from the pool and the room was very nicely decorated. We stayed in the tower and did not have a view, but I was hardly in the room...I spent all of my time at the pool or we were out sightseeing in the evenings. I can understand that if you don't have a rental car it might not be that convenient, but I enjoyed the park and path along side the bay. We will definately stay here again the next time we are in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “great location for sea world vaca, but not overly impressed w/hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CAmommaluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 initially booked a 2 night stay, but unfortunately had to cut our stay to one night only. The original room we were given (garden view villa) had a terrible smell (dog or mildew) so we were given another similar room free from any offensive smells. The reason we couldn't stay another night is because the walls were so paper thin that next door we heard a newborn baby crying every hour the entire night. It was as if the baby was in a crib wailing in our own room. It truly felt as if we were sharing rooms! Maybe it was just our run of bad luck with the room situation, but I don't think it's convenient for anyone (including those with young children) to play musical rooms. The front desk hotel staff was surprisingly hostile when I innocently "reminded" them we had free parking included in our hotel package. Apparently I spoke too soon because the attendant said she was "getting to that!" I was also a little stunned that 2 of the front desk women wore Pro Union buttons as part of their uniform. I thought it was pretty offensive and shocked that Hilton would allow that. On a very positive note, we spent some time at the pool area and they had a great kids pool-very separate from the big pool, so i didn't feel as if the young single couples lounging were disrupted. The restaurant/bar food had excelent service and the free breakfast was a plus and surprisingly tasty. Overall i am glad we were so close to Sea World, but i would stay elsewhere next trip around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms/pool, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: 2SunnyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the San Diego Hilton Resort for a couple of nights after spending 5 days in Disneyland. Pros: - Pool was very nice. Nice large pool, with a couple of spas & lots of comfortable chairs to lay out on. Had a little "beach" area where ou could go play down in the bay next to the hotel. (No "water features" such as waterfalls or slides in the pool, though - was definately targeted at adults rather than at kids). - Room was well furnished, very comfortable - Had a great view from the balcony of the bay (we got lucky here, not all rooms had great views) - Somewhat close to Mission Beach (it was about a 10-15 minute drive - longer than I had originally expected when I booked the hotel) Cons: - $22/night for "parking" is excessive. This isn't downtown San Diego! If you're booking a room, make sure you factor this cost into the overall cost as it may affect your decision to stay here. - Housekeeping wasn't that great ... we found that our room wasn't completely cleaned when we showed up (trash cans weren't emptied, in-room coffee area wasn't cleaned/restocked). - Prices for boat rental / skiing / etc were crazy high. I spent less for 5 days at disneyland than what they were charging for 1 hour of water skiing (no, I didn't go water skiing). Overall, if you want a place with a large nice pool, this is a great place to stay. I don't expect to stay here again, though - we'll look elsewhere next time we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Bow_Wineaux
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip and I was so pleased with my experience at the Hilton Mission Bay that I wanted to leave a comment on Trip Advisor. After reading the last few reviews, I feel it is important that I leave a review to offer another perspective: We were not traveling with children, we had a rental car, we had no intention of being in a gym on a beautiful sunny day and I intentionally left my laptop at home. If that more or less fits your travel profile, there is nothing not to love about this place. It is "isolated" if you don't have a car, but it is 10 minutes to every beach in SD if you do. There is a beautiful park next door, and biking/running/walking trails right out your front door, along with bike and water-sport rentals. The staff was excellent in all regards. We did have a problem when we tried to check in early and were assured they would put a rush on having our room cleaned so we could check in. By 4:00 they still did not have our room ready so they upgraded us to a Garden Front Villa which was tastefully furnished and very comfortable. The towels were fine - don't know what to say about "sharp edges" review. And, yes - it costs $22 to park your car but I am from Seattle and this is common there, too. Being from rainy Seattle I have a thing for palm trees, and the beautifully landscaped grounds at the Hilton feature many. For only a 2 1/2 hour flight, I felt I had left the states for a tropical paradise when I arrived at the Hilton Mission Bay. The ambiance and decor throughout the property is very appealing - trendy and a touch retro but very well done. I highly recommend this hotel and the experience it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need to Know - Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: SSWilliams
Reviews.Content: Everything you need to know; the Good and Bad: Good: Family - This is a great hotel for families. A kid program ($12/hr), Swimming pool and Little Kid pool, Kid and Adult bike rental, Right on the beach of Mission Bay. Front Desk, Bell Hop, Kids Club, Housekeeping, Pool Staff - GREAT! Location: On Mission Bay across from SeaWorld. Watch SeaWorld's fireworks each night while you relax at the pool. Bad: Cost - You will be charged for EVERYTHING. Need to get on the internet from your room? There is a charge! Want to go to the Gym? There is a charge! Kids participate in the kid's program? There is a charge! Want to utilize one of the hotel's bikes? There is a charge! Want to make Smore's (which are highlighted in the hotel's advertisements)? There is a charge! Coffee Bar - This is not Starbucks; but they sell Starbucks coffee. Plan to stand in line for a long time to get your morning latte. Be careful, there is a female staff member that will not be only rude but will talk about you when you leave (yep she gave me her full opinion on a previous customer's outfit). Coffee Bar also closes early; so if you need a jolt after 1pm you are out of luck! Gratuity - Watch out! Gratuity at the restaurant and bar are normally automatically included in small print line item. However in bigger letters the bill ask you to write in a Gratuity amount; yep they want gratuity 2xs! Take a moment and review your bill at the restaurant and bar - there is a good chance you will find the gratuity already included. Party - Weekends are a BIG party time for local college kids to come to San Diego and party. Good chance you will wake up to some loud kids having a good time. Isolated - This hotel is on 17 acres with only 1 restaurant. Too far to walk to another restaurant. So if you don't have a car and don't want to pay too much for taxis; then you will need to eat at the resort. Breakfast is around $15 per person; Dinner is around $25 per person. Concierge - Nice group but are not too knowledgeable on local attraction costs and hotel policies. Activity brochures are hidden around the corner from the Concierge’s desk. Worth looking for the brochures and doing your own research. If you are a AAA member; call AAA directly to get their pricing for tickets to local attractions; they are normally less then what you can get from the concierge - yet the conceirge will always state they are less. Priceline - If you received your room thru Priceline (minimum bid is $80/night) then you will get the lower rooms in the tower. These rooms are fine; however your view will be of the parking lot. You can pay to have your room upgraded. Internet - In room cost money. Wireless in the comman area (by pool or lobby) is spotty. Rooms - Are dated and may have broken items (door handles, lamps). More of a 3 Star then a 4 Star; but it was not dirty and house keeping did a good job on keeping it looking nice. Transportation - While this hotel is on 17 acres; they still charge a huge parking fee - $25/night. Since it is out of the way; taxis charge a premium for usage. A trip to the zoo or airport is around $25 each way. To Sea World is around $15 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled”
Reviews.Author: mciordan
Reviews.Content: Location: On the far E side of Mission Bay, right of the highway, in the middle of a very popular area of the park.Lots of people walking in close proximity to the villas..The pool area is gated, but the villas are not.The are homeless people camping around . This was the first time I did not feel safe staying at a hotel. One night, while on the patio, we could clearly see someone hiding in the bushes. The villas are remodeled, beds are comfortable, rooms are spacious with refrigerator and coffee station with Lavazza coffee.There was a damp smell that we could not get rid of; it must have been there for a long time.:-) The grounds are beautiful, unfortunately, we did not get to take advantage of all the seasonal activities - mostly available during the summer season. I would return if not for the safety issues. If you decide to go, try and get a centrally located villa, maybe closer to the pool area and not on the property edge.Also, be prepared to pay an outrageous parking fee for self parking...I believe it was over $20/ night.

Reviews.Title: “Not one of the best Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: DMR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a business function. Here are the good points. The location is nicely situated on the bay, close to the walking and biking path with lots of park areas and access to the water for young families. Freeway and Seaworld access is close. The pool area is wonderful. Gift shop, bar and restaurant all very nice. We stayed in the lower level garden wing with just a tiny view of the water. The room was spacious, clean and well decorated. Here are the bad points. It is isolated from other services, so you will need your car or take a taxi to leave the resort for other goods/services or dining. There is an expensive fee to park your vehicle overnight. My biggest complaint is about the bath towels in this hotel. I have stayed in many fine hotels ( and not so fine hotels) and these towels were by far the worst I have ever seen or felt. I have never written a report before about bad towels but these were so bad that I felt it necessary to warn future travelers. They are not thin or cheap towels but have thick and sharp ridges in them. When drying off after a shower it actually HURTS to rub these towels against your body. I don't know who picked out these linens, but they should get rid of them. For a higher end hotel, charging premium rates for water views, you should have plush and pleasant towels for bathing. Beyond this frustration, we walked past a room service tray out in the hallway that remained in the same spot for three days during the visit. Not sure where the customer service was. These negative points may seem petty, but they would keep me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggie47
Reviews.Content: Unlike some prior raters, we had incredible service. (Maybe management pays attention to TripAdvisor?!) This is a resort on San Diego Bay with a huge pool and lots of water sports available. It also is adjacent to park areas with lots of updated playgrounds for kids, a walk/bikeway that is several miles along the bay, and bay shoreline where you can swim (no waves--good for kids) and have campfires. The hotel has been updated with new linens and flat screen TVs. We asked for a quiet room so had no trouble with noise. It is a good resort for families so I don't know if being next to a young family would have been a problem. Since it was off season, there were a limited number of children and the hotel was fine for couples as well. The location is close to Old Town and freeway close to other San Diego attractions. We were able to get a discounted hotwire.com price so it was a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mare2teach
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for my daughter, it was a belated birthday gift. I called the hotel and spoke with Lisa. I am a Hilton Honors member and so is my daughter. I was alittle concerned as I had booked this on a third party site. I made a few simple requests. I was pleased to hear that they were honored and even though Lisa did not check her in, she had honored my requests. I was very impressed . My daughter stayed in the tower rooms and shared that the location was excellent. The hotel was central to so many things they had planned to do: Zoo, Balboa Park, Mission Beach etc. She loved the pool and beach areas, rooms had modern clean lines with a nice flat screen TV. We travel quite a bit to California:(San Diego,L.A & Anaheim).I am so happy to know we can add this resort to our San Diego list! For me, it's all about service.so I wanted to tell Greg Fracassa, the G.M.at this property, how much I appreciated Lisa and the rest of his staff. Thanks for making my daughter's trip a memorable one! Mrs. W.

Reviews.Title: “You'd be stupid to stay here”
Reviews.Author: hiltonsucks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my anniversary and was astonished at the level of incompetence and terrible location. It is absolutely nothing like the pictures illustrate on all the websites. We stayed in their Lanai villa bayfront room priced at $320 per night. What a joke of room and waste of money. If you're looking for a nice romantic weekend with the one you love look elsewhere to spend it as you will be completely disappointed. Our room faced out toward the "bay" which was actually more like a swamp without trees. Its located on a public park with a bike path nearly 15 feet from your sliding glass door with constant people walking, running, biking and/or skateboarding from sun up until about 11 pm at night. Their noise can easily be heard even with the sliding glass door shut and no windows open. The furnishings in the room are all mismatched and look like they were picked up the day before at a consignment store and thrown in to make it a "room" including hanging wires to the tv and internet connection (of course you have to pay to use the WiFi) visible and dangling there under the table they set the tv on. There was not even a coffee maker even though in their description it states there is one. We ordered room service which came after 45 minutes (it was a pizza and chicken sandwich, yes seriously 45 minutes later) and both were cold and almost inedible had it not been for our hunger. The beer was the best part of that dinner and that was because it was bottled beer they couldn't screw up. You have to PAY $22 A NIGHT TO SELF PARK YOUR CAR BECAUSE VALET ISN'T OFFERED. On Sunday morning, we were woken up by two sets of crew teams rowing and yelling down the swamp, err i mean bay, at 830 am. To top it off and yes, i'm not joking about this, YOU HAVE TO INDIVIDUALLY TURN ON AND OFF EACH LIGHT BECAUSE THERE IS NO LIGHT SWITCH IN THE ROOM. I mean, is there any other word to use here besides simply, unbelievable. The best part of our weekend was when we weren't wasting time at this awful, awful hotel. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone as I regret having wasted the amount of money we spent on our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, clean rooms, incompetant management”
Reviews.Author: sallyaMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: First the positives: the hotel is situated in a great location, the grounds are beautiful,the rooms very clean, modern and spacious. Super comfy beds, delicious food at the restaurant. Now for the rest of the story: We were unaware of the State Department Travel Advisory against any travel to Tijuana. Last Friday we spoke with the concierge to ask questions about visiting Tijuana. We talked for at least ten minutes and in that time she never ONCE mentioned how dangerous it is for Americans to travel to border towns. We were the ONLY Americans anywhere in sight. Lots of police and armed soldiers everywhere. We had no idea, had not paid attention to news on this story, which is unfortunate, but it is inexcusable that a concierge in a hotel 20 miles from the border would fail to advise us of the danger. On our last night at the hotel there was a very loud party going on in the room next to ours. Through the thin walls the noise carried nonstop. Our calls to the front desk at 12, 2:30 a.m. got the security guard to stop by the room----and that was completely ineffective. We were woken up again and again until the party finally ended after 3:30 a.m. There were several options: moving the partiers to another part of the not-too-full hotel, or else breaking up the party. But the management had no clue how to deal with it, and as a result, we got a very poor night's sleep. Isn't a good nights sleep the most basic thing you pay for???? But it is amateur hour at this hotel, run by a bunch of young and clueless "managers". I will not likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: happytanner
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay on Hotwire. My stay was determined by price and ratings. I attended a workshop at another 4 star hotel nearby The posted rate for the other hotel was $130 avg per night. I paid $99 per night, plus $22 per night parking fee and $10.95 per night internet connection which I was told is not wireless because the hotel is too old and the cost to install wireless in every room is prohibitive. The other hotel didn't charge for parking or internet nor did a local 2 star hotel where one of the other attendees stayed. Also, you could hear people using the toilet in adjacent rooms. My 'bargain' room overlooked the freeway which could be heard at all hours of the day and night. I think it is time for some soundproofing. On a positive note, the staff is great, the grounds are beautiful, beds very comfortable and the food delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: draudio
Reviews.Content: I am a HHonors Diamond VIP, so I used some points to take my family to San Diego for the weekend. We had stayed at this property a couple of years ago and were not impressed. We had debated whether or not to re-visit this time. We were very pleased with the remodel that has been completed since our last trip. The room was an upgraded lanai room on the 2nd floor. The extra floor space and vaulted ceiling made the room feel spacious. A large flat screen TV was nice, but the programming selection was pretty sparse. (Not that we watched much TV...). Bathroom fixtures were nice and new, not fancy. Beds and linens were comfortable. The staff was pleasant and efficient. As this was a rewards stay, I can't comment on price to value, but we were happy and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: pm85
Reviews.Content: This Hilton has beautiful grounds but the rooms are dated. I stayed in 543 in a roomy villa room. I am enjoying a nice view of the bay, but the room just feels dated. Also, you will need to dirve to any restaurants. They also charge $20/day for the car and $11/day for internet. It's just OK and I won't rush back. The good news is that it is very convenient to I5 and it is very close to both Sushi Ota and the original Rubios. There is also a nice walking path connected to the hotel and the pool is very nice. It you get a very good deal, then this is OK. If not, then I would hesitate to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Updated Property with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: MMM2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a recent business trip. I booked a tower room on the hotel's website, but when I checked in, I was given room 221 in one of the villas (a nice upgrade). The room was on the second floor, looking out on the water & had an amazing view of the sunset. The room was clean, updated & nicely decorated. The Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries at the Hilton hotels are always nice. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is not close to any restaurants or to downtown, so a car or a taxi are necessary if you want to leave the property. A taxi to/from the airport runs $20-25 each way, depending on the taxi company. I also found that airport shuttles vary in price significantly. It was $17 from the airport to the hotel & only $9 from the hotel to the airport with a different company. The hotel staff were friendly & helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Tuning”
Reviews.Author: Bonitagranville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a standard room in Nov. through Orbitz with a non refundable, what we thought was a good, rate.for a trip Dec. 30-Jan.2 We were told we could not request a room till ck. in at 4pm.Got there at 3:56pm and were told all the waterfront rms. were taken.We were told they had all been taken by earlier ck. ins. We were told we couldn't ck in early.I asked how this happened, and they simply shrugged and said "sorry." We got stuck in a rm. for 3 nights overlooking the frwy and next to the ice machine and elevator that made noise all night long.Our last night we were talking to a couple at the bar that got a rate $50 less than ours(looking over the Bay). The restaurant was pricey, but very good with excellent service. We will not be going back,especially since there are so many hotels to choose from.I will return to ACQUA though.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: Rndthewrld
Reviews.Content: Nice, well-decorated rooms. Good pool area. Lots of on site activity options. If you don't know San Diego and will be at the hotel a lot this is an excellent spot. It is close to Sea World. It is not on the ocean but rather Mission Bay which has no surf. The sailing and jet skiing are great here. One down side is there aren't close restaurants within walking distance. You'll have to drive to eat or stay in the resort which charges a bundle for breakfast and lunch.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at the San Diego Hilton Resort”
Reviews.Author: rossde
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 straight years here in the 1990s and loved it. They have done a recent remodel and the rooms have been updated nicely. We stayed in a larger "lanai" room which gave a little more room for our two teenagers. I think the best rooms for families open up to the garden and allow young kids to walk around outside the rooms. The beauty of this resort is the setting. You are right on Mission Bay and there are so many activities available on the bay itself from sailing to biking to just walking along the bayfront path. We lucked out with beautiful weather but there is a lot to in town even if the weather is not good. A few glitches that i would be aware of: During our late December 2008 stay the "pizza oven" was broken and apparently had been for a month. It would have been nice if an insert was in the room service menus explaining this if it really was a long term problem.. There are 4 pizzas mentioned on the menu. While we had a nice bike ride and rode in a 7 mile circuit, the rental bikes are all seem to be old cruisers and have seen better days. It would be nice if they updated them as nicely as the rooms are updated. On the plus side, the beds were very comfortable, and the food was delicious. They have a nice spa, tennis courts and exercise facility with nice treadmills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere at Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: HHICNSAND
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Diego the week of Dec 3. We spent two nights at the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa on Mission Bay. Upon early check in 12:00 PM, we were greeted by very friendly front desk staff. Although we booked through priceline, they looked at various room options that would be available and gave us a bay view room in the tower. We entered our room which looked exactly like pictures we had seen on line. They have done renovations and everything is nice clean and newer. We utilized the on site restaurant Acqua and bar The Olive as there are no options within walking distance due to the resort's location. I must say that we really enjoyed lunch at Acqua including the Ahi tuna salad and fresh, warm baked bread. We also had breakfast at Acqua and although it was pricey $36 before gratuity, it was delicious! My husband got a wonderful crab/egg dish and I got an omlette made my way with potatoes, toast and fruit. All the food at Acqua was very fresh and delicious. The wait staff was friendly too. On our second evening we headed down to the Olive for drinks and the bartender Aleem was friendly and professional. He gave my husband and I complimentary drinks in honor of our anniversary, nice touch! The only negative comments we have are the computerized wake up system did not wake us up at 5:00 AM. Also, we called the valet and asked him to get us a cab for 6:00 AM, no cab. Had to ask the front desk staff to call a cab. Luckily the cab arrived a few minutes after and we made it to the airport in plenty of time. Cab ride to airport from Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa $25.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: stooksk
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze; convenient 10 min. parking in front of lobby. We were put in the building directly across from the lobby so parking was super easy. Building looked very historical (re: OLD) on the outside so I wasn't sure what to expect on the inside but the hallway colors were very hip and the carpet very chic. I was very impressed with the size of the room and the room decor. Loved the linens, headboard, lighting, flatscreen tv, giant desk, carpet - it was all very hip and cool. We requested a king and were accomodated. No bay views, unfortunately! Bed was very comfortable. We weren't able to get a free wi-fi signal and didn't want to spend more to get the land line. Bathroom was very neat - loved the light fixtures. Only sour notes were that the toilet was round so a little on the small side and the tile shower/tub didn't get the benefit of the remodel - still looked a little dated. We walked around the property near the bay and it was very nice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: kariMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the San Diego Resort on MIssion Bay. I was actually running a conference there, which I feel brings a more critical eye to a review, as I had 200 people letting me know what they thought. In one word: amazing. I had been here pre-renovation, and almost didn't recognize this property. The location sure doesn't hurt, but the atmosphere is created by the hotel. Everywhere I went the grounds were well kept, the pool area was gorgeous and relaxing, the fireplaces throughout the public areas were so inviting...I loved the feeling throughout the resort. The food was always wonderful, especially when served in the new restaurant that overlooks the bay, next to yet another fireplace. The final ribbon on this prize is was the staff. They were completely dedicated to making this stay amazing. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: BadgerTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Villas area with connected rooms. The Villas are one and two story. The rooms have a modern decor that has recently been updated. The pool area was very nice. There were no problems with noise. We slept like babies. The staff was very helpful and the restaurant good. We will stay here again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: hwhinmt
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our room, lots of pillows and the staff was friendly. The location was great to get on the freeway and off to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Hilton - Above Average”
Reviews.Author: jnpoulos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 7 nights. At first, we thought the hotel needed some updating despite having a major overhaul. Although very expensive and really only having 1 restaurant which is ok, we still enjoyed our stay. It is in a great location if you want to rent a bike, boat, jet ski, canoe, run a great path. No shuttle and no restaurants close by, but for a 10-15 dollar taxi ride, you can go to Old Town for some great Mexican food or Little Italy for some great Italian food. Yes, this property is not perfect. Decent tennis courts and spa. Two nice jacuzzis. Pool is also nice (watch out for the duck poop . . . ducks hang out in the pool early morning and poop in it - just ask for it to be cleaned). We had a 2 hour protest which was annoying. Rooms are spacious, but not luxurious. The "lanai" is a balcony is you are on the second floor, so don't expect much more. The lanais and fire pits on the first floor are great. The cabanas at the pool are $75 dollars for the day during the week, 120 and 150 for c9 on the weekends. If you have children under 10, the hotel offers pizza, ice cream and movie night outside by the pool on a giant screen. This lasts from 8 - 10, perfect for a nice, quiet dinner at the restaurant with complimentary fireworks from sea world. The restaurant has a great wine selection ad top shelf liquor (from Johnny Blue to Calvados). In all, not the best, but if you want some time with your spouse and a relaxing stay, I would recommend this hotel. We have already booked for next year. BTW - our son loved the kids club which runs from 2 - 4. Another two hours to spend in the hot tub and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced - maintenance issues”
Reviews.Author: greenshoe
Reviews.Content: Contacted hotel directly and then hotel toll free no. to make reservations for a family get together. This was our 3rd visit there and 2nd family get together. Agents and front desk do no know the deals offered by the hotel - you have to tell them and still speak up when checking in. I called directly to try to get 3 rooms close by with extended patio that the cousins might be able to play on and visit other rooms/hang out easily. Told agent that it was important to me and was willing to pay more for a room for my request. With taxes, the rooms were about $400 a night each. Upon arriving to our rooms, which were nicely situated all next to one another we found out that the extended patios were walled in in the back so not easy access among the rooms and also were dusty with pine needles all over and their once nice outdoor furniture grimy. Not inviting at all. Had to call to get it cleaned. Also front desk never told us us that one room only had 1 king bed instead of the 2 queens we requested and needed ( 4 in our family). Strange, since we even requested an extra room key card so our 2 kids could share it. Rooms were fine with the extended section with an small counter top area with frig but a very uncomfortable sofa/chair ? No ventilation in any of the bathrooms so can't see the mirror after showers, lacks storage in the bathroom as well as the room if you are staying there with more than 2 people to a room. On the 2nd to our last night, my husband found a mouse in our bathtub. Also found (perhaps same mice - he threw it out the back patio somehow) mouse in room next door right outside the sliding glass door. We never opened the slider door to patio after that. Called (before 10 AM ) to ask to have the bathroom cleaned really well - never came until mid afternoon (4 pm ?) even after going to the front desk in person at 2 pm to ask why no one had come to clean the tub and bathroom. and I think they only did the standard cleaning job. Can't say I want to ever go back there anymore. Other than that...the hotel is nice with it's own dock for water sport rentals, Mission bay view, and close location to Sea World. If you go there don't pay for an extended patio room unless you make sure you are getting the flat extended patio looking out at the bay and also avoid the height of summer. The hotel becomes too crazy crowded. Nice fitness facility and tennis courts. Spa was average but adding an automatic 20 % tip for the customer's convenience is a questionable practice to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: CatpawParkville_Mo
Reviews.Content: We have three children and were excited for a fun family vacation. The resort is beautiful. The problem was it had no close restaurants or anyting else walking distance. We did not rent a car so we had to eat at the one restaurant that they had and it was expensive. the pool restaurant closed early. The kid club that they had was not good. My kids did not want to participate, it was a tiny room and the activities seemed lame. We ended up moving hotels downtown to embassy suites by the harbor and loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Place”
Reviews.Author: Buenzli
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and remodeled (decor a bit tacky though), staff seemed attentive, pool area was great for the kids, charming atmosphere in the evening with the fire on the restaurant's balcony, all-in-all very relaxing. Only minor downside was the charge for parking which seemed a bit excessive. Would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barone7783
Reviews.Content: We arrive after a long flight from New York (5 1/2 hour flight). We get to the hotel and some how between the travel agent and the hotel, my reservation was all screwed up the hotel only had me down for 3 nights but the travel agent voucher had 4 nights. The hotel said they would fix it wasn't a big problem. We had to wait about an hour for our rooms couldn't wait to relax but we get to the room and it's not the room we wanted. They upgraded us to a bigger room and told us to enjoy our vacation and that they would take care of the mixup...so we did. About the fourth day we get a bill slip under our door saying we were checking out today. Called the front desk they need us to come down A.S.A.P. After wasting a morning on the phone with my travel agent, the front desk tells us everything is okay we spoke to your travel agent everything is ok. We get back from the zoo and our room keys don't work. They locked us out of our room because there was no communication between the morning manager and the afternoon manager. The best part of this whole vacation was seaworld which is only 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: qwsmith
Reviews.Content: Hotel offers no shuttle service. That means no shuttle service to Seaworld and no shuttle service to the airport. Hotel offers no laundry facilities. That means if you want a t-shirt washed, it will cost you $6.95, ouch! Hotel offers major hotel worker protests. All day on 8/16/08 the hotel union workers had protests. They beat the drums, had loudspeakers and were really obnoxious. I felt sorry for all the vacationers including myself that had to listen to them protest all day long. Hotel offers unattentive staff. Was at the pool for 2 hours and no waitstaff. Finally had to go to the bar to get a beer. Additionally, called the concierge (which was not available) left a message and it was 4 hours before I received a returned call. I could go on and on (and am even still at the hotel), but will get right down to the point, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone and will NEVER return....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Terrible!! Left After One Day!!”
Reviews.Author: HonestTravels
Reviews.Content: Hilton's new ad says "be hospitable". Well this resort is the exception. We stay at Hiltons all the time and are HHonors gold members. We've never had a problem, anywhere in the world. This resort advertises being child friendly. Well it depends on the ages of your children. Kids under three may NOT swim in the regular pool. Even with swim diapers AND vinyl/rubber pants. When I complained, they told me that I could send my four and seven year old in the big pool alone and I could go to the baby pool with my one year old. They suggested I send a four year old in a big pool, unsupervised. To make it worse, they actually smiled smugly as they did nothing to remedy the situation. To add to that, the pool manager has never even heard of vinyl/rubber pants for kids to swim in!! They should make that clear when you book the hotel, because my family did not book a "lavish" resort to be seperated during swimming time. In fact, we checked out and stayed at another hilton available in san diego, to which we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyColo
Reviews.Content: Bad experience. Family of 5 traveled from Denver for a 3 day weekend. Booked a adjoining bayview terrace rooms. What a joke. Not at all as described, if the front desk even gave us what we had booked. They were the most expensive to pick from. Not ready upon arrival at 4:00pm. Everything was too pricey. Place was not clean, grounds, etc. Pool was too small without enough chairs. If you dont get out there by 9-10am, your out of luck until 4pm. Pool bar and food service is marginal. The girls are too busy, takes along time, and the quality is not worth the price. The site indicates you get maid servive and turndown, not true. The maids never came before 4:00pm, and did a lousy job. The website also indicates 24hr room service, not true as well, it ends at 10:00pm. Parking is a disaster. Not enough anywhere close to the rooms. Hilton needs to do some major work here, as there are many unfavorable comments, and like us, wont be back. I would much rather of been at the Hyatt, or even the Downtown Embassy Suites, both for less money, with better accomodations and service. Couple other items, no chairs at all on the beach, and no mini bars in the rooms also as the website promised.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware! Way overpriced!!”
Reviews.Author: R0sie13
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the tower portion of the hotel on the property. The halls were very dark and dingy! Room was very, very small. They charge extra $$ for everything except for use of the pool. To park your car in their lot you have to pay $22/day. Major rip-off! Front desk staff very snooty.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton can clearly do better”
Reviews.Author: rickNewportbeach
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this resort on numerous occassions. After many tripa and plain BAD service, we switched to another hotel. However, my wife and I decided to give it another try in June, when we attended a local wedding. Everytime I stay at this hotel, what I am promise and what I GET are two different things. It always turns into a 45 minute hassel. Ironically, the LA Times Travel Editor recently wrote a story on this hotel and had the same problems! In fact when you check in you tend to find a lot of unhappy customers griping about something that was not done or delivered. It is a beautiful site, but the front desk staff are poorly trained and have no power to remedy problems. Once you get in, you will pay $$$ everytime you turn around so that one night "get away" ended up costing over $600. Clealry, you can do better elsewhere. Hilton is a great chain, as a Hiltin Hhonors member, I frequent them in my travels, but striike this one off your list!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: dms193
Reviews.Content: My wife attended a conference there in February. It was a really nice place to relax and unwind. We brought our 1 year old along and she had a great time toddling around the grounds, chasing after the ducks and gulls. The walking path along the bay is beautiful and there are parks at either end. So its in a perfect place especially if you have kids. Seaworld is right down the road. The room was great, but parking was a bit scarce. We had to walk around our building to get to the car. The restaurant and pool were closed while we were there, which was a bummer. They opened it the last day of our stay and it was really nice (though still cold).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good facilities but in need of better cleaning”
Reviews.Author: reedfamilyboa
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 6 night stay at the Hilton San Deigo Resort & Spa in July as part of a family holiday to California. Hotel has been recently upgraded and enjoys a great pool area, good bar/restaurant and excellent spa facilities. Good sized rooms but let down by the standards of cleanliness in the corridors, in particular, but also to a lesser extent in the rooms and the pool water needed cleaning (so reported my son who spent a lot of time in the pool). New poolside bar area opened during our stay and well equipped and comfortable. Poolside waitress service was excellent - love the orange vest tops ! Location is good in terms of freeway access but certainly not a place you could abandon your car. Possible to walk long the beachfront but nothing to walk to - no adjacent bars or places to eat. Great views of the Sea World fireworks - every night !

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation in San Diego- Nice stand alone resort”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in July 2008. We booked on Priceline for $102/night. For the money, this was a very nice hotel. One complaint would be the $22/night valet or self parking fee. Since there is absolutely nothing around this resort, there is no options but to park your car here and pay the crazy rate. Internet is $13 a day but I think you can get free wireless around the pool. The pool area is nice. There are a couple jacuzzi's, a kid's pool and a big pool. There are cabana's to rent for 75/day weekdays or 120/day weekends for the whole day. Overall, the pool area was very nice. Looked at the beach, but its not a beach to lay around and relax but to do water activities or biking. Our rooms were on the 6th floor in the tower. We had a view of the bay as well as the 9:50pm fireworks show at Seaworld. Fireworks lasted around 5 minutes and that was a good fringe benefit of the room. The room came with 2 beds, desk, chair, refrigerator for your things and safe. The bathroom was clean and small but functional. Plenty of towels. We stayed in 2 rooms and one them was not available until 4:30pm. Check in time is 4:00. Check out time is 12 noon. Staff is very nice. If the price is right, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego not Vegas”
Reviews.Author: emt1170
Reviews.Content: Let me start off from the beginning. My wife and I had just spent our first two days of our honeymoon in Vegas at the New York, New York Hotel and Casino where I didn't feel very welcomed or my business appreciated, maybe I'm old fashioned, but if I'm laying down almost two hundred dollars a night, I expect respect and gratitude. I just felt like another dollar bill in there pocket. Anyways after leaving and flying in to San Diego, we arrived a little early at the Hilton and Mark, at the front desk, was very friendly and professional and when he found out I was on my honeymoon upgraded my room to this beautiful room on the bay. As soon as I got there I was treated with the utmost respect and courtesy. I don't ask much of people, but when I'm spending a lot of money on a vacation, this is something I expect. But at the Hilton, all the employees were nice and friendly. If you want a great place to stay where you can get away, this would be it. You can sit by the pool or jet ski, play tennis and you're only about a 10 minute drive to the Beach or Downtown San Diego. It was such a beautiful setting with a relaxed but luxurious feel. I could go on, but I will definitely stay at this Hilton in the future. Thank you for making my honeymoon everything my wife and I had dreamed.

Reviews.Title: “Great remodel job”
Reviews.Author: dancergal
Reviews.Content: Hilton recently renovated and upgraded this property, and the rooms are a great improvement, with with flat screen TVs, better mattresses, and, wonder of wonders, the key cards always worked! [This was a major problem the 5 times I stayed at this hotel for the same business conference.] Unfortunately, their main restaurant still suffers from a limited menu, poor execution, and execrable service. The refurbished public areas, particularly the pool, are excellent. The traffic pattern from the meeting areas to the restaurant and shops has been improved as well [the former arrangement required you to exit the conference wing and reenter by the main entrance].

Reviews.Title: “OK But Cannot Treally Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: Either we had the same room as the previous reviewer or tub problem is common at this property. The front desk claimed that that the rooms had been recently updated but either the job was extremely prooly done or they were lying. Tub looked was definitely either dirty or on desperate need of resurfacing. Furniture was chipped and and room was overall dark. Hotel would have looked much better with a lighter, brighter nautical look rather than the attempt they have made at a safari look. On the bright side pool is great and my kids enjoyed the kids club. Grounds are beautiful. Overall I think the main problem is the inexperienced management and ownership. THis property has everything to be truly first class.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you're looking for and price”
Reviews.Author: CAFamilyRvwr
Reviews.Content: This is hard to review--the location along Mission Bay is attractive, as there are some nice bay views and it's right along a recreational path for biking, running and connects to surrounding parks and even Sea World. However, the hotel is not within walking distance of any other restaurants or attractions, so a car is a must. There is a nice family swimming pool, and rental of bike and water equipment. But rentals were a bit pricey and bicycle selection was limited and condition was not great (squeaky chain, worn handgrips). The 2 Queen room was unusually spacious, as was the bathroom. It had a nice sliding door that opened out onto the path along the bay. I could even see the fireworks from Sea World each evening from the patio outside my room. However, the tub was either in need of re-surfacing or poorly done, as the bottom had an unappealing two-tone look where the top coating had worn through. The most upsetting was being awoken by mosquitoes at night. I killed a few each day before going to bed, and am guessing that they were let in when the room was cleaned. Overall, the service seemed mediocre. When I arrived at around 3:15, I was told that check-in was at 4:00 and my room was not ready. Judging by the constant stream of guests checking on room availability and several others in my meeting group that had the same story, the management of the property seems inefficient. When I tried later, I was able to get a clerk who would switch me to an available room. I agree that it's a secluded location, so if you just want to get away from it all, or have a meeting where you just want to walk around a bit during the day, it would work, and if you had a car it could even serve as a reasonable base for San Diego attractions. So, depends on what you want, and maybe the price you can get a room for.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: tkgn514
Reviews.Content: I thought the Mission Bay Hilton Resort and Spa was fantastic for a recent girls weekend. We stayed in one of the lower level villa rooms and the patio with comfy lounge chairs was great! I also liked the size of the room and the decor. Yes, the hallway and entry to the hallway looks more dated, but this didn't bother me. It seems from other postings that the tower rooms are not nearly as good. The pool area was fantastic, especially the cabanas by the pool. There were plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas during the very warm weekend. The pool bar made some really great drinks as well. It was a weekend in June, so we expected a lot of families and kids to be there and there were. Probably not so great for a romantic getaway, but fine for us. We chose this hotel since we knew we would lounge by the pool all day vs. the beach, but if you are a beach person, this may be inconvenient. The downside to this property is that it is not within walking distance of anything, although it is situated between the beaches to the north (very close), old town, and the airport and downtown (approx. 10-15 minutes away via cab). The restaurant was fair and I like that they offered pool service for drinks and food. Sandwiches and salads were great. All in all, the Hilton Resort & Spa had a good resort feel to it and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money..Checked in and right back out!”
Reviews.Author: brownanm
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my boyfriend somewhere really nice for his birthday. The hotel pics on their website made it look amazing. Do not be fooled... the rooms (we booked a bayfront villa at $569a night) are nothing like is stated or shown. The bayfront view was disgusting. The balcony had two really uncomfotable chairs, not the lounges like they show. There was a planter on the balcony (which is on top) of another villa's roof had dead flowers growing in it. There were cigarette butts and beer bottle caps all over the balcony. The chair in the tiny room was broken. The bathroom was so small and gross. I would not have even washed my feet in there. The room was also very smelly from a burnt out vacuum they were using all over the floor. We checked in and right back out. We had to ask a manager to give us our money back. Horrible hotel... do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTravel123
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 3-year old over the busy Memorial Day weekend and the Hilton San Diego Resort met - and at times exceeded - our expectation of a perfectly-situated family destination. Because of my Hilton Honors status, we were upgraded to a first floor garden room, a quiet oasis where our daughter even got to feed a family of ducks. The room was 25 yards from the beach, perfect for her to build sandcastles during beautiful sunsets. Also, we lucked out to stay on a Saturday when they were showing a family outdoor film at the pool, complete with free popcorn. Speaking of the pool, the kid-friendly, long sloping entrance was especially fun. Room service was surprisingly prompt. Only minor complaint was that the bathrooms could use an update. But if you are looking for a family hotel minutes to Sea World and the Zoo, we'd happily recommend the Hilton San Diego Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: octagon18
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Hilton San Diego Resort and only have the best to say! The rooms appear to be brand new (we stayed 1st floor main building, no view). It is a good size with plenty of room for your luggage. A comfy bed, private terrace, in room safe and deluxe bath accessories await you. We came into contact with many of the staff from the front desk, bellman, restaurant, bar, spa and housekeepers and everyone was wonderful. You are treated very well at this hotel. It is a comfortable atmosphere with enough high end to make you feel like you are on vacation and being taken care of. You have to try the chocolate martini from the hotel bar, it is out of this world!! The pool area is expansive with private cabanas and a waterfall. You are right on Mission Bay with views of Sea World and the surrounding areas of San Diego. The bay breeze is a nice thing to come back to after a long day in Sea World or the Zoo. Sea World is only 2.5 miles away and it literally is around the corner. The Zoo is 7.5 miles away and easy to get too. Coronado, Downtown, La Jolla, Pacific Beach and Ocean Beach are close by with most less than 15 minutes on the 5 which is less than a mile from the hotel. The only thing I would ask for are plasmas in the room vs the older square TV.

Reviews.Title: “not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: travelgalAvon
