Reviews.Content: on tag along business travel with the hubby-our room was upgraded to a suite (due to status with hotel chain) with a fire pit on the back patio and the bay out the back door (very nice) huge bathroom, sunken sitting area but....the entire place has been decorated sixties retro and i just do not like a zebra striped carpet, hanging lamps, the most uncomfortable looking (as well as sitting in) chairs. the place is all brand new yet it looks dated. i hated, hated, hated it and was glad we switched to the hyatt (across the bay) for the rest of the trip (review to follow). but like i said this place is too wierd retro for me and the "oh how cool" effect wears off real fast- the restaurant was awful also-a table was open on the patio when we showed up, we were told to wait for them to set up an outside table (after they tried to get us to stay inside) waited ten minutes constantly being told "table is being cleared" etc.. were shown to the EXACT table that was clean and open when we showed up-ridiculous. food was mediocre and expensive. management did cut food bill in half when we told him of situation at checkout so that was appreciated but i'd rather have had my table right away and some decent food. will not return here

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: testudo99
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week with my wife and 3 1/2 year old. We booked through priceline for $130 a night. Awesome deal I thought. Very nice and relaxing. Nice pool with bar in pool area. My son didn't want to get out. A lot of kids along with many adults around the pool (also had a kiddie pool for the little ones to hang out in). Rooms very clean and bathroom was on the bigger side. The room had a fridge which was nice. Parking was great, I was able to park right outside of my room. The only negative was the $22 a day to park. Oh well, the hotel made up for it. The grounds were very nice. ***Definitely would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor on service”
Reviews.Author: Nelspark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort for four nights in April, 2008. The location was great and it was close to Sea World and Old Town. It was a good base for our stay. However, the first night of our stay, our mattress was wet. We didn't arrive until 1:00 am so this was annoying as we wanted to go straight to sleep. They sent someone to change the sheets, but it didn't help with the wet mattress. Our son suggested we flip it over, which we did. We mentioned the wet mattress to the front desk staff and they were disinterested. The hotel is decorated beautifully, but I suggest you don't look too closely in the corners. My boys had lego and we were on our hands and knees looking for missing pieces and apparently the vacuum only stays to the main areas. It was pretty gross. We told the staff at the front desk, and again they were disinterested. The service at the restaurant was spotty. On our last day, the hostess seated us and we ended up waiting for 30 minutes before anyone even showed up to take our order. Finally we were helped and they comped our meal. Overall, it's a great location and a fine looking hotel. The boys loved the swimming pool, which was very nice. The grounds were beautiful and the location on the beach was lovely. But our room wasn't the cleanest and found the staff at this hotel uninterested in customer service. I found the lack of interest on behalf of the staff to be very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Dieog--average at best”
Reviews.Author: Sentinel_Node
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for a conference for 4 days... Good things: Secluded location--good for those who just want to hang at the hotel. Drinks at the bar are pricey, however, ask JV to make them, and they are delicious--especially the Mango Mojito. Undergoing renovations. I forgot my charger there, and they were nice enough to mail it back to me. Bad things: Front desk staff acted as if they were doing us a favor by checking us in--I'm Hilton Gold! We did get the breakfast vouchers though. Rooms are arranged in these odd "villas", some have indoor entries, some have outdoor entries, all are somewhat shabby. Restaurant staff is friendly, but the food is average. Secluded location--had to take a cab whenever we went out for dinner

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Hilton Resort”
Reviews.Author: BordaInc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3/30/08 Check in- As I entered the Hilton at 4pm they rude associate checking me in notified us that our room was not ready. Upon hearing this I told him we were only here for one night and was there anyway to get us a room. No was his answer with no regard to the situation. He did inform us that he would call my cell as soon as ours was ready. 2 hrs later no phone call so we returned to the hotel. Our room was ready finally but no one bothered calling us. It was ashame that our check in was poor because the entrance to the Hilton is pretty decent. Room- The rooms we were at were open like a motel not a hotel. The room itself was very nice Pool- Small but decent. Parking- $22 and good luck getting a spot anywhere near your room Location- IMO horrible. It is on the bay which looks more like a dirty lake. I was under the impression that the resort was located on the beach. DONT be fooled!!! It is also to far from the main attractions (bay area, downtown, beachs) Overall- I would never stay here again. Well below avg for a Hilton resort. VERY Disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: need_sun_Denver
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and received a great rate. The grounds are nice and the rooms were clean. Parking is $22 per day but can be avoided if you are willing to park on the street and walk to your room. We had to ask three times to check into our room upon arrival and it was not ready until well past 4pm. The concierge was not all that helpful; the Bell Hops had better information. We wanted to go into downtown, the Gas Lamp Quarter, and did not want to drive. The Concierge suggested a cab at $25 each way. When we asked the Bell Hops they helped us to locate the best trolley station to use. We ended up taking the trolley and saved ourselves over $50. Finally, the drinks at the pool are way overpriced. Go to a local convenience store and get some beer or drinks (no glass) and bring it to the pool. It is also worth asking for complimentary continental breakfast coupons. They are worth $12 each and can be applied towards your total bill. It really helps to cut down the cost of a $17 two egg breakfasts

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Ddevelopment
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Easter Sunday, we were supposed to stay 2 nights but couldn't bear it, checked out early. The Bay is dirty, the hotel is wide open to the park and public. If you are on the first floor everyone including "homeless" walking by can look right into your room. The front desk was totally overwhelmed and showed it. Asked for turndown service, it never came. When calling the "Concierge" pushed the "Concierge button" on the phone and was connected to the operator who said there is no "Concierge"? The restaurant is closed and they are using a hokey old ballroom for food service. The pool is crowded, dirty and unkept. The rooms have been redone but smelled like mildew. Its gross and totally overpriced! Shop around!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive; poor location”
Reviews.Author: Hans&Serife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, paid over $300 for a tower room. very nice decorations, but very limited in other amenities. Tennis: nice, but costs $12 to use it Fitness center: nice, but costs $12 to use it Pool: nice, and free Restaurant: only one on site and there are no other possibilities for food or snacks unless you drive into town. For the price, this hotel has very limited accomodations. It is best used for isolated conferences. . . not vacationing family. For same price, could have gotten a nice room at a luxury hotel in downtown San Diego -- with free pool, tennis, and fitness center use.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, exterior still needs work”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: Once you get to your room, I think you will be very happy with this hotel. The rooms are rennovated and very nice. We were upgraded to one of the lanai rooms, which has about 25% more space than the tower rooms. This was great for us since we had our two year old daughter with us she was able ot have more room to run around. The rooms are nicely decorated as is the bathroom. Bathroom has a granite vanity and has a nice look. The only thing about this hotel is that your first time going to your room can be a little unsettling. On the way to your room, the hallways look like something straight out of a Super 8 hotel. This is not an original Hilton hotel and it shows in the way the halls look. Since they are rennovating the proporty I certainly hope they're planning on doing the common areas as well. But other than that I thought the hotel and the room were good. There is lots of construction going on during the day, so be prepared for this if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: samsen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and loved it. We definitely will return again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “No pool or concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole24
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel and the staff is great! I have been here several times but this time was a little disapointing. The pool is under construction and they had removed the concierge desk!! I always used to get great help from the girls at the concierge desk and recommendations on where to eat and go for fun. The front desk staff is great but do not have the same knowledge. I have never stayed at a 4 star resort before where they didn't have a concierge on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & nice decoration”
Reviews.Author: smsteffy
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I've been there about 4 times now and I've never been disappointed. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are clean, large and cozy. Finally a hotel that pays attention to the decoration! The service was always great, nice surrounding, just next to the golf course. The restaurant is also great, on the beach with outdoor fire pits, great food. I read a review saying that the Paradise Resort was much better... I HATE the Paradise Resort and I don't think that it should a 4 stars hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: reds04
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and was a bit scared- but I went in January and didn't care about beachfront bars/dining, construction and water in the shower. It was perfect for my stay - big, clean rooms w/fridge & coffee, place to run, fitness center, AMAZAING staff. I changed rooms immediately - nothing wrong w/it -my choice. Every request was filled quickly and a manager called immediately to confirm it was done. Location was 5-7 minutes from most places - if I didn't have a car, not sure I'd stay there, but otherwise fine. Yes, there is some construction, but it didn't affect my trip - for the really cheap price, it was perfect for me. $20/day to self park is a drag, but same as other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: bbqt123706
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in this hotel just before Christmas -- a little getaway from the extended family during the holidays. We were very impressed with the hotel grounds and incredible service, which was surprising after reading the reviews on this site. We arrived quite early into the hotel (11am), hoping to check in early and take advantage of the hotel grounds. Because the hotel was not too busy, we kindly asked if we could check in early and for an upgrade. We were surprised to received a lovely bayview room, even though we booked on Priceline. The staff who checked us in was wonderful, she even gave us two complimentary breakfast coupon because we had to wait 5 minutes for her to complete our check-in (which we didn't even mind in the first place because she was trying to upgrade our room). The hotel consists of one set of tall tower rooms and a series of two story cottage-like buildings. We stayed in one of the two cottage-like buildings overlooking the lovely mission bay. The exterior was a bit dingy and dark. The interior, though, has been remodeled recently and looked contemporary and fresh. Great bed, comfortable furniture and large bathroom. Our balcony with cushy furniture overlooked the bay. Very romantic at sunset and sunrise. My fiance and I took long walks on the quiet and private beach area. We had breakfast at hotel restaurant. The complimentary coupon was for 18 dollars each person, which more than covered our delicious meal (large portions, great food). The restaurant overlooked the bay area. I only wished the parking was less expensive (20 dollar a day). Unfortunately if you bring a car, you are pretty much stuck with paying for parking. The adjacent public parking lots do not allow for overnight parking. We saw many cars with warning tickets-- which the owners promptly went and paid for parking. Overall, we had a terrific time.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it Alot!”
Reviews.Author: vacationmama
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for one night this past weekend, while in town for a trade show at the Convention Center. I really think this hotel is top-notch. Beautifully landscaped, a great location right on Mission Bay, and newly renovated, modern looking rooms. There was a nice jogging/bike path right off the property and they rent jet skis and sailboats too. Unfortunately the renovation has taken a toll on the restaurant/bar area and the swimming pool. BUT, when it is completed (scheduled for April), it will be an awesome hotel. The rooms are nice with the most comfortable bed and pillows I've slept on (besides my own!). Our room was on the top floor of the tower, and we were upgraded to a view room. Our view was tremendous; if Sea World had the fireworks show during the winter, we would have had a clear view of it. We ate in the restaurant and the food and service was very good. However, it is in a ballroom right now, with not much atmosphere. There is no bar area; just a makeshift bunch of stools facing an old TV. The ONLY problem, as mentioned in previous reviews, is that the walls and floors are VERY thin. I would request a top floor and a corner unit if possible. Also, the lighting in the rooms is not very good. Just two lamps, which if you are there for romance, might be nice, but those traveling with friends or kids might want it a little brighter. They did have nice reading lights by each bed, which was a great feature. Anyway, if you can get a good deal on Priceline, it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline for $100/night. When we arrived, we noticed the beautiful grounds and Christmas decorations all around. The check in was quick and the empolyees very friendly. Our room was decent size, with a balcony overlooking the gym area. The bed was very comfortable, probably the best hotel bed we've ever had. A few posters mentioned the thin walls...yes, you can hear the people next to you, but that didn't bother us. We spent very little time in the hotel since we didn't come here to sit in the hotel but to enjoy beautiful San Diego. We were here only to sleep then left for the entire day. The pool area is undergoing construction, but we wouldn't have used the pool anyway in this weather. The area around the hotel is beautiful, with awesome jogging trails nearby. Bring your running shoes. They serve Starbucks coffee in the lobby, but not just coffee as you would normally see. They have almost all the drinks that a regular Starbucks would have. Our only complaint is that they charge for internet and parking. We had our own internet connection, so didn't need to use theirs, but they should offer free wireless. The gym also charges $12/day, but if you sign up for H Honors on their site, you'll get the gym access for free and it costs nothing to sign up. Overall, this is an awesome hotel with friendly staff and a great location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice resort! Loved the Beds!”
Reviews.Author: johnandbilldc
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Resort had the most comfortable beds ever! We really enjoyed the 4 nights of our stay here because we felt like we were on a resort. The decor of our room was top notch and the bathroom was pretty large. It looks like they've been renovating as the pool area was under construction. We were close to Sea World, however, anyone staying at this resort would definitely need to have a car to get around San Diego. It is not walking distance to anything. The good points: - We loved the beds! - Personal care items were nice (Crabtree & Evelyn) - Large Safe - Decor was classy - In-Room refrigerator - Flat screen TV - Resort grounds were nice - Resort gym and tennis courts were nice Things that could be improved: - Better lighting in the room - Heating in bathroom could be improved - In-room internet access should be free (why is there a charge?) - On-resort parking should be free (again, why is there a fee for parking for guests?) - No movie channels.. what?! Overall, we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bring The Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: bid1nt
Reviews.Content: The upgraded decor was very nice and the hotel has a beautiful Mission Bay location. However, the walls (and floors) between rooms were surprisingly thin. $20 for parking - ouch! Fun place if you like water sports, but not the peaceful romantic getaway I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel .. Some Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: First of all, they've rennovated this place. The rooms and overall property appearance are great. Love the furnishings, bed, bathrooms, business amenities, etc. Staff very friendly and helpful. I did have a room which had a broken AC unit so it ran loud all the time. I asked to be moved. That was handled nicely. Surprise - my NEW room had a strong cleaning solvent odor. D'oh! I guess that's the luck of the draw. I'd still recommend this place though. Nice location right by the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: achen_phx
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews, I was expecting the worst. We stayed in room 566 with a view of the resort tennis courts and Interstate 5. The room was quite large w/ new and modern furnishings. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The bathroom was nice - the majority of it was new (except for the shower). The hotel provides Crabtree & Evelyn amenities. One thing I didn't like was the dark hallways. One side is painted in a cream color while the other is a dark brown, which makes the entire hallway very dark. We only stayed for one night and didn't wander around the resort itself, so the rating is for the room itself. The location of the hotel was good. Highway access is very convenient and it is only a ten minute drive to downtown San Diego. Considering that I paid $100 for the room via Priceline, I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: HI808
Reviews.Content: Our family of recently stayed at this "resort" hilton hotel for the first time. Expecting it to be like other Hilton resorts, we planned to enjoy the pool and other featured amenities of this hotel. Therefore, we only went to Legoland on this trip, with the plan of coming back to enjoy the hotel with our 6 and 7 year old girls. The room was nice and clean when we arrived. However, on the second day, when we returned in the evening, we were surprised to find our room had not been cleaned and a message was left from housekeeping. They said we had a sign on our door, and if we wanted our room cleaned to call them. Well, it was 9:00 p.m. and we were checking out before 6 the next moring. So, we just called for fresh towels and for our trash to be emptied. The beds were still in disarray. Lastly, as we were checking out on Oct. 8, we called for assistance with our luggage to the front desk at 5:00 a.m.. At that time we were asked if we had our ticket number for our car validation, so that they could get the car. We waited for 20 minutes and no one showed up to assist with our luggage. So, my husband made two trips to bring our luggage to the front desk area, while I stayed in the room with our two girls. When we finally all got to the valet area, we were surprised again... no car!! It had been 30 minutes, with no one else checking out, they could not find our car!! I expressed my disappointment to the front desk, who were very apologetic. I would definitely not be staying there again. Our friends were planning to stay there next summer, I will convince them to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leavinlv
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews and was a little sacred when I booked this hotel on Priceline. I was pleasantly surprised when I found that most of the reviews were very off base. At check in I asked if they had a room with a view. They did for an upgrade fee of $40.00. I accepted and in return the front desk staff told me he would take care of the parking fee for me ($20.00) and give me a free continental breakfast ($14.00). I know people have complained about the parking fee but if you have ever stayed anywhere in California this is not uncommon and you just have to deal with it. One night, parking was scarce but if you like you can valet and all you have to do is tip the valet when you pick up the car. Your parking fee covers valet. Again, this is California, deal with it. When you visit other states or countries there are customary things you have to deal with. The hotel and grounds are very nice. We stayed in a tower room with a view. The walls are a little thin so if you are a light sleeper beware but I slept just fine. Some people had complained that the bay is dirty. It's a bay, not the ocean. It is not a huge bay either. If you get a room with a view it is pleasant. The people I dealt with were all very nice, always saying hello. If your not nice don't expect someone else to be nice just because they are at work. I wouldn't stay here for the price the hotel charges but that is just me. I paid just over $100 per night on Priceline and I think it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve to be called "Hilton" or "Resort"!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen712
Reviews.Content: This experience was far below what Hilton should tolerate for one of its properties. The setting is nice, but the facility itself is tired, worn down and sad. The room I stayed in--like the rooms of many of my colleagues at the same event--was in sorry shape: chipping paint, torn carpet, stained bed linens, a cupboard door on the wet bar falling off its hinges, the screen door coming off its track. And this was supposedly a recently renovated superior room, a bayfront villa. Also, upon checking in to my room, I discovered that the room had not been cleaned thoroughly. Both the bathroom counter and the wet bar counter were dirty and sticky; the toilet was unclean; and the room needed to be vacuumed. Housekeeping had to come in and give the room a thorough cleaning while I waited. The morning of my last day, I requested and was approved for a 1:00 checkout, but my room key did not work at 12:15, and I had to wait 15 minutes outside my room until security came to let me back in. This happened to all of my fellow travelers who had requested late checkouts, so apparently the locks reset at noon regardless of your actual checkout time. All in all, a very unpleasant experience. There are much better deals to be had in San diego.

Reviews.Title: “Resort is a little over selling--bad food!”
Reviews.Author: marqule
Reviews.Content: I attended a 4 day meeting at the hotel. I read the Trip Advisor reviews and was prepared for the worst. That probably helped, because it was better than I thought it would be. I didn't have problems with the staff...they were all helpful and polite. The technology didn't work so well, though. Meeting room wireless was spotty. The food is average...and when you consider "average" in the world of hotels, it's not great. I travel a great deal, so my standards may be high, but in southern California, I would expect a lot of great, fresh healthy food. Not so much! It's more like hotel food available in Indiana. No thank you! All in all, it wasn't as bad as I suspected, but except for the views, it's not a real resort where everything is over the top. The weather can't be beat, but you don't have to stay at the hotel to get that!!

Reviews.Title: “"Quality, not like it was when the Hilton actually owned it"”
Reviews.Author: schnookemsmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at the "Hilton Resort" for the past 4 years. Don 't be fooled by the name Hilton, as they do not own it anymore. They sold out to the Noble House 3 months ago. If you have ever stayed at there propert Paradis Point in San Diego, you know what a dive the Hilton Resort is resorting too. We had booked our stay in our usual room on the bay. A king room with lanai with a fire pit. Great location, however they recently renovated the rooms and removed the ceiling fans in all there rooms. With an energy crunch, who does this. We no longer could enjoy the cool breeze with our fan as we had done in the past. Instead we had to run the air conditioner. What a waste. When they renovated, they put in some funky type wicker furniture that is not comfortable. The patio furniture is just as uncomfortable. When you are paying 480+ a night you expect better. The stay started out with the staff just completely rude. The young man checking me in was quite unpleasant, wanted to know who had made my reservation for me as they had not done it correctly. Like this is my problem. He did not greet me with Welcome back, Mrs. Smith like they had done in the past. Then the bellman. What a joke. He piled everything up on the cart and knocked over our 200 dollar radio and the speaker cover broke off. He never replied with sorry, he just wanted to know if we had any more stuff. He was rude and obviously did not want to be there. Our second day was suppose to be a relaxing one by the pool. However, someones small child pooped in the pool. My 4 year old is not terrified of swimming in there pool in fear of seeing poop in it again. As it floated right past her. They solution to this was bus everyone to Paradise Point. This wasn't quite working for us. So we swam in the polluted bay along with most people. You would have thought they might offer to bring out some lawn chairs for us. No such luck. I believe the facility has fired all there long time employees who are union. As they were picketing at the hotel during memorial day weekend. I wouldn't waste your money at this place. If I were the owners of Hilton, I would definately take me name off the place. Also, there use to be such fun activities all the time for families, such as samores and volleyball on the beach. Not anymore. And don't spend your money on the Kids Club as the young lady who suppose to be watching the children in the pool, would leave them for minutes at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip, great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: lnmfulkerson
Reviews.Content: Fantastic family vacation! The hotel is just beautiful and the grounds so lush. We booked a room through Priceline and I was a little nervous having read some of the bad reviews here on Trip Advisor. I was pleasantly surprised to find that nothing written about this hotel was true. The staff were more than helpful. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out we were greeted with smiles and "how can we help you?" Even the grounds staff were friendly with a "good morning". On two occasions we asked for more coffee for our room and not only did it come within 5 minutes, the front office called our room a little while later to find out if we had been taken care of. True customer service! The pool is very large and there are plenty of chairs. I especially enjoyed the little kids pool since we had our 3 year old with us. The pool is 1 ft and is perfect for little swimmers. Didn't have to worry about the older kids splashing and horsing around too close to the little kids. The Banana Cabana offers a full bar and grill as well as snacks and drinks for kids. A little over priced but what resort isn't?? We ate dinner at the Bayside Grille and had one of the finest dinners we've ever had. True fine dining. Don't expect fast food when eating at a 4star restaurant. Good quality food takes time but is well worth the wait. Everything was cooked to perfection and beautifully presented. I highly recommend the mushroom crusted halibut! We didn't eat there for breakfast or lunch so I can't tell you if the service is faster at those times but I can only assume so since they never had a wait time. Expect prices to reflect the qualtiy of the food. If you want fast, cheap food try Dennys. I've often said that bad travelers write bad reviews. People who treat other people badly will in turn be treated badly themselves. A little kindness goes a long way and a simple thank you every once in a while tends to get better service than behaving like a horses rear-end. I have learned to take other's bad reviews with a grain of salt and fully believe that people who have nothing nice to say probably NEVER have anything nice to say. Enjoy this hotel, we did!

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of a view”
Reviews.Author: thekilanders
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for an end of summer getaway with our children (11, 8 &6) from for two nights. We had stayed with friends last year and went back to enjoy a relaxing stay by the bay. We splurged on our room to get a bayview lanai for $400 a night so that we could enjoy the beautiful view. I called the hotel to clarify the room and asked which room was a patio so that we could enjoy the grassy area outside the room. The reservations at the hotel told me that this room had a patio so we paid our $400 per night plus parking and set it up. We arrived early hoping to enjoy the pool while we waited for our room. The pool was closed for some contamination problem so we sat by the bay. Finally when check-in was official, we went to get our room. The $400 room was on the second floor not the first. When I explained about the first floor the management said too bad we are full. They offered to cancel my reservation at no penalty but that was it. So we headed off to our second floor room to check things out. On the balcony, our $400 view of the bay was obscured by a huge tree. The room had been renovated inside since last year and they did a nice job with the color schemes but the trendy furniture on the balcony was horribly uncomfortable. That night we went to the nice restaurant. We were greeted by the hostess and asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside. I asked for outside and the hostess quickly announced that there weren't any tables availabe. When I asked how long the wait was she rolled her eyes and strode off to check. She seemed aggravated by my request. That sentiment was standard among the staff at the hilton. They were all dismissive and curt...not what I expect for $400 a night. After all of that fuss, my kids got food poisoning at the restaurant that night so for the entire next day our balcony was lost to the dirty laundry. On our final day, room service for a pot of coffee took one hour and they double charged our room. I have never paid so much money for so little. Other than the location on the bay, the Hilton was a bust. At the price of their rooms I would have been better served staying at the Hotel Del or the Pacific Terrace...they are expensive but worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: traveler261
Reviews.Content: priceline misrepresented this place as a 4-star, but it should be a 2-star. very old facilities. my wife called room service for utensils or something; they said they're very busy and we should go get it ourselves. not recommended. parking is 20 bucks per day. this place is worth 40 per night, no more.

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice rooms, very rude staff and too many young children”
Reviews.Author: 1AroundtheWorld
Reviews.Content: Pros - recently renovated, rooms are pretty nice. Cons - staff seemed like a bunch of thugs. they seemed to be intentionally unhelpful. the manager seemed to promote this attitude. Also, status with hilton meant nothing to them. isolated hotel, far from any other restaurants, etc. this hotel is not for anyone but families with young children who want isolation.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on the name Hilton, and too bad for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: heisenhaure
Reviews.Content: After a long day of traveling from the east coast, we were hungry, thirsty and couldn't wait to sit down. They were over booked and had to move our room. poor. Everything closes at 11pm. On a resort with near 500 rooms there should be some sort of vending available anywhere. NADA. One soda machine and it was sold out the entire 4 days we had to stay there. Not even $6 bottles of water in your room! No mini bar, nothing. The best they could do was send us to an all night grocery store a half mile away. They have an area they call an adult retreat, with a hot tub and water fountain, which is nice, except there was never a clean towel available. The hotel rooms are designed like a fancy motel 6. rooms have patios or balconies, but they are open in the entrance way to the outdoors. those floors are disgusting. there was dirty q-tips and a broken glass in the hall way I had to walk through for 3 days. the parking is disastrous. you can use valet for no extra of the $21 a day they charge, but they rarely answer the phone when you call for your car to be ready, and if your coming, they're on their cell phones while taking your car. I have never been more dissapointed with any hotel or for this case, the motel class stay. If I was Hilton, I'd sell this piece of crap property as soon as possible or do some serious management changes. They have beach front on mission bay across from the park. If you want a beach chair, there are 2, yes only 2 and they are first come first serve. if you wanted you could rent them from the beach hut for $5 for the day, except they were stolen and havent been replaced??? (that's what insurance is for...) Any time we complained, we got the shoulders up, head cocked, shrug. Wish they had room at the holiday express. Oh, but they do have a very friendly Starbucks cart in the morning. Yay, Starbucks! BOO Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, More of a 2 and 1/2 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: esner
Reviews.Content: First of all, is started with the location. Driving up to the hotel, I noticed the small bay. It looked like a sewage pool... Pictures made is seem like it was this huge enormous ocean but it wasn't. The hotel is between the sewage bay and the freeway! I requested an early check-in at 1 p.m. We arrived there at 2:30. The room was still not yet ready. I asked the attendant and he said it would be ready by 3. The time was now 5 p.m. and the room was still not ready. This was disspointing! We stayed at the Villas along the side of the bay. The rooms were average size but the bathroom was extremely small. There is absolutely no room to get ready in there. The shower head was full of mold and the floor was slimy. FYI: if you are stupid enough to stay at this hotel in the future, make sure you wear slippers when you shower. When you walk in the room, you get this "feel" of dirtiness. The website says that all rooms are newly renovated. What did they do? Just change the cover sheets on the bed! The breakfast was not as great. There were eggshells in the omlette... My advice to you is not to book this hotel... It's not even worth $50 a night. Go somewhere else than this sewage hotel. Best of Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_consultant
Reviews.Content: I always prefer to stay at Hilton family of hotels being a platinum hhonors member and I was not dissapointed. Room was compact but furnished very contemporarily. The balcony with the bay view in the tower was awesome too esp during sunsets. Service was ok but I have stayed at better hilton properties in orlando. I had requested for a cab one evening..waited 30 min and no show. I recommend this for families with kids. They have a huge pool and also play movies on a big screen by the pool after dark. $20 a day parking is ridiculous and includes valet parking. The fitness center is very outdated and crampy. The breakfast buffet is good but very pricey $20/person.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best of times, it was the worst....”
Reviews.Author: tinabinab
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on the same day of my arrival through Priceline. $80 was definitely a bargain and overall my experience was positive. Checkin: I arrived at about 10:30 in the evening on a Sunday night. I was initially very impressed. There was a live band playing in the background, and it definitely added to the resort feel. Checkin was quick and easy. (Be forewarned if you use Debit to backup your account, they will put a hold on your account for $100 for EACH day of your stay!) The Room: Our room was 377. The hallway had that funky smell that has been mentioned in other reviews. Smelled like fresh paint to me. It was noticable but not too bothersome; I could not smell it in the actual room. My first impression of the room was "WOW". It was very contemporary - not my style, but very nice nonetheless. Also liked the balcony area. Beds were very comfy. The NOISE: This is where the WORST part comes in. I have never stayed in a hotel where the noise was almost unbearable. Light sleepers beware! The noise tended to peak at the 11:30 pm timeframe - about when the Sea World folks were returning and then start up again around 7 or 8 am. You can easily hear footsteps, voices, doors, and of course the unique toilet flushing sound. Sometimes it sounded as if it was several floors above. It was quite obnoxious! I'd managed to wear my 3 yr old out every day of our stay, so luckily SHE slept through it all. Restaurant: We ate breakfast at the terrace restaurant every morning. It was consistently good. I ordered from the menu two days and did the buffet one. Both were good. The buffet had a little of everything and then some. $22-24 for one adult and a child (includes tip) wasn't great, but it was convenient and tasty. The service was excellent. General appearance: The grounds in general were very nice and well groomed. You could see people working each day on maintaining this. The pool area was lovely and had quite a lot of shade in the mornings. It looked like a nice place to just sit and relax even if you weren't enjoying the pool. Parking: As mentioned before, the $20 parking fee is outrageous. We did self park each day as I did not want the hassle of waiting for a valet. We never had a problem parking close to the tower. Overall we had a good visit. The location was very convenient to Sea World and at $80 on Priceline, it was definitely a bargain. I would probably prefer to try something else next time, but wouldn't be terribly upset if I got this hotel again. Just wish they could fix that noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not great serice”
Reviews.Author: stacStac
Reviews.Content: Although it is a beautiful hotel on a nice property, the service was somewhat bad. When asked where to go dine, the conceige flopped 2 huge books in front of me with a grumble and nothing more. Unlike other hiltons we have stayed in, this one makes you pay for everything, and pay alot. A cheeseburger for lunch was over 12$. Breakfast was 22$. Also on the last day we stayed there, they skipped us on cleaning up the room. After tiding up the room ourselves we called for some towels and coffee. We received some towels with no other ameties, as if they were bothered that we picked up on their mistake. For the $$ that you pay the service was not up to par. We are Hilton Honors members and usually receive great treatment. Not so at this one. Prepare to Pay!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful IN-town Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a last minute one night "honeymoon". We wanted to stay in the MissionBay area and so I used Priceline for the first time and won the Hilton MissionBay Resort for $80+tax and $20parking. I felt like I had won a bet at roulette!!! We were checked into our room by 1PM even though the hotel had been filled to capacity the night before. Noone mentioned Priceline and just asked what kind of bed we wanted.The entire resort is non-smoking so any room would have been fine. I told them we didn't care but would appreciate the best room they could offer us. Well we ended up with a bayview room in the highrise building and we were ecstatic! The decor was modern,with fridge,coffeemaker etc. The tv was small but had all the setups for games,computers etc.The bathroom was a little small but oh what a shower!! Myhusband had fun playing with the settings that changed the speed and massage-like quality. The grounds are just gorgeous and since the hotel is inside MissionBayPark we were able to take our 3mile walk and then retire to our room. There was a band playing at the pool and we enjoyed the music and atmosphere. I usually tell people that they will have to drive if they dont want to eat at the hotel restaurant, but oh my goodness,the restaurant was just fabulous!! We had drinks outside overlooking the bay and then went inside for our meal. We shared a salad and when it was brought,thought the waitress had ordered 2 salads instead of just 1. The plates were full and lovely. My main dish was halibut encrusted with mushrooms with a truffle essence. Oh my!I am still tasting it now! my husband had a chicken with all kinds of good things stuffed into it in a wine reduction sauce.We just looked at each other and he said he finally understood how food could be a turn-on. Dessert was a yummy chocolate concoction. When it got dark we watched the fireworks from Seaworld and thought how lucky we are to live in this wonderful city!! Drawbacks:I dont think I would have been happy with a first floor room facing the parking lot so a lot depends on WHICH room you get. The jacuzzi was very crowded with children and so we couldn't use it after dinner. i'd go here again in a less crowded(non school holiday)month. We certainly felt that we got wonderful value for our money and would definitely do this again. We will also bring guests to the restaurant even when not staying here since they validate parking and it has a pretty view and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: J2meLumi
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through priceline. I named my own price at $129 for the night. I was coming down to stay for one night after seeing John Mayer in concert at Coors. I booked a king size bed, when I checked in I received 2 doubles. My room was also on the ground floor. Not a big deal since I can see out the grounds to bay from my room. The room was recently updated with more modern bedding and bathroom fixtures. The bed was comfortable, no complaints there. There were crabtree and evelyn soaps and etc. The room showed some dirt in the grout, but overall it was clean and comfortable. The TV was older, but fine. The walls are extremely thin. I could hear my neighbors TV go on and I could also hear her talking on her cell phone clearly. I didn't like that I had to pay $20 for parking like other visitiors complained about. I had in-room breakfast. $17 for egg whites, bacon, toast, coffee, juice and potatoes. It was pretty good. Crisp bacon, warm eggs. Toast was cold though. I didn't have a chance to tour the grounds, but from what I can tell, it looked nice. Overall not a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “This place was just fine!!”
Reviews.Author: timbo2003
Reviews.Content: This place was just fine. The grounds are clean, and it's a typical hilton experience. Many of the ground floor rooms have firepits which is nice. It's on the bay and has a nice boat dock, along with all sorts of rentals. The in room coffee is pretty decent. "TC" at the front desk was very attentive and helpful. I stayed for two nights with my wife, and would recommend, so I'm not sure what other people were unhappy about.

Reviews.Title: “What's with all the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: Drewtoo88
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews on this board I was really scared to see what the place was like when my girlfriend and I showed up Memorial Day weekend. The funny thing was, I don't know if it was my diminished expectations from the reviews, or the fact that I think people like to complain too much and we don’t, but we thought the Hilton was great. The remolding was done from what we could see and our room, which was in the tower on the 7th floor, was very nice indeed. There were new amentias all around with a very comfortable bed and a tasteful modern decor. There were plenty of towels and the place had no oder as some have reported on this site. The staff was incredibly friendly as was the concierge, who recommenced some very nice places to eat. One was in Old Town called the Coyote Cafe that served some awesome Mexican food and the other was the Crab Catcher in La Jolla, which was expensive, but hey, It's La Jolla. The pool was very nice as was the view from our room, which allowed us to see the fire works display every night that Sea World put on. There were a lot of kids, but because I think the Hilton is some what price prohibitive, there were no riff raff or uncontrolled kids around the place. Too, the pool will keep the kids busy for a least half of the day. And if you're not bringing kids, the place was great for couples too. Again, I’m not sure what people expect in this world sometimes, but I have traveled many places and I can tell you, for a nice get away that is located very conveniently to all the attractions in the San Diego area, the Hilton was very much worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Saureus
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Paid $80 on Priceline. I had one of rooms in the villa (not the tower), and it was great. It must have been recently renovated with contempary designs. The beds were amazing and the bathroom was nice. There was even a little patio with two lounge chairs outside the room. $20 for parking really sucks, but you really need a car if you stay here. It is in a somewhat secluded spot on mission bay, which I actually liked. You forget that downtown was just a few min away. You are on the water and there is a lot of green space around you. On the other hand you there is nothing really close like restaurants to walk to. But if you have a car, then everything is pretty close like the airport, downtown, beach, zoo, seaworld, old town. The pool and hot tub were nice too, although there were a lot of kids there. The pool does go deep pretty fast, so there isn't too much of a shallow end. Check out was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Price -- As Long as You Don't Need to Park”
Reviews.Author: lesrion99
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I booked this hotel on priceline. We got one of the newly renovated rooms, which was really nice, but the building next to us and our own patio were still under construction. The big bummer though was the extra charges for everything, namely parking. There is a sign outside saying valet is $20/day, so we self parked. Little did we know that self parking is also $20/day even though the hotel is not in the downtown area so I'm not sure why they have to charge so much. We found a bill under our door at the end of our stay and at the front desk they told me I had agreed to it in some fine print when I signed the check in slip. The setting, however, is on a nice spot on Mission Bay.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but a bit disappointing for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: shortysnh
Reviews.Content: The grounds are lovely, it is convenient to the freeway, the staff is nice, and the room is large and clean. Also, those typical comfy Hilton beds are there... The property is undergoing renovation, and I believe my room (Tower) was recently done. The only complaint regarding its condition is that the closet smelled of mold so badly that I had to put the ironing board on the balcony to air out, so I could iron my clothes without absorbing that odor. I also could not hang my clothes in the closet for the same reason. I was glad to just be passing through town on business. Had I paid for this place as a vacation I would not be happy. As a Hilton Gold member, I received no complimenty amenities such as free breakfast, or free internet. The fitness center was closed due to renovations, with no comp at a local gym. The bay was lovely to look at from a distance, but too gross to wade into. And $20/day to park? I will be back soon for another biz trip, and probably will look for another Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: 2bigfly1littlefly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from April 3 to 14 which was over spring break and Easter. I will start with the positive because there isn’t much. The location was great, it is very convenient to any attractions and has easy access to the freeway. Being in the middle of Mission Park was very nice with jogging paths and playgrounds on both sides of the hotel. The pools aren’t bad, if a bit cold and not as well attended as they should be (running out of towels all the time or not having any at all at the other hot tub area). The staff, other than the front desk are very friendly and helpful. We asked for a very quiet room because our son is 1 ½ and goes to sleep around 7:00pm, we were placed in room 138 and were not very impressed. It had supposedly been completely renovated but the bathtub & tiles in the shower were very old, the shower was very weak, the mattresses were extremely uncomfortable and dirty, the sheets had rips in them and on the last day the towels that were left in the room had blood stains (rather horrifying!). This room was definitely not quiet, if anything it sounded like a head of elephants going through our room all night long with the outside door slamming and the noise from upstairs. The side to side sound proofing is good but the floor above and the doors are a joke, there is absolutely no sound proofing at all. We placed a towel at the bottom of the door to try to muffle the sound a bit. I don’t know if they forgot to put a seal at the bottom of the door or if there never was one, but it sure would go a long way to improving the sound problem. We had asked to be moved but they could only move us to another room that would be just as bad so in the end we didn’t bother. We tried to take it in stride since it was a busy time of year but when your baby is being woken up 6 or more times a night from doors slamming, it is a bit too much to excuse. All in all, we had a great time in the city but would avoid staying in a Hilton again because of this experience

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury but the price was right”
Reviews.Author: sunnsoul
Reviews.Content: Family of four booked a one-night stay in a room on Priceline for cheap ($100). Perks: comfy beds, pleasant staff, family friendly park within walking distance, shower/tub nice, clean rooms. Downers: $20/day parking fee, no dining table/seating, not a good location if you don't have a car (no shops or restaurants for miles). In my opinion, not a four star as rated but a solid three. Glad I didn't have to pay regular price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: bourets
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located on the ocean front. The staff is very friendly and professional. The rooms have a lot of space and are very confortable. It is worth to take a breakfast on the patio: terrific view, great food! I definitly recommend it even though it is relatively far from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant, if pricey stay”
Reviews.Author: Pokymike
Reviews.Content: I stayed in late Feb. for a business meeting so the tab was covered by someone. Arrived by taxi from the airport (approx. $20, inc. tip) . I had a spacious 2nd floor room in one of the 2-story villas facing the bay. It was clean, well-appointed, and the bed was very comfortable. The grounds are nice, and adjacent to city parks. The exercise area is a bit cramped, but they have a nice selection of equipment. The nearest bus stop is at least a 20-30 minute walk, and Pacific Beach, a neighborhood with many shops and restaurants is at least 45 minutes north on foot. Old Town is about a $12 cab ride. Meeting facilities were adequate for our small group, and the staff were very responsive to any of our needs. Food service was average. Internet access was an additional 11.95 per day; I was unable to get wireless access. Transportation back to airport was not as arranged, so I nearly missed my 615A flight. Overall, a pleasant stay though having a car or even a bicycle would have made it much more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaycimay
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was very skeptical but this place was beautiful! We stayed in a garden bay room, I called ahead to request a newly renovated room. Reserved the room on Priceline for $110.00 per night. The room was very big, everything was brand new,( it looked like the T.V. had never been used, the cord wasn't plugged in).We had a great view of the bay and a big balcony. Everyone that worked there was super nice and helpful. The guy at the front asked what we were doing for the day and told us it may rain and gave us umbrellas to use! The $20 parking is crazy, but the location is so convenient for everything. We didn't eat at the resort, (Jack in the Box is my favorite place to eat and they don't have them in OKC). The conceiege recommened a great Italian Restaurant in the Gaslamp District and it was the best Italian I've ever had, ASTI is the name. We went to the Zoo, AWESOME, Solano Beach, AWESOME, Tijuana, AWESOME, Mueseum of Natural History, not so great......

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful place!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTravelLondon
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel started badly when our room was not ready until 5pm (despite assurances that we would be able to have early check-in). The reception staff were unhelpful and had no understanding of client service. The whole place felt dirty and our room had the most revolting smell (we had to light a scented candle to help combat it). The tennis courts are very good - but it took almost 2 hours of begging to get the "tennis pro" to find us some racquets in his store room. Also the courts are right next to the noisy freeway making conversation between players virtually impossible. We felt somewhat misled by the hotel website which shows a panorama of the hotel seemingly on the oceanfront - in reality the "ocean" is a dirty brown inlet. One of the worst features of the hotel was the heavily gated pool area - you literally felt like you were being checked into a prison cell every time you entered the area (although I am sure that prisons do no insist on blasting their inmates with 24-hour Lionel Ritchie songs). All in all a dreadful place and not to be recommended at any price, let alone the extortionate price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Hans50
Reviews.Content: With all the choices avaiable in San Diego, you can do better than this particular Hilton resort. In its favor, it is close to the interstate, easy to get to, is in a generally quiet area, close to running paths, and the public areas of the resort are attractive. However, and it is a big however, this is not what I would consider a quality Hilton property. The room we stayed in (509) was dreary. A very large water spot spread across the ceiling. The ceramic tub finish was peeling off. The daily parking fee of twenty dollars is excessive. The restaurant fee schedule is weird. One day our breakfast of granola and yogurt was less than ten dollars; the next day they charged us for the yogurt. The day before we were told that the yogurt was included. You should also know that the resort is not on the ocean. It faces a backwater lagoon that eventually opens onto the ocean, but the property itself is at least a mile from the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: guerillatraveler75
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this hotel was certainly set in a nice part of SD between La Jolla and downtown and close to the highway. It boasts some decent amenities and a nice pool area. Nothing fabulous that would warrant a 4-star rating other than a small "resort" wing, though. After having stayed at many a 4-star hotel on business in many countries, I must say I was more than appalled at the nickel-and-diming of customers. Parking is $20/day, which is never mentioned on any online site. The worst part is, there are no other parking areas around the hotel, so it is more of a hostage arrangement than an option. They charge you to use the basic gym, internet service, and a few other services that your average 3 star hotel would give you for free. Add a bathroom full of deceptively placed "hotel brand" moisturizers and doodads- all for fee of course-and you get the distinct feeling that you're getting a shakedown that is simply irritating to no end. You start getting paranoid about using the hotel soap and towels lest a fee for that. For a resort, they simply have not understood the concept of including basics into the price and reducing the hassle factor for guests. Raise the price if you must, but for gods sake dont charge for using your own hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I can't believe all the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJeny
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I came to San Diego for New Year's and bid on priceline for a 4-star hotel. We were quite excited to see we were staying at a Hilton Resort for only $90. But then we had to pay $20 per day for parking so our cost was actually more. They say it includes valet parking, but the valet guy was so swamped, it was faster and easier to just park ourselves. The resort looks very nice but we were in the "tower", which is not as nice as all the little villas around the place. I would definitely classify it as a low 3 star. Watch out because they charge you for EVERYTHING, if you have a guest visit, they must pay $20 for parking, internet charges are $12 per day, if you ask for extra bedding it's $30, if you want to work out in the gym it's $12. Personally, I would try another option next time.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: lauraplanet
Reviews.Content: we decided to get away from the family at christmas - flew down to san diego, rented a car, and then drove back to sacramento. we stayed at the hilton christmas eve and christmas night. a friend gave us a gift certificate for two free nights. but even though nothing beats free, we both really enjoyed this hotel. the service was fast and friendly. the pool was clean and a pleasant temperature for december. the spas were great, two spas at two different temperatures. the restaurant starters were yummy, the calamari is good but different, the clams were awesome. room size is very large, and the bed was comfy. what more could you want? overall a good stay...

Reviews.Title: “Martha!!! Room Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunynCali
Reviews.Content: I just had bad experience at a previous hotel and checked in with apprehension. The previous hotel was a Hilton as well. My friend Martha from room service was so stellar and kind. She recommended a wonderful dinner and even better she followed up and called to ask me if I enjoyed her recommendation. What an incredible extra effort!! Very impressive!! I know this is not required or the standard of any hotel I stay at, including 5 star hotels!! Of course, I now think Martha is 5 star!! Since I travel so much, I notice genuine customer service. I am not in any way wishing to demean the value of Martha's position. I do head hunting for a living, so I can tell you, from experience, she is such a valueable asset to this company !! Martha needs to be recognized and promoted! She is such a pleasure to speak to and very wonderful!! I even had to comment on how well she articulated the menu with correct pronunciation. I sure hope she stays with your company and one day greets me as the General Manager!! If not, Martha call me, I will help achieve your aspirations!! :) Sandy Jordan, California Traveler!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Poor Poor”
Reviews.Author: nlaw68
Reviews.Content: Came to CA for a special occasion and had a lot of problems with this resort. First off let me stay I am an avid Hilton user because for the most part the service is usually great and the accommodations are usually great. This resort was nice but the service was awful! We got to the hotel at 5pm and there was a problem... I think they gave our room away. We did not get a room until 7pm that night. They tried to give us a room with 2 queen beds but it was our Anniversary and we really wanted a king with an outside lanai. And believe me we paid "BIG" money to have it. They said they had to "finish" cleaning our room. Their answer was to give us a $50.00 gift certificate for a hotel meal. When we did get the room the smell was soooooo bad and the carpet was wet..... They told us they had cleaned the carpet 2 weeks ago. It was so bad we had to move to another room. Our walk out lanai was not a walk out at all. We could go out but if you sat in the chair you could only see the ski and brick. The room itself was very large the bed was ok but not as comfy as I expected. The refrigerator smelled so bad (obviously the last guest left fish in there) everything that came out of it smelled like rotten fish. Needless to say we didn't bring any food back to our hotel. Readers are right $20.00 per day for parking is awful! What is this hotel thinking! The food is very expensive at the hotel you are definitely better off going to the many great restaurants in San Diego. They sure have learned how to nickel and dime you to death. I would definitely not stay here again. I have never been so disappointed in a Hilton before.

Reviews.Title: “Definately worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: cntrustno1
Reviews.Content: At first, I was a bit nervous purchasing a 2 nights stay on Priceline without knowing where we were going to stay. Then I figured, what can go wrong if I choose a 4 star hotel, in a specific area and for the price we want. We were very pleased with the selection of the Hilton San Diego Resort on Mission Bay. Upon arrival, we were given a Villa type room to stay in AND we were lucky enough to get an early check in! The Hilton was in a great location and we didn't have any trouble traveling around. The employees were helpful and the housekeeping staff was great. Saving the best for last, we will DEFINATELY recommend the Dungeness Crab Cake Benedict for breakfast at the onsite Bayside Terrace Grille! I would have to say that my boyfriend and I's first trip together was more than words can say.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential but a rip off”
Reviews.Author: exit17
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Southern California and I used my Hilton Honors points for 3 days in San Diego. Stayed the first night at the Embassy Suites downtown so we could see the Padres Game. That Hotel was nice and well runned. When we checked into the Hilton Resort we were very excited. nice location and the grounds are like resorts you would see in Mexico or Hawaii. Then we went to the front desk and there was a family complaining to the manager about the service. We were given our room and I requested a little nicer location and they gladly gave it to us. The rooms are small. Coming from the Embassy you really noticed it but they were nice and clean. My wife and I like to sit on the deck and it looked that it hadn't been swept in days. The hotel is geared towards corporate retreats and sales meetings. Because of that they stick you for everything. $3.50 for a soda at the vending machine! Food prices are expensive but they have have a wonderful outdoor resturant for breakfast. The pool was great and the water sports were plentiful and not overly expensive. What really got me was when we were checking out I was packing the bags in the car and 2 feet of raw sewage started to shoot out of a drain in the parking lot. By the way it is $16 a day to park. I told the maid about the sewage issue and nothing really happened. Seeing that this could really get someone sick as I view some kids splashing in the water I called the manager and they sent someone out to fix it. It was nice but disappointing. Definately not a 4star resort and they really try to stick it to you by nickel and diming you for everything. I would only go back on using points and I probably would stay at the Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: JourneyMaven
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Resort feels large and spacious, mostly because its buildings are spread over several acres and are no more than two stories in height. Well maintained landscaping connects the buildings and at its core is a main lobby with restaurant and pool. Parking is limited to one side of the hotel, and all the rooms seem to face towards the beach or landscaping on other side, so once you leave your car, you feel like you're really in a resort. Our room was not a suite and yet spacious with its private balcony and cathedral ceiling. The hotel is right on the beach of Mission Bay, so it's an easy walk from even the furthest room. On either side of the hotel are public parks, so you can walk on paved sidewalks for about a quarter mile in each direction, take the kids to a nearby playground, or enjoy a picnic on the grass. Some downsides are that the hotel is close to the interstate highway, so the sound of the traffic is omnipresent if you're outdoors. The beach, unfortunately, is on an inner bay, so no waves--just still water like being on a quiet lake. Great for kids, though, who won't be struggling with waves or an undertow at the ocean. During our stay, however, the water was contaminated and you weren't able to go in for a swim or ride a boat. The biggest disappointment was a $20 charge to park the car--not for valet, but for self-parking in an open parking lot--a ridiculous price considering the high cost of the hotel and a poor welcome to a resort. Hilton should reconsider this. The Hilton San Diego Resort advertises itself as a resort, but it's definitely a mixed bag. Any problems associated with its location on the water or by the freeway can't be easily be overcome by the hotel, but it should certainly warn its guests, especially if they can't take advantage of all its amenities or expect a romantic secluded spot on the ocean. If you're paying this much for a resort hotel, you don't want to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive but nice”
Reviews.Author: lexi731
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very beautiful, but at a price. We paid $280 per night and we used one night of our hilton honors points. When we got there, they said they had a garden room for us, but I said I wanted a room in the tower at the highest floor possible. Ryan got us a room on the top eighth floor with a view of the bay. But everything costs money! Breakfast is a joke with $10 waffles, so we ate at the nearby jack in the box. The highspeed internet in the rooms costs $12 a day (though I was able to tap into their wireless connection for free) and parking is $20 a day! And there were plenty of places to park - don't know why they have to charge for that. They have a basket of munchies set out, but if you eat anything, I'd run to the grocery store to replenish the stock. A tiny Toblerone candy bar was $3.50! And the bottle of Evian water (20 oz) was $5!! They do have Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, which I asked for extras of. The pillows are down, so you have to call for non-allergenic ones if you are allergic to feathers. But after an hour, a guy brought me up 4. Then they called to make sure I got them. They do have snacks and drinks in the gift shop that cost about the same as you would get in a movie theatre. The pool area is really nice and clean. The pool is 12 ft deep and must be heated a little because it was much more pleasant than the frigid ocean. They provide the pool towels, so you don't need to bring your own. From our balcony, we could see the Sea World fireworks each night up close. We didn't go in the bay, but they have jet skis, wind surfer thingies and a nice wide sidewalk to rollerblade on. The rooms were very comfortable and the beds were awesome. The tv was a flat screen, but once again, anything beyond basic cable will cost you. We have two teenagers and they seemed to really enjoy it. I saw kids playing in a kiddie area where they have arts and crafts. They seemed to be having fun. I would stay here again as long as I had a discount of some sort. I would not stay here for full price. You do get a tiny fridge in the room to put drinks in, and there's not any place close to eat, so you need to bring snacks. If you have a car like we did, it's not too bad to find food, but otherwise you are at the mercy of the Hilton and their outrageous price gouging!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has Changed after years of Return Business”
Reviews.Author: boitano
Reviews.Content: We just visited the Hilton Resort after returning for 6 yrs. Our dissappointment was that there was a sudden change in management service standards and the clientele. First let me say the grounds are impeccable, and so was every service giver maids; pool personnel etc. On this trip we were there for R&R. We visited the pool and it was monopolized by San Diego families that had found a way to use the hotels facilities by getting thru a door by the 400 building. After reporting the issue of the overcrowded pool and security issues, nothing was done. Also, there was an incident with our reservations on hilton.com for which they attempted to charge us a second time, and when we explained we left our confirmation at home they said it was our problem to prove otherwise. I spent an entire day of my vacation trying to straighten it out, away from the pool again! No credits or courtesys were given to my family. I was not suprised, in that it seems with the security issues and billing, and confirmation issues the management has changed their attitude towards guest. The clientelle now is very grunge oriented and younger, and the managements attitude in extending services reflects more to the new clientelle. There were a group of 12 in a single room we noticed, it seems that things have really changed. We are considering never returnning after 6 years of a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Not all money is green ...Long”
Reviews.Author: gjw89
Reviews.Content: We were given a very last minute 3 day pass good Fri 21 July thru Sun 23 . So we decided to head to San Diego as it was within fair driving distance. Determined to go and have fun we settled on the Hilton Resort. This was based on their proximity to Sea World which we had free passes to. And 2. Kid friendly amenities. I called Hilton directly to see what their prices were compared to the lowest online which was Expedia. The reservationist quoted a lowest available rate $20 higher than Expedia and did not include breakfast or the garden lanai. So I booked with Expedia. We paid quite a bit for the room ,but hey it was the day before a very busy summer weekend. and we wanted an easy and as stress free a getaway as possible. First impression for the resort was WOW. Post card perfect. Check in went smoothly . They did forget my breakfast vouchers but they did make good on it. And complained about Expedia while they did so. As she hands me the vouchers I said I am short a set. She said no, the free breakfast was only good for 2 adults. Expedia did NOT make that clear. The room view was an immediate wow. Wall to wall sliding glass window . That led to our private lanai overlooking the bay. I can see why some say to get this view it was spectacular. And as we walked the resort throughout our weekend we could also see why some people say "stay away" as some rooms/patios were in very conspicious spaces. The room came with everything we could need, fridge, mini pantry, granite counter & sink, coffee pot, and a well stocked bathroom. We had just passed housekeeping outside and requested they take away the "treats' before my kids accidentally got into it.. $5.00 bottles of water and $2.75 packs of M&M's were not in my budget. As we went through the room setting up and getting things put away we noticed the celing fan over the dining area was not working. As we were feeling quite muggy & hot we called housekeeping and asked for it to be looked at. We figured it just needed a battery. That was at 1 pm. We went to lunch on premises since we were a bit tired and didn't want to get back in traffic. There were 3 parties of 2 couples, and yet it took 25 minutes to get our lunch served to us. And after 2 messages gave up on getting a Coke with my lunch. Our server came up to us a the end and volunteered the fact that he had gone on break and forgotten to get the drinks to us. YIKES. We go tour room and maintenance is STILL there fixing the fan. We were feeling generous as were happy to be away. So we decided to go shopping. We came back . He was STILL there. at 6:15 pm mainteneance FINALLY finished fising the fan. Of course, meanwhile I am trying to track down a manager and finally camped out in the lobby until one arrived. He apologized and said it would get fixed as quickly as possible and would I like to go to the bar and get a drink? Yeah right! I point blank asked how I was to be compensated. He said due to to whom I had booked the stay through there is nothing Hilton could do! What?!! This made my blood boil. I paid $389 per night up front and that was somehow deemed beneath the Hilton standards?! So of course, I got loud and made a fuss. In The Lobby. Got 2 $50 dinner vouchers to include the mandatory 18% tip, and tax and to be made good for room service. And got 4 free vouchers to Americna breakfasts. Same details~ roughly another $100. (beware there is a diff in price between free continental that expedia offers and american breakfast) and we got our parking costs comped as well. And a few more inciental freebies. After that "little" incident we were treated quite well. We did not make use of any of the preplanned children activities. But they were plentiful. We did make use of the regular pool extensively, as well as their "Sandy Beach" for the kiddos. We didn't get in the bay water there but the kiddos were happy to be in the sand and we laid out on 1 of 4 covered deck chairs. The villa we were in was only 2 floors. And had it's own hot tub. This is besides the 2 hot tubs that are at the pool areas. The villa was surrounded by lush foliage and truly made us feel we were away from the daily grind. Housekeeping was completed each morning by 11am as we requested. Concierge was fantastic as was every dept we dealt with, after the "incident' of course. We did notice the room was damp ~ not musty. That could have been due to us having come from the extreme weather climate of South Arizona. And the ince machine on our floor was not in working order. Iniitial treatment left us sour. Will we book here again? Honestly I don't know. I like that they took the effort to make up their initial blunder to us. But I don't like that were put in that spot to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LOML
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautiful location, too bad that is the nicest part of it. Initially we were sent to a room that was so musty and old smelling I thought I might be in a nursing home. Our "garden view" was a view of the putting green. Needless to say we changed rooms and were given an adequate room in the tower. The rooms are blah, nothing exciting about them.Decent but not exquisite. THERE ARE NO IN ROOM COFFEE MAKERS-very irritating. I will admit that the beds were quite comfortable with nice down comforters and clean sheets. The hotel is located relatively close to other area attractions but a car is needed as taxis are a fortune. BE WARNED - you pay extra to park- $20 a night. The dining selection is limited both in room and at the restaurant. The pool is large but space is limited and shade is a commodity. The pool side menu is sparse but the drinks are nice. The spa and workout room are a joke. There are water sports available right at the bay in back of the hotel. All things considered it wasn't tragic but it was DEFINITELY NOT WHAT I WOULD CONSIDER "A RESORT". The cost was outrageous for what was offered. I would say it was one step up from a budget hotel. I definitely would not stay there again given the multitude of options in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a lifesaver the Hilton is! We were booked at La Jolla Cove Suites we were horrified at their conditions! We didn't think during a busy holiday the Hilton would have any rooms for our remaining 6 day stay, but we called and they were more than accomodating to get us adjoining rooms. The beds are "comfty cozy" according to my little ones and our feet didn't get black from walking on their carpet like they did in LJCS. There is ample room in the bathrooms and the staff was very nice. We stayed here last year also and was just as satisfied with our stay. Sure you pay for all the services, but that what vacation is! The pool is wonderful and the kiddie pool is a lifesaver. Cleanliness is key for me and I was very comfortable. We have stayed in the tower and in the garden view 2 story buldings. Both were just fine. Because we stayed at the Hilton, our vacation was awesome. I recommend it highly. The bay is somewhat dirty, but it is a BAY. If you want the beach, go up 5 minutes to Mission Beach. The food is expensive here but they are everywhere. That's what you have to expect on vacation unless you go get subs and some groceries and stuff them in your mini fridge which is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “This is really a mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: KK-Ltraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-night stay at the Hilton on Mission Bay. What a mixed bag that place is! We've stayed in more than a few properties and I must say this one has me stumped. I'm still trying to figure out why this resort misses and can only put it down to poor management. The feeling of hospitality and service was definately lacking to a great extent. Part of it was due to inexperience and lack of training, part of it was due to the unfriendly demeanor of a few employees. Having said that, it may be that the staff's attitude is a defensive response to the boorish behavior of some of the guests particularly at the check-in desk. I agree with previous comments that your experience at this property will be greatly enhanced by your room assignment and that seemed to be a problem with quite a few people during our stay. If you're paying Priceline prices it's not so bad, but if you're paying rack rates it can be a big disappointment. Ask to see a map of the resort when you're checking in and ask questions about the location of your room in relation to parking lots, freeway, etc. Once you get past the room issue the resort can be enjoyable.
