The grounds are nicely kept and the pool area is pleasant. But, as other Trip Advisors have noted, it does not have the ambiance of other four-star resorts. As for Gold/Platinum members...you're on your own at this property. The automatic gracious welcome you're accustomed to is definately lacking here.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got this deal on hotwire and would never pay the going rate for this place, which was 279.00/night plus tax. We checked in Memorial Day weekend and the place did not seem too busy. When it was time to check in, they said that our room wasn't ready and asked us to wait 10-15 minutes. We waited and checked back with the front desk 15 minutes later and they said that our room still wasn't ready, and after we showed some fustration the supervisor put us in another guestroom. He forgot to change the number of our new room and we had to return to the front desk after unloading our baggage to the incorrect room and all. He gave us "complimentary" continental breakfast vouchers for our troubles, but when we used them for the continental breakfast, the waitress explained that it was only a 14 dollar credit per voucher...even though it says "complimentary" on the voucher. The continental breakfast came up to 18 bucks per person including tax, but I would not even pay the difference for this breakfast. The selection was very limited and the food was not that great. It was a good thing that we had a car, cause we mainly ate elsewhere. Speaking of car, parking is 14 dollars per night and there is no overnight street parking, so you are forced to park in the hotel's lot. Parking is rarely enforced, if at all, and I doubt they will tow any car parked in their lot, because the repercussion from the customer will outweigh the act of towing the car (if that makes any sense). I was never given a parking permit to display on my dashboard even though I checked "self-parking" during check-in, and my car survived through the weekend (and my credit card has not been charged). The room was nice. We did not stay in the tower that people here have been talking about. There was no moldy smell. The beds were nice and comfortable. The bathrooms were large. The noise from neighbors were not noticeable, aside from the shutting of the doors. I think there is a fee for the gym and the business center, though we did not check. The pool was alright. I think people preferred the pool to the bay when it came to swimming and laying out. The bay water seemed too dirty. I think the hotel charges for "housekeeping" gratuity, so we did not tip the maids at the end of our stay. Check-out was hassle-free, like most hotels, but the front desk did not ask if we enjoyed our stay and such. She just said, "You're all set". This place is definitely a 3.5 star hotel in my opinion, not 4. P.S.-They will charge you an arm and a leg for any extras, so bring your own snacks and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “3 rooms later....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't get off on the right foot with this hotel. I will say firstly that it's in a great location, central to Mission Bay, parks, beaches, downtown, Old Town and Sea World. The grounds are nice, well kept, expansive banquet facilities with weddings, 'proms' and business functions going on, a full building dedicated as a spa, great pool featuring 'banana cabana', resturant right on the bay, guest access direct to sandy beach where there's sailboat and jetski rental. Now for the bad - THE ROOMS. We were checked into a room on the bottom floor located as soon as you walked in the tower door, that faced the lobby, valet, and all the busy-ness of a hotel on Friday night. The screen door opened up directly to the driveway to valet, an inferior room that we wondered was maybe the result of being a 'discount purchaser'. You get what you pay for?! The bathroom was tiny and the tub still had hair and stains in it. So we asked for another room and were given a 2nd floor one in another building. When we went to check the 2nd room out, thinking it was on the first floor because our room number started with '1', the hallway on that floor was littered with room service plates, nats and bugs flying around them, and the smell of sweet-dampness (kind of how bad fruit smells). It was syrup... and fruit... and eggs, pancakes, jam - seen on the many plates outside almost every other room door, that were obviously sitting out from breakfast - at 3pm in the afternoon! Came to find out odd room numbers were on the top floor, made our way up the stairs (no elevator) to our 2nd room. Soon as we opened the door, there was the most terrible PEE and musty smell in this room. We wanted to give it a try anyway (and not be headaches to the front desk), opened windows and turned on the ceiling fan (a plus) but couldn't get rid of the smell. We thought maybe the carpet had been cleaned and not dried properly, but soon found out when we tried to put our kids drinks in the room fridge that it was old, moldy, brown and rusty inside, emanating that old, foul smell. No wonder the room was damp and stinky! We called front desk to complain ... again. And were given a room a few doors down from the second, that was better - new fridge, mildly damp smell (maybe the humidity in San D ). So overall a *decent* stay, but here's the thing - NOT WHAT YOU'D EXPECT OF A 4 STAR by any means. Rooms need a facelift out of their 'floridian retiree' style into something more modern and cheek (beachy can be chic). I guess the only good thing in the rooms - Crabtree & Evelyn bath products. If you don't mind a little 'crustiness' in your room which is made up for in the facilites, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “SKIP THE RESTUARANT. DEFINITELY SKIP THE SPA!”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoHanna
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at this Hilton. I had an excellent rate, so that influences my expectations and opinions of the room and hotel in general. The room was spacious, very comfortable bedding and fine housekeeping services. I chose a room in the Tower because the first room I was offered, which was nearer to the pool, etc., had a strong musty odor. We ate dinner in the restuarant one evening. Although the food is very attractive and artistically presented, everything from the apetizers to the desserts tasted mediocre, at best! Service was slow and inattentive. The whole experience was annoying and over-priced! FORGET THE SO-CALLED SPA! We decided to really splurge and made appointments for massages and pedicures. OUCH! What an extreme disappointment! The facility is absolutely nothing special. There wasn't even a person on-hand to greet us when we arrived. The massages were so-so (Are these therapists trained and licensed?) and the very expensive pedicure was given in an uncomfortable chair. When our services were completed, we were offered the opportunity to sit on the porch which over-looks the tennis courts and the freeway! We spent $400 for these services!!! I'm a teacher, so that's a big chunk of my paycheck wasted on below average treatments. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a great price via Priceline. For about $100/night we were in the tower. Nice, big clean room. Everyone was so courteous from the valet to room service. We were having a hard time getting on the internet because everyone was trying to watch movies, but the hotel said to try again in 30 minutes and they wouldn't charge us for it. We were able to get on the internet AND watch movies after about 10 minutes and it was all free of charge just as promised! So close to Sea World and the bay! Everything was just perfect! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Not great for this family!”
Reviews.Author: Applepiemommy
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my three kids away for a "mommy bonding" weekend, and with some hesitancy after reading these reviews, used Priceline to book a room for two nights. After a great drive down from Los Angeles(laughing and singing and the like) we get to the hotel. We're immediately impressed. Until we get to our room. I booked the room on Priceline, and the staff knew it. Since we didn't pay full price, we got the crappiest room in the 400 room hotel. It was overlooking the parking lot and entrance driveway. Plus, it only had one bed. One bed for 4 people? I called to request a different room and was told there was nothing else available. So I left the kids in the room and went to the front desk. I said in a rather loud voice that I was disappointed that the staff did not recognize that this was a safety issue-- having a toddler and a sliding glass door that opened onto a busy parking lot. I surely hoped that there wouldn't be any accidents, I said loudly. Amazingly enough, they found us another room. Still only one bed, but they sent over a roll away. So, my teenager and I slept in the king and the 6 year old and the 2 year old slept on the roll away. The room was fine except for a few small details. The room smelled like cigarette smoke, but aired out pretty quickly. There was no key to the mini bar (even after I asked for one to be sent up... no one came). The maid forgot to refill the coffee on the second day. The second bathrobe was missing from the room. The towels were really rough, but nice and large. The shampoo and conditioner were FANTASTIC. The room service menu was horrible. It was all "shi shi" food, with NOTHING for the kids. For dinner the first night, the two little kids had to split a $12 Angus burger ("please leave off the garlic aioli sauce and send fries instead of the Herb crusted potato wedges). Oh and a WARNING. Many hotels these days add the gratuity onto the room service already. Then there is a space on the ticket for a tip. Don't tip the server, or else you'll be tipping twice!! Plus a $2.50 room service charge. We ordered a movie on Pay Per View, sat in the jacuzzi (there are three-- one near our building and one two near the pool area.) We swam in the pool (they have a nice kiddie pool as well as a huge main one.) We ran along the beach, played in the garden, sat in the hammocks... Sunday, instead of Sea World (I spent our Sea World money on room service) we went shopping at Seaport Village. It was a blast. Then, lunch at Carl's Jr. ($12 for all of us, thank you!) and headed back to the hotel for more swimming. That night we went out for dinner, and ended up at a strip mall where I had fantastic Indian food and the kids had mac n cheese. Dessert was Cold Stone ice cream! This meal would have cost $50 at the hotel! Monday morning I got up early and went for a walk on the beach and had coffee in the jacuzzi (ALONE) while I read the paper. We packed up and headed out for a last walk around the property. Overall, I'd say it's a beautiful property, but not great for a little weekend getaway. It's more appropriate for a wedding or a meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: yes2travel
Reviews.Content: I think the room you select makes a difference at this Hilton. I was in the Palacio building and my room was fantastic. The 2nd floor balcony was angled to look out towards the water and was very private. You could not see your neighbors on either side. The bed was king sized and very comfy. The carpet appeared to be brand new and there was no "mildew" smell. I was also surprised ot find a HD TV! The room also had a very nice wet bar and an oversized bar refridgerator (for you personal items) in addition to the mini-bar. The bathroom towels appeared to be brand new and I thought very nice. The grounds were lovely and and the pool and hot tub areas excellent. I had breakfast two mornings and although the buffet was a bit pricey at 18$ the items presented were tasty. Extremely close proximity to Old Town. It took me about 5 minutes to drive there for some great Mexican meals. The down side is the parking situation. It is very limited. We were not charged during our 3 nights there, but it took some driving around to find a spot. There were events going on at the hotel (business meetings, a wedding) and those attendees took up many of the self parking slots. I'd suggest that the hotel never charge self parking fees unless they can guarantee a spot for every car. The work out area was nice, but $24 for use of the tennis courts seemed overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked this hotel through an online travel site - basic room for $200+. Then, I decided to give Priceline a try, requested a 4-star hotel in the San Diego Coastal area for $99/night and, lo and behold, I got the Hilton San Diego (same hotel) for half the cost! So, on that note, for $99 a night, this hotel is stellar! For $200+ a night, I would have had a lot of complaints. First off, you really need to request where your room is. I understand that the Tower is not where you want to be and I can see why from my limited experience with the Tower. It is very tall, cold feeling, like an old apartment building. We were placed in a villa that was one story, side by side rooms (others are two-story). The majority of the rooms in our villa block had arcadia doors that opened in the back onto gorgeous green lawns with putting green, hot tub, etc. Our room was flipped so that the arcadia doors were in the front (next to the front door) and the patio (two lounge chairs) sat right on the parking lot. Needless to say, the patio wasn't used and I didn't feel safe opening the curtains for all of the parking lot to be able to look into our room. So beware. The room itself was very small, barely enough room for two double beds. The room had an old motel feel to it, low ceilings, although the beds and furniture was top-quality. Very tight quarters, I can't imagine spending a lot of time in the room. Would request a bigger room option next time (but for $99 who can complain?) Great bay/beach area, lots of fun stuff to rent (jet skis, etc.), pool area is nice but pool was very cold. Great for families that want to plant themselves at the resort and not go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better!”
Reviews.Author: Maui Marine
Reviews.Content: Nice property except that that most rooms are a very long walk from the reception area – do not use valet parking unless you are sleeping in the lobby as all rooms are a long walk back to the valet parking area. There are not central walkways from the rooms back to the hotel lobby area – pool - restaurant. Self parking is $14.00 and they do not enforce who pays and who did not pay, on three nights I came back to the hotel after a long day and could not find anywhere to park as they had special events and the attendees parked in front of the buildings where the guest stay. The beach in front of the hotel is not really an ocean beach but part of the Fiesta Island Bay which was built from sewage sludge dumped by the City of San Diego (Google Fiesta Island San Diego and Sewage) – I’d be very hesitant let my kids play in this water. Also during my walk along the boardwalk I saw several city owned bathrooms that said “Sewer pumping station # ___” - right on the beach area. Pool and spa area here is very nice and stays open late. Beds were not what I expect from a Hilton and I had an ocean front king which should be as good as it gets. Pay a few bucks more and stay at the Hilton Torrey Pines – it’s a much better property just up the road a few miles.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Lindsyb
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was nervous staying at the Hilton San Diego Resort after reading the various posts here, but it was the only Hilton available to use my points on our recent trip so I thought I'd give it a try. Positives - Grounds, Restaurant, Staff Middle of the Road - Room itself Negatives - Convenience I was concerned as the room we were assigned was not a "tower room" which it says to request but I thought we'd check it out and if necessary would ask to be moved. It did have a bit of a mildewy odor but once we opened the curtains and turned on the ceiling fan it was no longer noticable and the view to the water was nice so we decided to stay put. The room itself was clean and comfortable and Hilton Standard I would say - nothing jumped out at me as different then any other Hilton I have stayed at. We really enjoyed walking on the biking / walking path along the water and the hotel grounds themselves were great too. Pool was a bit cold but the hot tub at sunset was just right!! We ate several meals at the restaurant and the service and food were very good. The reason that we ate more meals at the hotel than we normally would is that it is really not in a convenient location to much else besides the biking/walking path and you would need to drive to find other restaurants/shops so thankfully the restaurant was quite good. Lastly, most of my stay was using Hilton points and I'm not sure I would stay again as I feel the price is a bit steep for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice rooms, beds comfortable, location is right next to Mission Bay, but in my opinion not within walking distance to the ocean beach. If your with a family and don't want to venture out, this is a great location. Park nearby, walking trail behind the hotel. I prefer to be near restaurants and the ocean, this is bay front. I booked through hotwire. Tennis courts on site and very large pool with a childrens pool too. Game area for the kids and during the tourist season a childrens program. They rent boats, ski doos, bikes, and other play items right at the hotel. There is a restaurant on site, but a bit pricey. Didn't eat there. Had to drive to another location, since no other eateries within walking distance. Paid $14 to park my car outside of my room. No parking garage. Just another way to get another buck from the consumer.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in late June, 2005. It is important to note there are two buildings to the hotel-the nice Marina building, and then a "step-child" building. Upon checking in at the main building, I was put in the other building, and told they had a free shuttle, or it was a 2 minute walk. Since I was in a hurry, I walked. It was more like 10 minutes, hauling my luggage and hot and sweaty. The first room I was put in was very nice, however the balcony was inhabited by a family of sea gulls and covered in bird mess. The parent birds stood at the window and squawked at me non-stop, apparently trying to protect the baby bird also living on the balcony. I called the front desk and they said "oh, you're in that room...we'll move you right away." Apparently they all know this room is a problem, but still put people in it. The second room was ok; it was a handicap-accessible room and the towels were frayed, the coffee maker burst a leak the first morning and spilled coffee everywhere but in the coffee pot, however the staff did give me a credit for the inconvenience. Second morning my shower drain backed-up (not a bathtub, a walk-in with no boundary on the floor) and dirty water flooded the bathroom floor. I had just gotten out of the shower and needed to get dressed, do my hair, etc. The staff sent someone up and gave me another credit, however I was late to my morning appt. because I could not use the bathroom to get ready! I was transferred to a third room which was fine, but this was only after much complaining on my part. I would only stay at this hotel if you can get a room in the main building as the other building seems to have a lot of problems and is certainly not the top priority of the management.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, the architecture, the location, it was nice! We booked through Hotwire but when we checked in at the hotel, we were upgraded for free to the tower with an awesome ocean, city view and balcony. It was quiet, peaceful and convenient. I got up in the morning to a beautiful ocean view and worked out in their state of the art fitness room. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly rooms unless in tower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Looks great until you enter your room. They smell like mold. The help said they smell all the time. Our first room was really bad. The next one was half as bad. We were ready to leave when they moved us to the Tower (which the woman at the front desk said could not be done). The tower was fine. Beds comfortable, nice view, no smell. Upon checkout they hit us for $30 extra per nite for the tower, something they didn't tell us. Didn't mind paying it, but should have been told up front. The smell seems to be in the first floor rooms throughout the complex. Frankly, they should burn those buildings and rebuild absent what appears to be a ubiquitous mold problem. Food was marginal. Good conscierge. Excellent workout facility, nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “nice resort”
Reviews.Author: winterbrrr
Reviews.Content: Our stay in March 2005 was very nice. We received a room in the tower, but it was not on the side of the freeway. We had a great view of the reception building and parking lot (haha). The room was lovely, clean and quite large. Two double beds and they even comped a roll-away for our 3rd child! It didn't have a fridge, but we just kept our drinks on ice in the bathtub!! The housekeeper was great. For a $1/day tip she gave up more soap and shampoo we could ever use! She even left extra coffee packs and towels. Very friendly lady, she inquired about the children each day and asked if we were having a good time. Actually all the staff we met were very friendly, including receptionists. The pool area is beautiful and the pool is large and deep. It was supposedly heated, but too cold for me. Our kids enjoyed it though. At the time we were there, it was cool and rainy so they only swam once. The beach area is very nice and they offer bike and boat rentals. Quite expensive though. There is a Starbucks in the lobby area which we used, but even those prices were inflated. We did not use the restaurant or room service. Overall the resort was a good experience. The price of $64/night (on priceline) was amazing for such quality. The downside was a parking fee of $14/day. Well, it is a resort after all. We visited Old Town for a day and thoroughly enjoyed it. My husband is not into Mexican food so we didn't eat anything there, which is a shame because a lot of places looked interesting. Touring the old buildings was fun and educational. We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Resort and found it very easy to hop onto the freeway and get to other areas of San Diego. We had a great time in S.D. and hope to return again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you're traveling for business”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First things first, this is a resort adjacent to Sea World so it is designed to extract dollars from carefree (or careless) vacationers. This Hilton is in an isolated area, cut off by the freeway from the rest of San Diego. There's nothing within walking distance. If you want a business-friendly hotel, look elsewhere. Nasty overcharges and high fees are everywhere, from the $14/night parking to the $12/night hi-speed internet (in-room, wired, DSL) to $30+/person for dinner. The resort is a very confusing place to navigate, especially at night. The parking lots are poorly lit and hazardous for cars and pedestrians. I had a Villa room (Villa Triana). No elevator in the Villas. They resemble motel-type buildings. The room itself was quite good, with the usual Hilton comforts and conveniences. Work desk was located away from the door (good). TV reception is bad, even for a hotel (probably to encourage travelers to use the resort). Keep an eye out for the refridgerator in the hidden, second closet. Turn it off if you want a quiet night's sleep. There was some hallway and parking lot noise but it calmed down after 10pm...I visited in October, during the off-season for Sea World, so it's probably worse during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: TahitiGirl
Reviews.Content: We needed a quick getaway since our plans to travel to Cancun were stopped by Hurricane Wilma. This property fit the bill. Check in was smooth and we were upgraded to a full bay view when the staff learned that we were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and that our original trip had been canceled. The room was clean and the bed was heavenly, although after two nights we decided it was just a little too soft for our tastes. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant. We did the buffet one morning, it was awful! The next we ordered off the menu the food was much, much better. My only complaint (and it's a minor one) was that we had to pay for parking, $14 a day seemed a little steep. But that won't stop us from visiting again when we want a quick weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Can't understand all the fuss”
Reviews.Author: MrBacardi5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort in August and I have few complaints. As a Hilton Honors VIP I used points for the stay and were treated as full paying guests and got free breakfast. Some people complained about the value of the hotel but had I not been using points, it was no more expensive than any other major chain. We were upgraded to a garden view room which had a limited view of the bay. Some people complained of mold but our room was fine. The room was very large and comfortable, especially the beds. It was extremely quiet except for an occasional flushing from the room next door. We got there early and our room wasn't ready but were given pool keys immediately. The pool was large but it was an irregular shape and got deep very fast, therefore at peak times it was a bit crowded at one end. There was a cabana at the pool that was open for lunch and drinks in the afternoon. The prices at the cabana were a little high but the portions were large and they gave free refills on the soda all afternoon and with 2 kids that was a big savings. They should have kept it open later in the day during the summer. I agree the $14/day parking charge was a bit excessive but it wasn't anything I didn't know about in advance and we never had a problem finding a space. The restaurant was nice and if I had a complaint it would be that it was too nice. Having 2 kids it was a bit fancy and the only other alternative was to get in the car and drive somewhere since the hotel is kind of in the middle of nowhere. It was a good central location if you are going to be there for a week or so. The breakfast buffet was a bit pricey at $15.95 but was very good. In the evening the view of the fireworks from Seaworld were awesome. Each day there were activities for the kids around the pool and one evening they even had a private reception for Hilton Honors members which included free beer, wine & appetizers. The internet in the room is $12/day but there is free wireless in the lobby and pool area. We had one small problem getting a light bulb changed but other than that the service was excellent in all respects from the maid to the concierge and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is Not a Resort. And who rated this as a 4 star anyway?”
Reviews.Author: lealealea
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Priceline and knew we wanted to stay in a 4 star hotel. We bid $100/night and it was taken by the Hilton San Diego Resort. The location was nice bc it was on Mission Bay. Along the drive to the hotel on E. Mission Bay Dr., you can see people barbecuing, flying kites, on their wave runners on the bay, and children playing on the large playgrounds. It was a neat sight to see, especially with the sun shining on the water, making it sparkle! We arrived at the hotel at 2pm to check in. (Check in is actually listed as 4 p.m..) Upon checking in, they asked if I wanted to valet all 4 days I would be there, or if I'd like to self park. The valet parking is $16/day or $14/day to self park. I thought this idea was completely ridiculous! You receive a piece of paper to place on your dashboard to show what dates they are valid from. But... Who really polices this? Parking was very tight and it was nearly impossible to park close by to our building each day. We soon realized people were parking on the street instead. Had we known this, we wouldn't have agreed to the self park upon checking in. Upon checking in, we had no bellhop assist with our luggage, nor offer, even though he was just standing there looking straight at us. Rather than offering to take our bags, he jumps over to another person in line and offers to take their bags, even though I got there first. We have checked in to many 4 and 5 star hotels before and have never received service like this before. Aside from the lazy and unattentive bellhop, service didn't get any better. We requested a room overlooking the bay over the telephone before our trip, and the agent said they'd honor that. Much to our disappointment, the person who checked us in said, "Well, we already have you set up in the room." No big deal. We were on the 1st floor in the building over looking the parking lot. What a view and the noise! Was this not negotiable because I obtained this room through priceline bid? The room was very clean, beds were very well made, and toiletries were stocked every day. Just like in any other hotel, they won't change the towels for clean, new ones, unless you put them on the floor. Towels were so hard and crunchy! For a 4 star hotel, you'd think along with the soft, high thread count sheets, they'd have soft towels. Again, very minor. In the restroom, it had granite countertops, good water pressure, but an ugly sight below the countertop. The front of the counter is actually a faux cabinet door, and is one big piece of wood. It was coming apart and was really ugly. Aside from that, the furniture was pretty basic. The room had a kin size comfortable bed, 2 side tables, a table with a mirror in front of it (which was great when I was doing my hair in the mornings), with a chair, a comfortable arm chair, and dresser drawers with a flat screen tv on it. All in all, we had a great vacation sight seeing, but we're wondering how the heck this hotel has a 4 star rating? This is really not a resort, but just a larger scale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: segraybill
Reviews.Content: We spent the Labor Day weekend at the Hilton and had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful and the property is awesome!! The only drawback is the 14.00 a night for parking. The Beds are soooooo comfortable!!! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the Labor day weekend. This is not exactly a resort but a very good deluxe hotel - wide open spaces, nice pool area, watersports on property, bayside dining with good food at reasonable prices for a deluxe hotel. We had a villa room that was huge and service was second to none. Bathrooms were very clean and beds extremely comfortable. The hotel decor is not ostentatious like some other deluxe hotels, so you stay over there not so much to enjoy the decor but to relax by the bayside and have a little fun around the hotel marina - wave running, kayaking, sailing ..... There is no real beach on the hotel property, just a small strip of sand on the backwaters of the bay. We went to Coronado where you will find a real beach.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not bad”
Reviews.Author: DahliaJordan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort over the 4th of July weekend and thoroughly enjoyed my time. The room was spacious and excellently laid out. Despite having a room right infront of the car park, i was lucky enough to not hear any noise at all. The pool and spa facilities are very good. It is a pity that it is a fair way from downtown San Diego but the nearby beach does compensate for this somewhat. I enjoyed the breakfast but i felt as though it was overpriced for what it was. The staff were friendly and accomodating, all found i felt. In room there are good tea and coffee making facilities with a small area with a sink even dedicated to it. The mini bar was well stocked but as ever pricey.

Reviews.Title: “hilton is worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place and great prices! We booked on priceline and were expecting them to give us a shabby room but we have a view of the bay and the putting green. The room was clean and the shower was way above hotel expectations! The bed was extremely comfortable. We couldn't hear anything from our neighbors and our neighbors said they couldn't hear us. (We were traveling with a newborn and a pre-schooler) The staff was obliging and check out the fireworks!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Hilton San Diego Resort”
Reviews.Author: darsm
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at the Hilton San Diego Resort and thought it was great! The service was excellent, the room was very big and seemed like it had been recently renovated - very clean and comfortable. We got the bounce-back package which included breakfast, which was a great deal, especially since they let us get food for our young daughters from the buffet at no extra charge. They even brought us something special for one of my daughters after the food she wanted wasn't included in the buffet that day. The grounds and pools were also beautiful and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: brooksterann
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Mission Bay - great location - very clean and comfortable rooms (most have been recently renovated). Ours was a "garden villa" - a bit of a walk down to the water, but worth the deal we got on priceline ($89). Very nice beds with feather pillows & comforters - huge bathroom (very clean) and even a small patio with lounge chairs. Lovely public spaces. We liked the pool area best. Service was great too. Parking can be a little tough after dark (and costs $14/nite self-park). Mission Bay is not always the best place to swim, but the sand area in front of the Hilton was clean & well-maintained and they offer boat/bike rentals etc. We didn't eat in the restaurant (it looked very nice) but we did order room service for breakfast and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Will most likely return next year - Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It took us a full day on tripadvisor to find the right hotel. This one seemed to be it, and it didn't disappoint. The bellman was especially freindly and didn't put on any airs, just downright freindly and real. The rooms were nice and clean, medium sized, and the beds were VERY comfy. We're a family of three with a five year old, and the hotel was extremely child-friendly which was a pleasant surprise to us. Whoever said the pool could have been larger must be writing about the wrong hotel. The pool is big and clean and heated nicely. We spent half a day just out by the pool in between days at Sea World and Wild Animal Park. We had a tower room, and even though the balcony faced the freeway, it didn't make all that much difference. Who goes on vacation to sit in their room? With the sliding glass door shut, the noise was nil. I recommend it highly for families, but you might want to check the rates against your schedule. From Sun-Tue we paid $220 a night, and when inquiring about staying another (WED) night, they wanted $370 and wouldn't budge. Take in at least one late dinner at the restaurant and eat on the patio. We got in late the first night and were pleasantly surprised to be able to view the fireworks at SeaWorld at 9:45. It was a great start to a pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “you can do a lot better for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Sam_I_Am_Boise
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel only one star because we paid top dollar for our one-night stay (from priceline.com - where we will never buy again due to this bad experience). We were looking for a 4-star in the SD are close to SeaWorld preferrably. This was the match for us. The room looked dingy and run down. For some reason, coffee makers, irons, mini bars were hidden behind a door, and took some searching. We will never go back here unless we are paying Motel 6 rates for the stay b/c that's what the place felt like. only good thing was that our room faced Mission Bay. but we were not there long enough to enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you like mediocre resorts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 4 star, please! Vacations are supposed to be relaxing, not a battle with the hotel front desk. Being a Hilton Diamond member for the last 15 years and logging 100-150 nights a year in Hiltons I think I know how a hotel should operate; this one is mediocre at best. Problems? Oh yes, many. The front desk is abysmal, including Vince the assistant manager; basically young kids working it who don't have a clue how to deal with customers and just spout the company line when faced with an issue. I'm still waiting for my call from Jennifer the general manager; obviously that won't happen. My family and I were first put in a moldy smelling handicapped room by the "water". The front desk's response to my comments regarding the smell got me a "we can spray the room if needed". (Don't bother with the bay front rooms since it's nothing more than a big mud hole). We were moved to a garden room which was better but not that great. I had to call each day for the two small bottles of water coming to me each day and the keys to our room worked maybe 20% of the time. I do agree with the other reviews that the Kids Club and the restaurant were very good. Mike the concierge was on his game but the others were much to be desired. Bottom line: if you don't expect too much from a hotel, have kids and don't pay more than $79 a night then this might be the hotel for you. There are others in the area that are better.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Diamond member --enjoyed the stay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a Diamond level Hilton Honors member, I certainly have expectations for staying at a "resort" hotel. My wife and two sons (16 & 20) vacationed over the Memorial Holiday week and we really enjoyed ourselves. POOL - Nice and warm, but could have been a little larger. HOT TUB - A little too small, as well. Also wound up needing renovation while we were there--so it was out of commission. FOOD - onsite restaurant food was good, but we enjoyed eating at other spots for lunch and dinner. However, we enjoyed the breakfasts. WATER SPORTS - you can rent bikes, sailboats, paddle craft and jet-ski's. The price of the jet-ski's at $90/hr was a turnoff to my son's. Too pricey. We wound up taking the ferry to Coronado Island, rented bikes there, and rode around the island for several hours---GREAT TIME!! ACCOMODATIONS - We were scheduled to stay in the Tower, but after reading a previous TripAdvisor review, I chose to ask for a "garden villa" on the ground floor when I checked in. The staff were very courteous and accomodated my request. This was REALLY nice--being able to step out of the room onto the well manicured grounds. I'm really glad I did this. The room smelled a bit "musty", but it wasn't unpleasant. The beds were REALLY comfortable and we all slept well the 5 nights we were there. OVERALL - I would rate this hotel a 7 out of 10, all things considered. If I was going to return to this area, however, I might be inclined to try another hotel--more for comparison reasons than anything else. My "benchmark" for Hilton "resort" hotels is Hawaii (Oahau, Big Island). Those are all 9-10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “very good place to stay with family but few mark downs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we had booked and paid for 2 rooms in advance but once we got there manager didn't want to give us two rooms next to eachother so with small kids we had to seperate from our friends one in the tower one by the pool for the same price!!!!! this was not good at all we had to constantly go up get kids stuff if we forgot something and finally we ended up crashing the day in our friend's room the manager did not work with us we tried hard and it was not a positive point for hilton the rest of hotel was great

Reviews.Title: “Always a fan of the Hilton San Diego Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort numerous times since I was a teenager. Now when I come home from college, which is in cold New England, the Hilton San Diego Resort is where I want to go. It is perfect for families on vacation, friends on a weekend road trip, or couples looking for a romantic getaway. The rooms range from traditional hotel style to cabana mini-homes. All rooms are well equipped and within walking distance of the hotel's private beach. The restaurant is absolutely phenomenal. I highly recommend the breakfast buffet as well as the dinner buffet. The restaurant provides the best seat in the house to watch the fireworks set off at Sea World (which is right across the bay) during summer. The hotel provides endless amentities: tennis courts, water sports, bike and skate rentals, pools, an amazing spa, and a great stretch of beach. The great thing about the Resort is that you don't need to even the grounds of the hotel to have fun! My boyfriend and I spent an entire just exploring the grounds and soaking in the sun. Very relaxing! The Resort is a bit pricey, but the staff will completely take care of you. We've never had a problem with them, not even when we brought our dog with us (yep, they takes pets too!!). I've stayed in plenty of hotels in San Diego on vacations and weekend getaways, but the Hilton San Diego Resort is by far the best!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 1775 East Mission Bay Drive, San Diego, CA 92109
